So far as climate goes , it was immaterial what time [we]749-we chose for [our]749-we expedition , as the temperature ranges from seventy - five to ninety degrees both summer and winter , with no appreciable difference in heat . In moisture , however , it is otherwise ; from December to May is the period of the rains , and during this time [the river]2530-the river slowly rises until it attains a height of nearly forty feet above [its]2530-the river low - water mark . [It]2530-the river floods [the banks]752-the banks , extends in great lagoons over [a monstrous waste of country]753-a monstrous waste of country , and forms a huge district , called locally [the Gapo]69-the gapo , which is for the most part too marshy for foot - travel and too shallow for boating . About June the waters begin to fall , and are at their lowest at October or November . Thus [our]749-we expedition was at the time of the dry season , when [the great river]754-the great river and [its]754-the great river tributaries were more or less in a normal condition .

The current of [the river]2530-the river is a slight one , the drop being not greater than eight inches in a mile . [No stream]756-no stream could be more convenient for navigation , since the prevailing wind is south - east , and [sailing boats]757-sailing boats may make a continuous progress to [the Peruvian frontier]758-the peruvian frontier , dropping down again with the current . In [our]749-we own case [the excellent engines of [the Esmeralda]70-the esmeralda]759-the excellent engines of the esmeralda could disregard the sluggish flow of [the stream]760-the stream , and [we]749-we made as rapid progress as if [we]749-we were navigating [a stagnant lake]761-a stagnant lake . For three days [we]749-we steamed north - westwards up [a stream]762-a stream which even here , a thousand miles from [its]754-the great river mouth , was still so enormous that from [its]754-the great river center [the two banks]763-the two banks were mere shadows upon the distant skyline . On the fourth day after leaving [Manaos]52-manaos [we]749-we turned into [a tributary]764-a tributary which at [its]754-the great river mouth was little smaller than [the main stream]765-the main stream . [It]764-a tributary narrowed rapidly , however , and after two more days ' steaming [we]749-we reached [an Indian village]766-an indian village , where [the Professor]2374-the professor insisted that [we]749-we should land , and that [the Esmeralda]70-the esmeralda should be sent back to [Manaos]52-manaos . [We]749-we should soon come upon [rapids]768-rapids , [he]2374-the professor explained , which would make its further use impossible . [He]2374-the professor added privately that [we]749-we were now approaching [the door of [the unknown country]770-the unknown country]769-the door of the unknown country , and that the fewer whom [we]749-we took into [our]749-we confidence the better it would be . To this end also [he]2374-the professor made each of [us]749-we give [our]749-we word of honor that [we]749-we would publish or say nothing which would give any exact clue as to the whereabouts of [our]749-we travels , while [the servants]771-the servants were [all solemnly sworn to the same effect]772-all solemnly sworn to the same effect . It is for this reason that [I]0-i am compelled to be vague in [my]0-i narrative , and [I]0-i would warn [[my]0-i readers]773-my readers that in any map or diagram which [I]0-i may give the relation of places to each other may be correct , but the points of the compass are carefully confused , so that in no way can it be taken as an actual guide to [the country]2801-the country . [Professor Challenger]142-challenger 's reasons for secrecy may be valid or not , but [we]749-we had no choice but to adopt them , for [he]2374-the professor was prepared to abandon the whole expedition rather than modify the conditions upon which [he]2374-the professor would guide [us]749-we .

It was August 2nd when [we]749-we snapped [our]749-we last link with [the outer world]775-the outer world by bidding farewell to [the Esmeralda]70-the esmeralda . Since then four days have passed , during which [we]749-we have engaged two large canoes from [the Indians]162-cucama indians , made of so light a material skins over a bamboo framework that [we]749-we should be able to carry [them]776-them round any obstacle . These [we]749-we have loaded with all [our]749-we effects , and have engaged [two additional Indians]777-two additional indians to help [us]749-we in the navigation . [I]0-i understand that [they]777-two additional indians are the very two - [Ataca]201-ataca and [Ipetu]202-ipetu by name - who accompanied [Professor Challenger]142-challenger upon [his]142-challenger previous journey . [They]777-two additional indians appeared to be terrified at the prospect of repeating it , but [the chief]2532-the chief has patriarchal powers in [these countries]779-these countries , and if the bargain is good in [his]2532-the chief eyes [the clansman]780-the clansman has little choice in the matter .

So to - morrow [we]749-we disappear into [the unknown]781-the unknown . This account [I]0-i am transmitting down [the river]2530-the river by [canoe]783-canoe , and it may be [our]749-we last word to those who are interested in [our]749-we fate . [I]0-i have , according to [our]749-we arrangement , addressed it to [you]784-you , [[my]0-i dear]2487-my dear [Mr. McArdle]143-mcardle , and [I]0-i leave it to [your]784-you discretion to delete , alter , or do what [you]784-you like with it . From the assurance of [Professor Challenger]142-challenger 's manner - and in spite of the continued scepticism of [Professor Summerlee]182-summerlee - [I]0-i have no doubt that [[our]749-we leader]786-our leader will make good [his]786-our leader statement , and that [we]749-we are really on the eve of some most remarkable experiences .

CHAPTER VIII

" [The Outlying Pickets of [the New World]71-the new world]2842-the outlying pickets of the new world "[786-our leader]

[[Our]749-we friends at [home]2831-home]787-our friends at home may well rejoice with [us]749-we , for [we]749-we are at [our]749-we goal , and up to a point , at least , [we]749-we have shown that the statement of [Professor Challenger]142-challenger can be verified . [We]749-we have not , it is true , ascended [the plateau]789-the plateau , but it lies before [us]749-we , and even [Professor Summerlee]182-summerlee is in a more chastened mood . Not that [he]182-summerlee will for an instant admit that [[his]182-summerlee rival]790-his rival could be right , but [he]182-summerlee is less persistent in [his]182-summerlee incessant objections , and has sunk for the most part into an observant silence . [I]0-i must hark back , however , and continue [my]0-i narrative from where [I]0-i dropped it . [We]749-we are sending home [one of [[our]749-we local Indians]792-our local indians who is injured , and [I]0-i am committing this letter to [[his]182-summerlee charge]793-his charge]791-one of our local indians who is injured , and i am committing this letter to his charge , with considerable doubts in [my]0-i mind as to whether it will ever come to hand .

When [I]0-i wrote last [we]749-we were about to leave [the Indian village]794-the indian village where [we]749-we had been deposited by [the Esmeralda]70-the esmeralda . [I]0-i have to begin [my]0-i report by bad news , for the first serious personal trouble [I]0-i pass over the incessant bickerings between [the Professors]795-the professors occurred this evening , and might have had a tragic ending . [I]0-i have spoken of [[our]749-we English - speaking half - breed]796-our english - speaking half - breed , [Gomez]196-gomez - [a fine worker]797-a fine worker and [a willing fellow]798-a willing fellow , but afflicted , [I]0-i fancy , with the vice of curiosity , which is common enough among [such men]2337-such men . On the last evening [he]196-gomez seems to have hid [himself]196-gomez near [the hut in which [we]749-we were discussing [our]749-we plans]800-the hut in which we were discussing our plans , and , being observed by [[our]749-we huge negro [Zambo]195-zambo , who is as faithful as a dog and has the hatred which all [his]195-zambo race]801-our huge negro zambo , who is as faithful as a dog and has the hatred which all his race bear to [the half - breeds]802-the half - breeds , [he]195-zambo was dragged out and carried into [our]749-we presence . [Gomez]196-gomez whipped out [his]196-gomez knife , however , and but for the huge strength of [[his]196-gomez captor]803-his captor , which enabled [him]196-gomez to disarm [him]803-his captor with one hand , [he]196-gomez would certainly have stabbed [him]803-his captor . The matter has ended in reprimands , [the opponents]804-the opponents have been compelled to shake hands , and there is every hope that all will be well . As to the feuds of [the two learned men]805-the two learned men , [they]805-the two learned men are continuous and bitter . It must be admitted that [Challenger]142-challenger is provocative in the last degree , but [Summerlee]182-summerlee has an acid tongue , which makes matters worse . Last night [Challenger]142-challenger said that [he]142-challenger never cared to walk on the [Thames Embankment]72-thames embankment and look up [the river]2530-the river , as it was always sad to see [one]2316-one 's own eventual goal . [He]142-challenger is convinced , of course , that [he]142-challenger is destined for [Westminster Abbey]73-westminster abbey . [Summerlee]182-summerlee rejoined , however , with a sour smile , by saying that [he]182-summerlee understood that [Millbank Prison]74-millbank prison had been pulled down . [Challenger]142-challenger 's conceit is too colossal to allow [him]142-challenger to be really annoyed . [He]142-challenger only smiled in [his]142-challenger beard and repeated " Really ! Really ! "[142-challenger] in the pitying tone [one]2316-one would use to [a child]809-a child . Indeed , [they]810-they are [children]2683-children both - [the one wizened and cantankerous]812-the one wizened and cantankerous , the other formidable and overbearing , yet each with a brain which has put [him]142-challenger in the front rank of [his]142-challenger scientific age . Brain , character , soul - only as one sees more of life does [one]2316-one understand how distinct is each .

The very next day [we]814-we did actually make [our]814-we start upon this remarkable expedition . [We]814-we found that all [our]814-we possessions fitted very easily into the two canoes , and [we]814-we divided [[our]814-we personnel]815-our personnel , six in each , taking the obvious precaution in the interests of peace of putting [one Professor]816-one professor into [each canoe]817-each canoe . Personally , [I]0-i was with [Challenger]142-challenger , who was in a beatific humor , moving about as one in a silent ecstasy and beaming benevolence from every feature . [I]0-i have had some experience of [him]142-challenger in other moods , however , and shall be the less surprised when the thunderstorms suddenly come up amidst the sunshine . If it is impossible to be at [your]818-your ease , it is equally impossible to be dull in [his]142-challenger company , for one is always in a state of half - tremulous doubt as to what sudden turn [his]142-challenger formidable temper may take .

For two days [we]814-we made [our]814-we way up [a good - sized river some hundreds of yards broad]819-a good - sized river some hundreds of yards broad , and dark in color , but transparent , so that [one]2316-one could usually see the bottom . [The affluents of [the Amazon]24-the amazon]821-the affluents of the amazon are , half of them , of this nature , while the other half are whitish and opaque , the difference depending upon [the class of country through which [they]821-the affluents of the amazon have flowed]822-the class of country through which they have flowed . The dark indicate vegetable decay , while the others point to clayey soil . Twice [we]814-we came across [rapids]768-rapids , and in each case made a portage of half a mile or so to avoid [them]768-rapids . [The woods on either side]824-the woods on either side were primeval , which are more easily penetrated than woods of [the second growth]825-the second growth , and [we]814-we had no great difficulty in carrying [[our]814-we canoes]826-our canoes through [them]824-the woods on either side . How shall [I]0-i ever forget the solemn mystery of it ? The height of the trees and the thickness of the boles exceeded anything which [I]0-i in [my]0-i town - bred life could have imagined , shooting upwards in magnificent columns until , at an enormous distance above [our]814-we heads , [we]814-we could dimly discern the spot where [they]827-they threw out [their]827-they side - branches into Gothic upward curves which coalesced to form one great matted roof of verdure , through which only an occasional golden ray of sunshine shot downwards to trace a thin dazzling line of light amidst the majestic obscurity . As [we]814-we walked noiselessly amid [the thick , soft carpet of decaying vegetation]828-the thick , soft carpet of decaying vegetation the hush fell upon [our]814-we souls which comes upon [us]814-we in the twilight of [the Abbey]75-the abbey , and even [Professor Challenger]142-challenger 's full - chested notes sank into a whisper . Alone , [I]0-i should have been ignorant of the names of these giant growths , but [[our]814-we men of science]829-our men of science pointed out the cedars , the great silk cotton trees , and the redwood trees , with all that profusion of various plants which has made this continent the chief supplier to [the human race]411-the human race of those gifts of Nature which depend upon [the vegetable world]831-the vegetable world , while it is the most backward in those products which come from animal life . Vivid orchids and wonderful colored lichens smoldered upon [the swarthy tree - trunks and where a wandering shaft of light fell full upon the golden allamanda]832-the swarthy tree - trunks and where a wandering shaft of light fell full upon the golden allamanda , the scarlet star - clusters of the tacsonia , or the rich deep blue of ipomaea , the effect was as a dream of fairyland . In [these great wastes of forest]833-these great wastes of forest , life , which abhors darkness , struggles ever upwards to the light . Every plant , even the smaller ones , curls and writhes to the green surface , twining itself round its stronger and taller brethren in the effort . Climbing plants are monstrous and luxuriant , but others which have never been known to climb elsewhere learn the art as an escape from that somber shadow , so that the common nettle , the jasmine , and even the jacitara palm tree can be seen circling the stems of the cedars and striving to reach their crowns . Of animal life there was no movement amid the majestic vaulted aisles which stretched from [us]814-we as [we]814-we walked , but a constant movement far above [our]814-we heads told of that multitudinous world of snake and monkey , bird and sloth , which lived in the sunshine , and looked down in wonder at [[our]814-we tiny , dark , stumbling figures in the obscure depths immeasurably below [them]827-they]834-our tiny , dark , stumbling figures in the obscure depths immeasurably below them . At dawn and at sunset [the howler monkeys]835-the howler monkeys screamed together and the parrakeets broke into shrill chatter , but during the hot hours of the day only the full drone of insects , like the beat of a distant surf , filled the ear , while nothing moved amid the solemn vistas of stupendous trunks , fading away into the darkness which held [us]814-we in . Once [some bandy - legged , lurching creature]836-some bandy - legged , lurching creature , [an ant - eater or a bear]837-an ant - eater or a bear , scuttled clumsily amid the shadows . It was the only sign of earth life which [I]0-i saw in [this great Amazonian forest]838-this great amazonian forest .

And yet there were indications that even human life itself was not far from [us]814-we in [those mysterious recesses]839-those mysterious recesses . On the third day out [we]814-we were aware of a singular deep throbbing in the air , rhythmic and solemn , coming and going fitfully throughout the morning . [The two boats]840-the two boats were paddling within a few yards of [each other]2795-each other when first [we]814-we heard it , and [[our]814-we Indians]842-our indians remained motionless , as if [they]842-our indians had been turned to bronze , listening intently with expressions of terror upon [their]842-our indians faces .

" What is it , then ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Drums , "[181-lord john] said [Lord John]181-lord john , carelessly ; " war drums . [I]181-lord john have heard [them]2843-them before . "[181-lord john]

" Yes , [sir]2355-sir , war drums , "[196-gomez] said [Gomez]196-gomez , [the half - breed]843-the half - breed . " [Wild Indians]204-the indians , [bravos]2845-bravos , [not mansos]2846-not mansos ; [they]204-the indians watch [us]814-we every mile of the way ; kill [us]814-we if [they]204-the indians can . "[196-gomez]

" How can [they]204-the indians watch [us]814-we ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , gazing into [the dark , motionless void]844-the dark , motionless void .

[The half - breed]843-the half - breed shrugged [his]843-the half - breed broad shoulders .

" [The Indians]204-the indians know . [They]204-the indians have [their]204-the indians own way . [They]204-the indians watch [us]814-we . [They]204-the indians talk the drum talk to [each other]2795-each other . Kill [us]814-we if [they]204-the indians can . "[843-the half - breed]

By the afternoon of that day - [my]0-i pocket diary shows [me]0-i that it was Tuesday , August 18th - at least six or seven drums were throbbing from various points . Sometimes [they]846-they beat quickly , sometimes slowly , sometimes in obvious question and answer , one far to the east breaking out in a high staccato rattle , and being followed after a pause by a deep roll from [the north]711-the north . There was something indescribably nerve - shaking and menacing in that constant mutter , which seemed to shape itself into the very syllables of [the half - breed]843-the half - breed , endlessly repeated , " [We]814-we will kill [you]2848-you if [we]814-we can . [We]814-we will kill [you]2848-you if [we]814-we can . "[843-the half - breed] [No one]2652-no one ever moved in [the silent woods]850-the silent woods . All the peace and soothing of quiet Nature lay in that dark curtain of vegetation , but away from behind there came ever the one message from [[our]851-our fellow - man]852-our fellow - man . " [We]814-we will kill [you]2848-you if [we]814-we can , "[853-the men in the east] said [the men in the east]853-the men in the east . " [We]814-we will kill [you]2848-you if [we]814-we can , "[854-the men in the north] said [the men in [the north]711-the north]854-the men in the north .

All day the drums rumbled and whispered , while [their]856-their menace reflected itself in the faces of [[our]851-our colored companions]857-our colored companions . Even [the hardy , swaggering half - breed]858-the hardy , swaggering half - breed seemed cowed . [I]0-i learned , however , that day once for all that both [Summerlee]182-summerlee and [Challenger]142-challenger possessed that highest type of bravery , the bravery of the scientific mind . [Theirs]859-theirs was the spirit which upheld [Darwin]154-darwin among [the gauchos of the Argentine]860-the gauchos of the argentine or [Wallace]160-wallace among [the head - hunters of [Malaya]76-malaya]861-the head - hunters of malaya . It is decreed by a merciful Nature that the human brain can not think of two things simultaneously , so that if it be steeped in curiosity as to science it has no room for merely personal considerations . All day amid that incessant and mysterious menace [[our]851-our two Professors]862-our two professors watched every bird upon the wing , and every shrub upon [the bank]863-the bank , with many a sharp wordy contention , when the snarl of [Summerlee]182-summerlee came quick upon the deep growl of [Challenger]142-challenger , but with no more sense of danger and no more reference to drum - beating [Indians]204-the indians than if [they]204-the indians were seated together in [the smoking - room of [the Royal Society]865-the royal society 's Club in [St. James 's Street]77-st. james 's street]864-the smoking - room of the royal society 's club in st. james 's street . Once only did [they]862-our two professors condescend to discuss [them]204-the indians .

" [Miranha]205-miranha or [Amajuaca cannibals]2849-amajuaca cannibals , "[142-challenger] said [Challenger]142-challenger , jerking [his]142-challenger thumb towards the reverberating wood .

" No doubt , [sir]2355-sir , "[182-summerlee] [Summerlee]182-summerlee answered . " Like all such tribes , [I]182-summerlee shall expect to find [them]204-the indians of poly - synthetic speech and of Mongolian type . "[182-summerlee]

" Polysynthetic certainly , "[142-challenger] said [Challenger]142-challenger , indulgently . " [I]142-challenger am not aware that any other type of language exists in [this continent]2851-this continent , and [I]142-challenger have notes of more than a hundred . The Mongolian theory [I]142-challenger regard with deep suspicion . "[142-challenger]

" [I]182-summerlee should have thought that even a limited knowledge of comparative anatomy would have helped to verify it , "[182-summerlee] said [Summerlee]182-summerlee , bitterly .

[Challenger]142-challenger thrust out [his]142-challenger aggressive chin until [he]142-challenger was all beard and hat - rim . " No doubt , [sir]2355-sir , a limited knowledge would have that effect . When [one]2316-one 's knowledge is exhaustive , [one]2316-one comes to other conclusions . "[142-challenger] [They]866-they glared at [each other]2795-each other in mutual defiance , while all round rose the distant whisper , " [We]868-we will kill [you]2355-sir - [we]868-we will kill [you]2355-sir if [we]868-we can . "[142-challenger]

That night [we]868-we moored [[our]868-we canoes]826-our canoes with heavy stones for anchors in [the center of [the stream]760-the stream]870-the center of the stream , and made every preparation for a possible attack . Nothing came , however , and with the dawn [we]868-we pushed upon [our]868-we way , the drum - beating dying out behind [us]868-we . About three o'clock in the afternoon [we]868-we came to a very steep rapid , more than a mile long - [the very one in which [Professor Challenger]142-challenger had suffered disaster upon [his]142-challenger first journey]872-the very one in which professor challenger had suffered disaster upon his first journey . [I]0-i confess that the sight of it consoled [me]0-i , for it was really the first direct corroboration , slight as it was , of the truth of [his]142-challenger story . [The Indians]204-the indians carried first [[our]868-we canoes]826-our canoes and then [our]868-we stores through the brushwood , which is very thick at this point , while [[we]868-we four whites , [our]868-we rifles on [our]868-we shoulders]874-we four whites , our rifles on our shoulders , walked between [them]204-the indians and any danger coming from [the woods]2543-the woods . Before evening [we]868-we had successfully passed [the rapids]2595-the rapids , and made [our]868-we way some ten miles above [them]2595-the rapids , where [we]868-we anchored for the night . At this point [I]0-i reckoned that [we]868-we had come not less than a hundred miles up [the tributary]877-the tributary from [the main stream]765-the main stream .

It was in the early forenoon of the next day that [we]868-we made the great departure . Since dawn [Professor Challenger]142-challenger had been acutely uneasy , continually scanning [each bank of [the river]2530-the river]879-each bank of the river . Suddenly [he]142-challenger gave an exclamation of satisfaction and pointed to a single tree , which projected at a peculiar angle over the side of [the stream]760-the stream .

" What do [you]182-summerlee make of that ? "[142-challenger] [he]142-challenger asked .

" It is surely an Assai palm , "[182-summerlee] said [Summerlee]182-summerlee .

" Exactly . It was an Assai palm which [I]142-challenger took for [[my]142-challenger landmark]2855-my landmark . The secret opening is half a mile onwards upon [the other side of [the river]2530-the river]2856-the other side of the river . There is no break in the trees . That is the wonder and the mystery of it . There where [you]2858-you see light - green rushes instead of dark - green undergrowth , there between the great cotton woods , that is [[my]142-challenger private gate into [the unknown]781-the unknown]2859-my private gate into the unknown . Push through , and [you]2858-you will understand . "[142-challenger]

It was indeed [a wonderful place]882-a wonderful place . Having reached the spot marked by a line of light - green rushes , [we]868-we poled out two canoes through them for some hundreds of yards , and eventually emerged into [a placid and shallow stream , running clear and transparent over a sandy bottom]883-a placid and shallow stream , running clear and transparent over a sandy bottom . [It]760-the stream may have been twenty yards across , and was banked in on each side by most luxuriant vegetation . [No one who had not observed that for a short distance reeds had taken the place of shrubs]884-no one who had not observed that for a short distance reeds had taken the place of shrubs , could possibly have guessed the existence of [such a stream]885-such a stream or dreamed of [the fairyland beyond]886-the fairyland beyond .

For [a fairyland]887-a fairyland [it]887-a fairyland was - the most wonderful that the imagination of [man]2341-man could conceive . The thick vegetation met overhead , interlacing into a natural pergola , and through [this tunnel of verdure]889-this tunnel of verdure in a golden twilight flowed [the green , pellucid river]890-the green , pellucid river , beautiful in itself , but marvelous from the strange tints thrown by the vivid light from above filtered and tempered in its fall . Clear as crystal , motionless as a sheet of glass , green as the edge of an iceberg , it stretched in front of [us]868-we under [its]890-the green , pellucid river leafy archway , every stroke of [our]868-we paddles sending a thousand ripples across [its]890-the green , pellucid river shining surface . [It]890-the green , pellucid river was [a fitting avenue to [a land of wonders]892-a land of wonders]891-a fitting avenue to a land of wonders . All sign of [the Indians]893-the indians had passed away , but animal life was more frequent , and the tameness of the creatures showed that [they]893-the indians knew nothing of [the hunter]894-the hunter . Fuzzy little black - velvet monkeys , with snow - white teeth and gleaming , mocking eyes , chattered at [us]868-we as [we]868-we passed . With a dull , heavy splash an occasional cayman plunged in from [the bank]863-the bank . Once [a dark , clumsy tapir]896-a dark , clumsy tapir stared at [us]868-we from a gap in the bushes , and then lumbered away through [the forest]897-the forest ; once , too , the yellow , sinuous form of a great puma whisked amid the brushwood , and its green , baleful eyes glared hatred at [us]868-we over its tawny shoulder . Bird life was abundant , especially the wading birds , stork , heron , and ibis gathering in little groups , blue , scarlet , and white , upon every log which jutted from the bank , while beneath [us]868-we the crystal water was alive with fish of every shape and color .

For three days [we]868-we made [our]868-we way up [this tunnel of hazy green sunshine]898-this tunnel of hazy green sunshine . On [the longer stretches]899-the longer stretches [one]2316-one could hardly tell as [one]2316-one looked ahead where [the distant green water]902-the distant green water ended and [the distant green archway]903-the distant green archway began . The deep peace of [this strange waterway]904-this strange waterway was unbroken by any sign of [man]2341-man .

" [No Indian]2536-no indian [here]2484-here . Too much afraid . [Curupuri]168-curupuri , "[196-gomez] said [Gomez]196-gomez .

" [Curupuri]168-curupuri is the spirit of [the woods]2543-the woods , "[181-lord john] [Lord John]181-lord john explained . " It 's a name for any kind of devil . [The poor beggars]2864-the poor beggars think that there is something fearsome in this direction , and therefore [they]2864-the poor beggars avoid it . "[181-lord john]

On the third day it became evident that [our]868-we journey in [the canoes]906-the canoes could not last much longer , for [the stream]760-the stream was rapidly growing more shallow . Twice in as many hours [we]868-we stuck upon the bottom . Finally [we]868-we pulled [the boats]908-the boats up among the brushwood and spent the night on [the bank of [the river]2530-the river]909-the bank of the river . In the morning [Lord John]181-lord john and [I]0-i made [our]868-we way for a couple of miles through [the forest]897-the forest , keeping parallel with [the stream]760-the stream ; but as it grew ever shallower [we]868-we returned and reported , what [Professor Challenger]142-challenger had already suspected , that [we]868-we had reached [the highest point to which the canoes]913-the highest point to which the canoes could be brought . [We]868-we drew them up , therefore , and concealed them among the bushes , blazing a tree with [our]868-we axes , so that [we]868-we should find [them]906-the canoes again . Then [we]868-we distributed the various burdens among [us]868-we - guns , ammunition , food , a tent , blankets , and the rest - and , shouldering [our]868-we packages , [we]868-we set forth upon the more laborious stage of [our]868-we journey .

An unfortunate quarrel between [our]868-we pepper - pots marked the outset of [our]868-we new stage . [Challenger]142-challenger had from the moment of joining [us]868-we issued directions to [the whole party]914-the whole party , much to the evident discontent of [Summerlee]182-summerlee . Now , upon [his]142-challenger assigning some duty to [[his]142-challenger fellow - Professor]915-his fellow - professor it was only the carrying of an aneroid barometer , the matter suddenly came to a head .

" May [I]182-summerlee ask , [sir]2355-sir , "[182-summerlee] said [Summerlee]182-summerlee , with vicious calm , " in what capacity [you]2355-sir take it upon [yourself]2355-sir to issue these orders ? "[182-summerlee]

[Challenger]142-challenger glared and bristled .

" [I]182-summerlee do it , [Professor Summerlee]182-summerlee , as [leader of this expedition]2866-leader of this expedition . "[182-summerlee]

" [I]182-summerlee am compelled to tell [you]2355-sir , [sir]2355-sir , that [I]182-summerlee do not recognize [you]2355-sir in that capacity . "[182-summerlee]

" Indeed ! "[142-challenger] [Challenger]142-challenger bowed with unwieldy sarcasm . " Perhaps [you]182-summerlee would define [my]142-challenger exact position . "[142-challenger]

" Yes , [sir]2355-sir . [You]2355-sir are [a man whose veracity is upon trial]2869-a man whose veracity is upon trial , and [this committee]2870-this committee is here to try it . [You]2355-sir walk , [sir]2355-sir , with [[your]2355-sir judges]2872-your judges . "[182-summerlee]

" Dear [me]142-challenger ! "[142-challenger] said [Challenger]142-challenger , seating [himself]142-challenger on the side of one of [the canoes]906-the canoes . " In that case [you]2355-sir will , of course , go on [your]2355-sir way , and [I]142-challenger will follow at [my]142-challenger leisure . If [I]142-challenger am not the leader [you]2355-sir can not expect [me]142-challenger to lead . "[142-challenger]

Thank heaven that there were [two sane men]917-two sane men - [Lord John Roxton]181-lord john and [myself]0-i - to prevent the petulance and folly of [[our]918-we learned Professors]919-our learned professors from sending [us]918-we back empty - handed to [London]22-london . Such arguing and pleading and explaining before [we]918-we could get [them]917-two sane men mollified ! Then at last [Summerlee]182-summerlee , with [his]182-summerlee sneer and [his]182-summerlee pipe , would move forwards , and [Challenger]142-challenger would come rolling and grumbling after . By some good fortune [we]918-we discovered about this time that both [[our]918-we savants]920-our savants had the very poorest opinion of [Dr. Illingworth of]206-dr. illingworth [Edinburgh]79-edinburgh . Thenceforward that was [our]918-we one safety , and every strained situation was relieved by [our]918-we introducing the name of [the Scotch zoologist]921-the scotch zoologist , when both [[our]918-we Professors]922-our professors would form a temporary alliance and friendship in [their]922-our professors detestation and abuse of [this common rival]923-this common rival .

Advancing in single file along [the bank of [the stream]760-the stream]924-the bank of the stream , [we]918-we soon found that [it]760-the stream narrowed down to [a mere brook]926-a mere brook , and finally that [it]760-the stream lost itself in a great green morass of sponge - like mosses , into which [we]918-we sank up to [our]918-we knees . [The place]927-the place was horribly haunted by clouds of mosquitoes and every form of flying pest , so [we]918-we were glad to find solid ground again and to make a circuit among the trees , which enabled [us]918-we to outflank this pestilent morass , which droned like an organ in the distance , so loud was it with insect life .

On the second day after leaving [our]918-we canoes [we]918-we found that the whole character of [the country]2801-the country changed . [[Our]918-we road]929-our road was persistently upwards , and as [we]918-we ascended [the woods]2543-the woods became thinner and lost their tropical luxuriance . The huge trees of [the alluvial Amazonian plain]931-the alluvial amazonian plain gave place to the Phoenix and coco palms , growing in scattered clumps , with thick brushwood between . In [the damper hollows]932-the damper hollows [the Mauritia palms]933-the mauritia palms threw out their graceful drooping fronds . [We]918-we traveled entirely by compass , and once or twice there were differences of opinion between [Challenger]142-challenger and [the two Indians]934-the two indians , when , to quote [the Professor]2374-the professor 's indignant words , [the whole party]914-the whole party agreed to " trust the fallacious instincts of [undeveloped savages rather than the highest product of modern European culture]2873-undeveloped savages rather than the highest product of modern european culture . "[914-the whole party] That [we]918-we were justified in doing so was shown upon the third day , when [Challenger]142-challenger admitted that [he]142-challenger recognized several landmarks of [his]142-challenger former journey , and in one spot [we]918-we actually came upon four fire - blackened stones , which must have marked [a camping - place]937-a camping - place .

[The road]439-the road still ascended , and [we]918-we crossed a rock - studded slope which took two days to traverse . The vegetation had again changed , and only the vegetable ivory tree remained , with a great profusion of wonderful orchids , among which [I]0-i learned to recognize the rare Nuttonia Vexillaria and the glorious pink and scarlet blossoms of [Cattleya]207-cattleya and odontoglossum . Occasional brooks with pebbly bottoms and [fern - draped banks]939-fern - draped banks gurgled down [the shallow gorges in [the hill]941-the hill]940-the shallow gorges in the hill , and offered good camping - grounds every evening on the banks of [some rock - studded pool]942-some rock - studded pool , where swarms of little blue - backed fish , about the size and shape of English trout , gave [us]918-we a delicious supper .

On the ninth day after leaving the canoes , having done , as [I]0-i reckon , about a hundred and twenty miles , [we]918-we began to emerge from the trees , which had grown smaller until they were mere shrubs . [Their]943-their place was taken by [an immense wilderness of bamboo , which grew so thickly that [we]918-we could only penetrate it by cutting a pathway with the machetes and billhooks of [the Indians]893-the indians]944-an immense wilderness of bamboo , which grew so thickly that we could only penetrate it by cutting a pathway with the machetes and billhooks of the indians . It took [us]918-we a long day , traveling from seven in the morning till eight at night , with only two breaks of one hour each , to get through this obstacle . Anything more monotonous and wearying could not be imagined , for , even at the most open places , [I]0-i could not see more than ten or twelve yards , while usually [my]0-i vision was limited to the back of [Lord John]181-lord john 's cotton jacket in front of [me]0-i , and to the yellow wall within a foot of [me]0-i on either side . From above came one thin knife - edge of sunshine , and fifteen feet over [our]918-we heads one saw the tops of the reeds swaying against the deep blue sky . [I]0-i do not know what kind of creatures inhabit [such a thicket]946-such a thicket , but several times [we]918-we heard the plunging of large , heavy animals quite close to [us]918-we . From [their]943-their sounds [Lord John]181-lord john judged [them]943-their to be some form of wild cattle . Just as night fell [we]918-we cleared [the belt of bamboos]947-the belt of bamboos , and at once formed [[our]918-we camp]948-our camp , exhausted by the interminable day .

Early next morning [we]918-we were again afoot , and found that the character of [the country]2801-the country had changed once again . Behind [us]918-we was the wall of bamboo , as definite as if [it]950-it marked the course of [a river]951-a river . In front was [an open plain , sloping slightly upwards and dotted with clumps of tree - ferns]952-an open plain , sloping slightly upwards and dotted with clumps of tree - ferns , the whole curving before [us]918-we until [it]952-an open plain , sloping slightly upwards and dotted with clumps of tree - ferns ended in [a long , whale - backed ridge]953-a long , whale - backed ridge . This [we]918-we reached about midday , only to find [a shallow valley beyond]954-a shallow valley beyond , rising once again into a gentle incline which led to a low , rounded sky - line . It was here , while [we]918-we crossed [the first of [these hills]956-these hills]955-the first of these hills , that an incident occurred which may or may not have been important .

[Professor Challenger]142-challenger , who with [the two local Indians]957-the two local indians was in the van of [the party]958-the party , stopped suddenly and pointed excitedly to the right . As [he]142-challenger did so [we]918-we saw , at the distance of a mile or so , something which appeared to be a huge gray bird flap slowly up from the ground and skim smoothly off , flying very low and straight , until it was lost among the tree - ferns .

" Did [you]959-his colleague see it ? "[142-challenger] cried [Challenger]142-challenger , in exultation . " [Summerlee]182-summerlee , did [you]182-summerlee see it ? "[142-challenger]

[[His]142-challenger colleague]959-his colleague was staring at the spot where the creature had disappeared .

" What do [you]182-summerlee claim that it was ? "[959-his colleague] [he]959-his colleague asked .

" To the best of [my]959-his colleague belief , a pterodactyl . "[959-his colleague]

[Summerlee]182-summerlee burst into derisive laughter " A pter - fiddlestick ! "[182-summerlee] said [he]182-summerlee . " It was a stork , if ever [I]182-summerlee saw one . "[182-summerlee]

[Challenger]142-challenger was too furious to speak . [He]142-challenger simply swung [his]142-challenger pack upon [his]142-challenger back and continued upon [his]142-challenger march . [Lord John]181-lord john came abreast of [me]0-i , however , and [his]181-lord john face was more grave than was [his]181-lord john wo nt . [He]181-lord john had [his]181-lord john Zeiss glasses in [his]181-lord john hand .

" [I]181-lord john focused it before it got over the trees , "[181-lord john] said [he]181-lord john . " [I]181-lord john wo n't undertake to say what it was , but [I]181-lord john 'll risk [my]181-lord john reputation as [a sportsman]2418-a sportsman that it was n't any bird that ever [I]181-lord john clapped eyes on in [my]181-lord john life . "[181-lord john]

So there the matter stands . Are [we]960-our really just at the edge of [the unknown]781-the unknown , encountering [the outlying pickets of this lost world of which [[our]960-our leader]786-our leader speaks]962-the outlying pickets of this lost world of which our leader speaks ? [I]0-i give [you]964-you the incident as it occurred and [you]964-you will know as much as [I]0-i do . It stands alone , for [we]960-our saw nothing more which could be called remarkable .

And now , [[my]0-i readers]773-my readers , if ever [I]0-i have any , [I]0-i have brought [you]964-you up [the broad river]966-the broad river , and through the screen of rushes , and down [the green tunnel]967-the green tunnel , and up [the long slope of palm trees]968-the long slope of palm trees , and through the bamboo brake , and across [the plain of tree - ferns]969-the plain of tree - ferns . At last [[our]960-our destination]970-our destination lay in full sight of [us]960-our . When [we]960-our had crossed [the second ridge]971-the second ridge [we]960-our saw before [us]960-our [an irregular , palm - studded plain]972-an irregular , palm - studded plain , and then the line of high red cliffs which [I]0-i have seen in the picture . There it lies , even as [I]0-i write , and there can be no question that it is the same . At the nearest point it is about seven miles from [[our]960-our present camp]973-our present camp , and it curves away , stretching as far as [I]0-i can see . [Challenger]142-challenger struts about like a prize peacock , and [Summerlee]182-summerlee is silent , but still sceptical . Another day should bring some of [our]960-our doubts to an end . Meanwhile , as [Jose , whose arm was pierced by a broken bamboo]974-jose , whose arm was pierced by a broken bamboo , insists upon returning , [I]0-i send this letter back in [his]974-jose , whose arm was pierced by a broken bamboo charge , and only hope that it may eventually come to hand . [I]0-i will write again as the occasion serves . [I]0-i have enclosed with this a rough chart of [our]960-our journey , which may have the effect of making the account rather easier to understand .

CHAPTER IX

" Who could have Foreseen it ? "[0-i]

A dreadful thing has happened to [us]960-our . Who could have foreseen it ? [I]0-i can not foresee any end to [our]960-our troubles . It may be that [we]960-our are condemned to spend [our]960-our whole lives in [this strange , inaccessible place]975-this strange , inaccessible place . [I]0-i am still so confused that [I]0-i can hardly think clearly of the facts of the present or of the chances of the future . To [my]0-i astounded senses the one seems most terrible and the other as black as night .

[No men]976-no men have ever found [themselves]976-no men in a worse position ; nor is there any use in disclosing to [you]977-you [our]960-our exact geographical situation and asking [[our]960-our friends]978-our friends for a relief party . Even if [they]978-our friends could send one , [our]960-our fate will in all human probability be decided long before it could arrive in [South America]18-south america .

[We]960-our are , in truth , as far from any human aid as if [we]960-our were in the moon . If [we]960-our are to win through , it is only [our]960-our own qualities which can save [us]960-our . [I]0-i have as [companions three remarkable men]979-companions three remarkable men , [men of great brain - power and of unshaken courage]980-men of great brain - power and of unshaken courage . There lies [our]960-our one and only hope . It is only when [I]0-i look upon the untroubled faces of [[my]0-i comrades]662-my comrades that [I]0-i see some glimmer through the darkness . Outwardly [I]0-i trust that [I]0-i appear as unconcerned as [they]662-my comrades . Inwardly [I]0-i am filled with apprehension .

Let [me]0-i give [you]982-you , with as much detail as [I]0-i can , the sequence of events which have led [us]960-our to this catastrophe .

When [I]0-i finished [my]0-i last letter [I]0-i stated that [we]960-our were within seven miles from [an enormous line of ruddy cliffs]983-an enormous line of ruddy cliffs , which encircled , beyond all doubt , [the plateau of which [Professor Challenger]142-challenger spoke]984-the plateau of which professor challenger spoke . [Their]983-an enormous line of ruddy cliffs height , as [we]960-our approached [them]983-an enormous line of ruddy cliffs , seemed to [me]0-i in some places to be greater than [he]142-challenger had stated - running up in parts to at least a thousand feet - and they were curiously striated , in a manner which is , [I]0-i believe , characteristic of basaltic upheavals . Something of the sort is to be seen in Salisbury Crags at [Edinburgh]79-edinburgh . The summit showed every sign of a luxuriant vegetation , with bushes near the edge , and farther back many high trees . There was no indication of any life that [we]960-our could see .

That night [we]960-our pitched [[our]960-our camp]948-our camp immediately under [the cliff]2610-the cliff - [a most wild and desolate spot]987-a most wild and desolate spot . [The crags above [us]960-our]988-the crags above us were not merely perpendicular , but curved outwards at the top , so that ascent was out of the question . Close to [us]960-our was [the high thin pinnacle of rock which [I]0-i believe [I]0-i mentioned earlier in this narrative]989-the high thin pinnacle of rock which i believe i mentioned earlier in this narrative . It is like a broad red church spire , the top of [it]989-the high thin pinnacle of rock which i believe i mentioned earlier in this narrative being level with [the plateau]789-the plateau , but a great chasm gaping between . On [the summit of [it]989-the high thin pinnacle of rock which i believe i mentioned earlier in this narrative]991-the summit of it there grew one high tree . [Both pinnacle and cliff]992-both pinnacle and cliff were comparatively low - some five or six hundred feet , [I]0-i should think .

" It was on that , "[142-challenger] said [Professor Challenger]142-challenger , pointing to this tree , " that the pterodactyl was perched . [I]142-challenger climbed half - way up [the rock]2875-the rock before [I]142-challenger shot [him]142-challenger . [I]142-challenger am inclined to think that [a good mountaineer like]2876-a good mountaineer like [myself]142-challenger could ascend the rock to the top , though [he]2876-a good mountaineer like would , of course , be no nearer to [the plateau]789-the plateau when [he]2876-a good mountaineer like had done so . "[142-challenger]

As [Challenger]142-challenger spoke of [his]142-challenger pterodactyl [I]0-i glanced at [Professor Summerlee]182-summerlee , and for the first time [I]0-i seemed to see some signs of a dawning credulity and repentance . There was no sneer upon [his]142-challenger thin lips , but , on the contrary , a gray , drawn look of excitement and amazement . [Challenger]142-challenger saw it , too , and reveled in the first taste of victory .

" Of course , "[142-challenger] said [he]142-challenger , with [his]142-challenger clumsy and ponderous sarcasm , " [Professor Summerlee]182-summerlee will understand that when [I]142-challenger speak of a pterodactyl [I]142-challenger mean a stork - only it is the kind of stork which has no feathers , a leathery skin , membranous wings , and teeth in its jaws . "[142-challenger] [He]142-challenger grinned and blinked and bowed until [[his]142-challenger colleague]959-his colleague turned and walked away .

In the morning , after a frugal breakfast of coffee and manioc - [we]994-our had to be economical of [our]994-our stores - [we]994-our held a council of war as to the best method of ascending to [the plateau above [us]994-our]995-the plateau above us .

[Challenger]142-challenger presided with a solemnity as if [he]142-challenger were [the Lord Chief Justice on [the Bench]997-the bench]996-the lord chief justice on the bench . Picture [him]142-challenger seated upon a rock , [his]142-challenger absurd boyish straw hat tilted on the back of [his]142-challenger head , [his]142-challenger supercilious eyes dominating [us]994-our from under [his]142-challenger drooping lids , [his]142-challenger great black beard wagging as [he]142-challenger slowly defined [our]994-our present situation and [our]994-our future movements .

Beneath [him]142-challenger [you]998-you might have seen [the three of [us]994-our]999-the three of us - [myself]0-i , sunburnt , young , and vigorous after [our]994-our open - air tramp ; [Summerlee]182-summerlee , solemn but still critical , behind [his]182-summerlee eternal pipe ; [Lord John]181-lord john , as keen as a razor - edge , with [his]182-summerlee supple , alert figure leaning upon [his]182-summerlee rifle , and [his]182-summerlee eager eyes fixed eagerly upon [the speaker]1000-the speaker . Behind [us]994-our were grouped [the two swarthy half - breeds]1001-the two swarthy half - breeds and [the little knot of [Indians]204-the indians]1002-the little knot of indians , while in front and above [us]994-our towered those huge , ruddy ribs of rocks which kept [us]994-our from [our]994-our goal .

" [I]786-our leader need not say , "[786-our leader] said [[our]994-our leader]786-our leader , " that on the occasion of [my]786-our leader last visit [I]786-our leader exhausted every means of climbing [the cliff]2610-the cliff , and where [I]786-our leader failed [I]786-our leader do not think that [anyone else]2424-anyone else is likely to succeed , for [I]786-our leader am something of [a mountaineer]2880-a mountaineer . [I]786-our leader had none of the appliances of [a rock - climber]2881-a rock - climber with [me]786-our leader , but [I]786-our leader have taken the precaution to bring [them]2882-them now . With [their]2882-them aid [I]786-our leader am positive [I]786-our leader could climb that detached pinnacle to the summit ; but so long as [the main cliff]2883-the main cliff overhangs , it is vain to attempt ascending that . [I]786-our leader was hurried upon [my]786-our leader last visit by the approach of the rainy season and by the exhaustion of [my]786-our leader supplies . These considerations limited [my]786-our leader time , and [I]786-our leader can only claim that [I]786-our leader have surveyed about six miles of [the cliff]2610-the cliff to [the east of [us]2886-we]2885-the east of us , finding no possible way up . What , then , shall [we]2886-we now do ? "[786-our leader]

" There seems to be only one reasonable course , "[182-summerlee] said [Professor Summerlee]182-summerlee . " If [you]181-lord john have explored [the east]2887-the east , [we]2886-we should travel along the base of the cliff to the west , and seek for a practicable point for [our]2886-we ascent . "[182-summerlee]

" That 's it , "[181-lord john] said [Lord John]181-lord john . " The odds are that [this plateau]2888-this plateau is of no great size , and [we]2886-we shall travel round [it]2888-this plateau until [we]2886-we either find an easy way up it , or come back to the point from which [we]2886-we started . "[181-lord john]

" [I]142-challenger have already explained to [[our]2886-we young friend]2889-our young friend here , "[142-challenger] said [Challenger]142-challenger [he]142-challenger has a way of alluding to [me]0-i as if [I]0-i were [a school child ten years old]1004-a school child ten years old , " that it is quite impossible that there should be an easy way up anywhere , for the simple reason that if there were [the summit]2611-the summit would not be isolated , and those conditions would not obtain which have effected so singular an interference with the general laws of survival . Yet [I]142-challenger admit that there may very well be places where [an expert human climber]2891-an expert human climber may reach [the summit]2611-the summit , and yet [a cumbrous and heavy animal be unable to descend]2893-a cumbrous and heavy animal be unable to descend . It is certain that there is a point where an ascent is possible . "[142-challenger]

" How do [you]182-summerlee know that , [sir]2355-sir ? "[182-summerlee] asked [Summerlee]182-summerlee , sharply .

" Because [[my]142-challenger predecessor]2895-my predecessor , [the American Maple White]169-maple white , actually made such an ascent . How otherwise could [he]2895-my predecessor have seen the monster which [he]2895-my predecessor sketched in [his]2895-my predecessor notebook ? "[142-challenger]

" There [you]182-summerlee reason somewhat ahead of the proved facts , "[182-summerlee] said [the stubborn Summerlee]182-summerlee . " [I]182-summerlee admit [[your]182-summerlee plateau]2896-your plateau , because [I]182-summerlee have seen it ; but [I]182-summerlee have not as yet satisfied [myself]182-summerlee that it contains any form of life whatever . "[182-summerlee]

" What [you]182-summerlee admit , [sir]2355-sir , or what [you]182-summerlee do not admit , is really of inconceivably small importance . [I]1005-he am glad to perceive that [the plateau]789-the plateau [itself]789-the plateau has actually obtruded itself upon [your]182-summerlee intelligence . "[1005-he] [He]1005-he glanced up at it , and then , to [our]1006-our amazement , [he]1005-he sprang from [his]1005-he rock , and , seizing [Summerlee]182-summerlee by the neck , [he]1005-he tilted [his]1005-he face into the air . " Now [sir]2355-sir ! "[1005-he] [he]1005-he shouted , hoarse with excitement . " Do [I]1005-he help [you]2355-sir to realize that [the plateau]789-the plateau contains some animal life ? "[1005-he]

[I]0-i have said that a thick fringe of green overhung [the edge of [the cliff]2610-the cliff]1007-the edge of the cliff . Out of this there had emerged a black , glistening object . As it came slowly forth and overhung [the chasm]1009-the chasm , [we]1006-our saw that it was [a very large snake with a peculiar flat , spade - like head]1010-a very large snake with a peculiar flat , spade - like head . It wavered and quivered above [us]1006-our for a minute , the morning sun gleaming upon its sleek , sinuous coils . Then it slowly drew inwards and disappeared .

[Summerlee]182-summerlee had been so interested that [he]182-summerlee had stood unresisting while [Challenger]142-challenger tilted [his]142-challenger head into the air . Now [he]182-summerlee shook [[his]182-summerlee colleague]959-his colleague off and came back to [his]182-summerlee dignity .

" [I]182-summerlee should be glad , [Professor Challenger]142-challenger , "[182-summerlee] said [he]182-summerlee , " if [you]142-challenger could see [your]142-challenger way to make any remarks which may occur to [you]142-challenger without seizing [me]182-summerlee by the chin . Even the appearance of a very ordinary rock python does not appear to justify such a liberty . "[182-summerlee]

" But there is life upon [the plateau]789-the plateau all the same , "[959-his colleague] [[his]182-summerlee colleague]959-his colleague replied in triumph . " And now , having demonstrated this important conclusion so that it is clear to [anyone]2598-anyone , however prejudiced or obtuse , [I]959-his colleague am of opinion that [we]1015-we can not do better than break up [[our]1015-we camp]948-our camp and travel to westward until [we]1015-we find some means of ascent . "[959-his colleague]

[The ground at the foot of [the cliff]2610-the cliff]1013-the ground at the foot of the cliff was rocky and broken so that the going was slow and difficult . Suddenly [we]1015-we came , however , upon something which cheered [our]1015-we hearts . It was the site of [an old encampment]1016-an old encampment , with several empty [Chicago]80-chicago meat tins , a bottle labeled " Brandy , "[142-challenger] a broken tin - opener , and a quantity of [other travelers]1017-other travelers ' debris . A crumpled , disintegrated newspaper revealed itself as the Chicago Democrat , though the date had been obliterated .

" Not mine , "[142-challenger] said [Challenger]142-challenger . " It must be [Maple White]169-maple white 's . "[142-challenger]

[Lord John]181-lord john had been gazing curiously at a great tree - fern which overshadowed the encampment . " [I]181-lord john say , look at this , "[181-lord john] said [he]181-lord john . " [I]181-lord john believe it is meant for a sign - post . "[181-lord john]

A slip of hard wood had been nailed to the tree in such a way as to point to the westward .

" Most certainly a sign - post , "[142-challenger] said [Challenger]142-challenger . " What else ? Finding [himself]2904-himself upon a dangerous errand , [[our]1015-we pioneer]2905-our pioneer has left this sign so that any party which follows [him]2904-himself may know the way [he]2904-himself has taken . Perhaps [we]1015-we shall come upon some other indications as [we]1015-we proceed . "[142-challenger]

[We]1015-we did indeed , but they were of a terrible and most unexpected nature . Immediately beneath [the cliff]2610-the cliff there grew a considerable patch of high bamboo , like that which [we]1015-we had traversed in [our]1015-we journey . Many of these stems were twenty feet high , with sharp , strong tops , so that even as they stood they made formidable spears . [We]1015-we were passing along the edge of this cover when [my]0-i eye was caught by the gleam of something white within it . Thrusting in [my]0-i head between the stems , [I]0-i found [myself]0-i gazing at a fleshless skull . The whole skeleton was there , but the skull had detached itself and lay some feet nearer to the open .

With a few blows from the machetes of [[our]1015-we Indians]842-our indians [we]1015-we cleared [the spot]1020-the spot and were able to study the details of this old tragedy . Only a few shreds of clothes could still be distinguished , but there were the remains of boots upon the bony feet , and it was very clear that [the dead man]418-the dead man was [a European]1022-a european . A gold watch by [Hudson]208-hudson , of [New York]81-new york , and a chain which held a stylographic pen , lay among the bones . There was also a silver cigarette - case , with " J. C. , from A. E. S. , "[181-lord john] upon the lid . The state of the metal seemed to show that the catastrophe had occurred no great time before .

" Who can [he]418-the dead man be ? "[181-lord john] asked [Lord John]181-lord john . " [Poor devil]2906-poor devil ! every bone in [his]418-the dead man body seems to be broken . "[181-lord john]

" And the bamboo grows through [his]418-the dead man smashed ribs , "[182-summerlee] said [Summerlee]182-summerlee . " It is a fast - growing plant , but it is surely inconceivable that this body could have been here while the canes grew to be twenty feet in length . "[182-summerlee]

" As to [the man]2381-the man 's identity , "[142-challenger] said [Professor Challenger]142-challenger , " [I]142-challenger have no doubt whatever upon that point . As [I]142-challenger made [my]142-challenger way up [the river]2530-the river before [I]142-challenger reached [you]2909-you at [the fazenda]2910-the fazenda [I]142-challenger instituted very particular inquiries about [Maple White]169-maple white . At [Para]56-para [they]56-para knew nothing . Fortunately , [I]142-challenger had a definite clew , for there was a particular picture in [his]418-the dead man sketch - book which showed [him]418-the dead man taking lunch with a certain ecclesiastic at [Rosario]29-rosario . [This priest]2911-this priest [I]142-challenger was able to find , and though [he]418-the dead man proved [a very argumentative fellow]2912-a very argumentative fellow , who took it absurdly amiss that [I]142-challenger should point out to [him]418-the dead man the corrosive effect which modern science must have upon [his]418-the dead man beliefs , [he]418-the dead man none the less gave [me]142-challenger some positive information . [Maple White]169-maple white passed [Rosario]29-rosario four years ago , or two years before [I]142-challenger saw [his]418-the dead man dead body . [He]418-the dead man was not alone at the time , but there was [a friend]2913-a friend , [an American named [James Colver]164-jimmy colver , who remained in [the boat]2591-the boat and did not meet [this ecclesiastic]2916-this ecclesiastic]2914-an american named james colver , who remained in the boat and did not meet this ecclesiastic . [I]142-challenger think , therefore , that there can be no doubt that [we]1023-we are now looking upon the remains of [this James Colver]164-jimmy colver . "[142-challenger]

" Nor , "[181-lord john] said [Lord John]181-lord john , " is there much doubt as to how [he]418-the dead man met [his]418-the dead man death . [He]418-the dead man has fallen or been chucked from the top , and so been impaled . How else could [he]418-the dead man come by [his]418-the dead man broken bones , and how could [he]418-the dead man have been stuck through by these canes with their points so high above [our]1023-we heads ? "[181-lord john]

A hush came over [us]1023-we as [we]1023-we stood round these shattered remains and realized the truth of [Lord John Roxton]181-lord john 's words . The beetling head of [the cliff]2610-the cliff projected over the cane - brake . Undoubtedly [he]181-lord john had fallen from above . But had [he]181-lord john fallen ? Had it been an accident ? Or - already ominous and terrible possibilities began to form round [that unknown land]1025-that unknown land .

[We]1023-we moved off in silence , and continued to coast round the line of cliffs , which were as even and unbroken as some of [those monstrous Antarctic ice - fields which [I]0-i have seen depicted as stretching from horizon to horizon and towering high above the mast - heads of [the exploring vessel]1027-the exploring vessel]1026-those monstrous antarctic ice - fields which i have seen depicted as stretching from horizon to horizon and towering high above the mast - heads of the exploring vessel .

In five miles [we]1023-we saw no rift or break . And then suddenly [we]1023-we perceived something which filled [us]1023-we with new hope . In [a hollow of the rock]1028-a hollow of the rock , protected from rain , there was drawn a rough arrow in chalk , pointing still to the westwards .

" [Maple White]169-maple white again , "[142-challenger] said [Professor Challenger]142-challenger . " [He]181-lord john had some presentiment that worthy footsteps would follow close behind [him]181-lord john . "[142-challenger]

" [He]181-lord john had chalk , then ? "[142-challenger]

" A box of colored chalks was among the effects [I]142-challenger found in [his]181-lord john knapsack . [I]142-challenger remember that the white one was worn to a stump . "[142-challenger]

" That is certainly good evidence , "[182-summerlee] said [Summerlee]182-summerlee . " [We]1023-we can only accept [his]181-lord john guidance and follow on to the westward . "[182-summerlee]

[We]1023-we had proceeded some five more miles when again [we]1023-we saw a white arrow upon [the rocks]1029-the rocks . It was at [a point where [the face of the cliff]1031-the face of the cliff was for the first time split into a narrow cleft]1030-a point where the face of the cliff was for the first time split into a narrow cleft . Inside the cleft was a second guidance mark , which pointed right up [it]1032-it with the tip somewhat elevated , as if the spot indicated were above the level of the ground .

It was a solemn place , for the walls were so gigantic and the slit of blue sky so narrow and so obscured by a double fringe of verdure , that only a dim and shadowy light penetrated to the bottom . [We]1023-we had had no food for many hours , and were very weary with the stony and irregular journey , but [our]1023-we nerves were too strung to allow [us]1023-we to halt . [We]1023-we ordered [the camp]669-the camp to be pitched , however , and , leaving [the Indians]893-the indians to arrange it , [we]1023-we four , with [the two half - breeds]1035-the two half - breeds , proceeded up [the narrow gorge]1036-the narrow gorge .

[It]1036-the narrow gorge was not more than forty feet across at the mouth , but [it]1036-the narrow gorge rapidly closed until [it]1036-the narrow gorge ended in an acute angle , too straight and smooth for an ascent . Certainly it was not this which [[our]1023-we pioneer]2905-our pioneer had attempted to indicate . [We]1023-we made [our]1023-we way back - [the whole gorge]1038-the whole gorge was not more than a quarter of a mile deep - and then suddenly the quick eyes of [Lord John]181-lord john fell upon what [we]1023-we were seeking . High up above [our]1023-we heads , amid the dark shadows , there was one circle of deeper gloom . Surely it could only be the opening of [a cave]1039-a cave .

[The base of [the cliff]2610-the cliff]2609-the base of the cliff was heaped with loose stones at the spot , and it was not difficult to clamber up . When [we]1023-we reached [it]1039-a cave , all doubt was removed . Not only was it an opening into [the rock]2875-the rock , but on the side of [it]1039-a cave there was marked once again the sign of the arrow . Here was the point , and this the means by which [Maple White]169-maple white and [[his]169-maple white ill - fated comrade]1043-his ill - fated comrade had made [their]1044-their ascent .

[We]1023-we were too excited to return to [the camp]669-the camp , but must make [our]1023-we first exploration at once . [Lord John]181-lord john had an electric torch in [his]181-lord john knapsack , and this had to serve [us]1023-we as light . [He]181-lord john advanced , throwing [his]181-lord john little clear circlet of yellow radiance before [him]181-lord john , while in single file [we]1023-we followed at [his]181-lord john heels .

[The cave]1046-the cave had evidently been water - worn , the sides being smooth and the floor covered with rounded stones . [It]1046-the cave was of such a size that [a single man]1047-a single man could just fit through by stooping . For fifty yards [it]1046-the cave ran almost straight into [the rock]2875-the rock , and then [it]1046-the cave ascended at an angle of forty - five . Presently this incline became even steeper , and [we]1023-we found [ourselves]1023-we climbing upon hands and knees among loose rubble which slid from beneath [us]1023-we . Suddenly an exclamation broke from [Lord Roxton]181-lord john .

" It 's blocked ! "[181-lord john] said [he]181-lord john .

Clustering behind [him]181-lord john [we]1023-we saw in the yellow field of light a wall of broken basalt which extended to the ceiling .

" The roof has fallen in ! "[181-lord john]

In vain [we]1023-we dragged out some of the pieces . The only effect was that [the larger ones]1049-the larger ones became detached and threatened to roll down the gradient and crush [us]1023-we . It was evident that the obstacle was far beyond any efforts which [we]1023-we could make to remove it . [The road by which [Maple White]169-maple white had ascended]1050-the road by which maple white had ascended was no longer available .

Too much cast down to speak , [we]1023-we stumbled down [the dark tunnel]1051-the dark tunnel and made [our]1023-we way back to [the camp]669-the camp .

One incident occurred , however , before [we]1023-we left [the gorge]1053-the gorge , which is of importance in view of what came afterwards .

[We]1023-we had gathered in a little group at [the bottom of [the chasm]1009-the chasm]1054-the bottom of the chasm , some forty feet beneath [the mouth of [the cave]1046-the cave]1056-the mouth of the cave , when a huge rock rolled suddenly downwards - and shot past [us]1023-we with tremendous force . It was the narrowest escape for [one or all of [us]1023-we]1058-one or all of us . [We]1023-we could not [ourselves]1023-we see whence the rock had come , but [[our]1023-we half - breed servants , who were still at the opening of [the cave]1046-the cave]1059-our half - breed servants , who were still at the opening of the cave , said that it had flown past [them]1059-our half - breed servants , who were still at the opening of the cave , and must therefore have fallen from [the summit]2611-the summit . Looking upwards , [we]1023-we could see no sign of movement above [us]1023-we amidst [the green jungle which topped [the cliff]2610-the cliff]1062-the green jungle which topped the cliff . There could be little doubt , however , that the stone was aimed at [us]1023-we , so the incident surely pointed to humanity - and malevolent humanity - upon [the plateau]789-the plateau .

[We]1023-we withdrew hurriedly from [the chasm]1009-the chasm , [our]1023-we minds full of this new development and its bearing upon [our]1023-we plans . The situation was difficult enough before , but if the obstructions of Nature were increased by the deliberate opposition of [man]2341-man , then [our]1023-we case was indeed a hopeless one . And yet , as [we]1023-we looked up at that beautiful fringe of verdure only a few hundreds of feet above [our]1023-we heads , there was [not one of [us]1023-we who could conceive the idea of returning to [London]22-london until [we]1023-we had explored [it]22-london to [its]22-london depths]1067-not one of us who could conceive the idea of returning to london until we had explored it to its depths .

On discussing the situation , [we]1023-we determined that [our]1023-we best course was to continue to coast round [the plateau]789-the plateau in the hope of finding some other means of reaching the top . The line of cliffs , which had decreased considerably in height , had already begun to trend from west to north , and if [we]1023-we could take this as representing the arc of a circle , the whole circumference could not be very great . At the worst , then , [we]1023-we should be back in a few days at [our]1023-we starting - point .

[We]1023-we made a march that day which totaled some two - and - twenty miles , without any change in [our]1023-we prospects . [I]0-i may mention that [our]1023-we aneroid shows [us]1023-we that in the continual incline which [we]1023-we have ascended since [we]1023-we abandoned [our]1023-we canoes [we]1023-we have risen to no less than three thousand feet above sea - level . Hence there is a considerable change both in the temperature and in the vegetation . [We]1023-we have shaken off some of that horrible insect life which is the bane of tropical travel . A few palms still survive , and many tree - ferns , but the Amazonian trees have been all left behind . It was pleasant to see the convolvulus , the passion - flower , and the begonia , all reminding [me]0-i of [home]2831-home , here among [these inhospitable rocks]1070-these inhospitable rocks . There was a red begonia just the same color as one that is kept in a pot in the window of [a certain villa in [Streatham]82-streatham]1071-a certain villa in streatham - but [I]0-i am drifting into private reminiscence .

That night - [I]0-i am still speaking of the first day of [our]1023-we circumnavigation of [the plateau]789-the plateau - a great experience awaited [us]1023-we , and one which for ever set at rest any doubt which [we]1023-we could have had as to the wonders so near [us]1023-we .

[You]1073-you will realize as [you]1073-you read it , [[my]0-i dear]2487-my dear [Mr. McArdle]143-mcardle , and possibly for the first time that the paper has not sent [me]0-i on a wild - goose chase , and that there is inconceivably fine copy waiting for [the world]2307-the world whenever [we]1023-we have [the Professor]2374-the professor 's leave to make use of it . [I]0-i shall not dare to publish these articles unless [I]0-i can bring back [my]0-i proofs to [England]41-england , or [I]0-i shall be hailed as [the journalistic Munchausen of all time]1077-the journalistic munchausen of all time . [I]0-i have no doubt that [you]1073-you feel the same way [yourself]1073-you , and that [you]1073-you would not care to stake the whole credit of the Gazette upon this adventure until [we]1023-we can meet the chorus of criticism and scepticism which such articles must of necessity elicit . So this wonderful incident , which would make such a headline for the old paper , must still wait its turn in the editorial drawer .

And yet it was all over in a flash , and there was no sequel to it , save in [our]1023-we own convictions .

What occurred was this . [Lord John]181-lord john had shot an ajouti - which is a small , pig - like animal - and , half of it having been given to [the Indians]204-the indians , [we]1023-we were cooking the other half upon [our]1023-we fire . There is a chill in the air after dark , and [we]1023-we had all drawn close to the blaze . The night was moonless , but there were some stars , and [one]2316-one could see for a little distance across [the plain]1079-the plain . Well , suddenly out of the darkness , out of the night , there swooped something with a swish like an aeroplane . [The whole group of [us]1023-we]1080-the whole group of us were covered for an instant by a canopy of leathery wings , and [I]0-i had a momentary vision of a long , snake - like neck , a fierce , red , greedy eye , and a great snapping beak , filled , to [my]0-i amazement , with little , gleaming teeth . The next instant it was gone - and so was [our]1023-we dinner . A huge black shadow , twenty feet across , skimmed up into the air ; for an instant the monster wings blotted out the stars , and then it vanished over the brow of [the cliff above [us]1023-we]1081-the cliff above us . [We]1023-we all sat in amazed silence round the fire , like [the heroes of [Virgil]83-virgil]1082-the heroes of virgil when [the Harpies]210-the harpies came down upon [them]1082-the heroes of virgil . It was [Summerlee]182-summerlee who was the first to speak .

" [Professor Challenger]142-challenger , "[182-summerlee] said [he]182-summerlee , in a solemn voice , which quavered with emotion , " [I]182-summerlee owe [you]142-challenger an apology . [Sir]2355-sir , [I]182-summerlee am very much in the wrong , and [I]182-summerlee beg that [you]142-challenger will forget what is past . "[182-summerlee]

It was handsomely said , and [the two men]1083-the two men for the first time shook hands . So much [we]1023-we have gained by this clear vision of [our]1023-we first pterodactyl . It was worth a stolen supper to bring [two such men]1084-two such men together .

But if prehistoric life existed upon [the plateau]789-the plateau it was not superabundant , for [we]1023-we had no further glimpse of [it]1086-it during the next three days . During this time [we]1023-we traversed [a barren and forbidding country]1087-a barren and forbidding country , which alternated between [stony desert]1088-stony desert and [desolate marshes full of many wild - fowl]1089-desolate marshes full of many wild - fowl , upon [the north and east of the cliffs]1090-the north and east of the cliffs . From that direction [the place]927-the place is really inaccessible , and , were it not for [a hardish ledge]1092-a hardish ledge which runs at [the very base of the precipice]1093-the very base of the precipice , [we]1023-we should have had to turn back . Many times [we]1023-we were up to [our]1023-we waists in the slime and blubber of [an old , semi - tropical swamp]1094-an old , semi - tropical swamp . To make matters worse , [the place]927-the place seemed to be a favorite breeding - place of the Jaracaca snake , the most venomous and aggressive in [South America]18-south america . Again and again these horrible creatures came writhing and springing towards [us]1023-we across [the surface of [this putrid bog]1097-this putrid bog]1096-the surface of this putrid bog , and it was only by keeping [our]1023-we shot - guns for ever ready that [we]1023-we could feel safe from [them]1098-them . [One funnel - shaped depression in [the morass]1100-the morass]1099-one funnel - shaped depression in the morass , of a livid green in color from some lichen which festered in it , will always remain as a nightmare memory in [my]0-i mind . It seems to have been a special nest of [these vermins]1101-these vermins , and [the slopes]1102-the slopes were alive with them , all writhing in [our]1023-we direction , for it is a peculiarity of [the Jaracaca]211-the jaracaca that [he]211-the jaracaca will always attack [man]2341-man at first sight . There were too many for [us]1023-we to shoot , so [we]1023-we fairly took to [our]1023-we heels and ran until [we]1023-we were exhausted . [I]0-i shall always remember as [we]1023-we looked back how far behind [we]1023-we could see the heads and necks of [[our]1023-we horrible pursuers]1104-our horrible pursuers rising and falling amid the reeds . [Jaracaca Swamp]84-jaracaca swamp [we]1023-we named [it]84-jaracaca swamp in the map which [we]1023-we are constructing .

[The cliffs upon [the farther side]1106-the farther side]1105-the cliffs upon the farther side had lost their ruddy tint , being chocolate - brown in color ; the vegetation was more scattered along the top of them , and [they]1105-the cliffs upon the farther side had sunk to three or four hundred feet in height , but in no place did [we]1023-we find any point where [they]1105-the cliffs upon the farther side could be ascended . If anything , they were more impossible than at the first point where [we]1023-we had met [them]1105-the cliffs upon the farther side . [Their]1105-the cliffs upon the farther side absolute steepness is indicated in the photograph which [I]0-i took over [the stony desert]1107-the stony desert .

" Surely , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , as [we]1023-we discussed the situation , " the rain must find its way down somehow . There are bound to be water - channels in the rocks . "[0-i]

" [[Our]1023-we young friend]2889-our young friend has glimpses of lucidity , "[142-challenger] said [Professor Challenger]142-challenger , patting [me]0-i upon the shoulder .

" The rain must go somewhere , "[0-i] [I]0-i repeated .

" [He]2889-our young friend keeps a firm grip upon actuality . The only drawback is that [we]1023-we have conclusively proved by ocular demonstration that there are no water channels down [the rocks]1029-the rocks . "[142-challenger]

" Where , then , does it go ? "[0-i] [I]0-i persisted .

" [I]0-i think it may be fairly assumed that if it does not come outwards it must run inwards . "[0-i]

" Then there is a lake in the center . "[142-challenger]

" So [I]0-i should suppose . "[0-i]

" It is more than likely that [the lake]2920-the lake may be an old crater , "[182-summerlee] said [Summerlee]182-summerlee . " The whole formation is , of course , highly volcanic .
