" Or evaporation might preserve an equilibrium , "[142-challenger] remarked [Challenger]142-challenger , and [the two learned men]805-the two learned men wandered off into one of [their]805-the two learned men usual scientific arguments , which were as comprehensible as Chinese to [the layman]1109-the layman .

On the sixth day [we]1110-our completed [our]1110-our first circuit of [the cliffs]1111-the cliffs , and found [ourselves]1110-our back at [the first camp]1112-the first camp , beside [the isolated pinnacle of rock]1113-the isolated pinnacle of rock . [We]1110-our were [a disconsolate party]1114-a disconsolate party , for nothing could have been more minute than [our]1110-our investigation , and it was absolutely certain that there was no single point where [the most active human being]1115-the most active human being could possibly hope to scale [the cliff]2610-the cliff . [The place which [Maple White]169-maple white 's chalk - marks had indicated as [his]169-maple white own means of access]1117-the place which maple white 's chalk - marks had indicated as his own means of access was now entirely impassable .

What were [we]1110-our to do now ? [Our]1110-our stores of provisions , supplemented by [our]1110-our guns , were holding out well , but the day must come when they would need replenishment . In a couple of months the rains might be expected , and [we]1110-our should be washed out of [[our]1110-our camp]948-our camp . [The rock]2875-the rock was harder than marble , and any attempt at cutting a path for so great a height was more than [our]1110-our time or resources would admit . No wonder that [we]1110-our looked gloomily at [each other]2795-each other that night , and sought [our]1110-our blankets with hardly a word exchanged . [I]0-i remember that as [I]0-i dropped off to sleep [my]0-i last recollection was that [Challenger]142-challenger was squatting , like a monstrous bull - frog , by the fire , [his]142-challenger huge head in [his]142-challenger hands , sunk apparently in the deepest thought , and entirely oblivious to the good - night which [I]0-i wished [him]142-challenger .

After breakfast [we]1124-we unpacked the bundle in which [[our]1124-we leader]786-our leader had brought [his]142-challenger climbing accessories . From it [he]142-challenger took a coil of the strongest and lightest rope , a hundred and fifty feet in length , with climbing irons , clamps , and other devices . [Lord John]181-lord john was [an experienced mountaineer]1130-an experienced mountaineer , and [Summerlee]182-summerlee had done some rough climbing at various times , so that [I]0-i was really [the novice at rock - work of the party]1131-the novice at rock - work of the party ; but [my]0-i strength and activity may have made up for [my]0-i want of experience .

It was not in reality a very stiff task , though there were moments which made [my]0-i hair bristle upon [my]0-i head . The first half was perfectly easy , but from there upwards it became continually steeper until , for the last fifty feet , [we]1124-we were literally clinging with [our]1124-we fingers and toes to tiny ledges and crevices in [the rock]2875-the rock . [I]0-i could not have accomplished it , nor could [Summerlee]182-summerlee , if [Challenger]142-challenger had not gained [the summit]2611-the summit it was extraordinary to see such activity in so unwieldy a creature and there fixed the rope round the trunk of the considerable tree which grew there . The first impression which [I]0-i received when [I]0-i had recovered [my]0-i breath was of the extraordinary view over [the country which [we]1124-we had traversed]1135-the country which we had traversed . [The whole Brazilian plain]1136-the whole brazilian plain seemed to lie beneath [us]1124-we , extending away and away until it ended in dim blue mists upon the farthest sky - line . In the foreground was the long slope , strewn with rocks and dotted with tree - ferns ; farther off in the middle distance , looking over [the saddle - back hill]1137-the saddle - back hill , [I]0-i could just see the yellow and green mass of bamboos through which [we]1124-we had passed ; and then , gradually , the vegetation increased until it formed the huge forest which extended as far as the eyes could reach , and for a good two thousand miles beyond .

[I]0-i was still drinking in this wonderful panorama when the heavy hand of [the Professor]2374-the professor fell upon [my]0-i shoulder .

[The level of [the plateau]789-the plateau]1139-the level of the plateau , when [I]0-i turned , was exactly that on which [we]1124-we stood , and the green bank of bushes , with occasional trees , was so near that it was difficult to realize how inaccessible it remained . Finally [I]0-i set to work in earnest upon the trunk , taking turn and turn with [Lord John]181-lord john . In a little over an hour there was a loud crack , the tree swayed forward , and then crashed over , burying its branches among the bushes on the farther side . The severed trunk rolled to the very edge of [[our]1145-we platform]1147-our platform , and for one terrible second [we]1145-we all thought it was over . It balanced itself , however , a few inches from the edge , and there was [[our]1145-we bridge]1148-our bridge to the unknown .

[A man in white clothes]1197-a man in white clothes , who could only be [the surviving half - breed]1198-the surviving half - breed , was running as one does run when [Death]136-death is [the pacemaker]1199-the pacemaker . [The white figure]1204-the white figure lay motionless in [the middle of [the great plain]1206-the great plain]1205-the middle of the great plain .

[[Our]1190-our two traitors]1207-our two traitors had been destroyed , but the mischief that [they]1207-our two traitors had done lived after [them]1207-our two traitors . By no possible means could [we]1190-our get back to [the pinnacle]1208-the pinnacle . [We]1190-our had been [natives of [the world]2307-the world]1209-natives of the world ; now [we]1190-our were [natives of [the plateau]789-the plateau]1211-natives of the plateau . The two things were separate and apart . There was [the plain]1079-the plain which led to [the canoes]906-the canoes . [Yonder , beyond the violet , hazy horizon]1215-yonder , beyond the violet , hazy horizon , was [the stream]760-the stream which led back to civilization . But the link between was missing . No human ingenuity could suggest a means of bridging the chasm which yawned between [ourselves]1190-our and [our]1190-our past lives . One instant had altered the whole conditions of [our]1190-our existence .

It was at such a moment that [I]0-i learned the stuff of which [[my]0-i three comrades]1217-my three comrades were composed . [They]1217-my three comrades were grave , it is true , and thoughtful , but of an invincible serenity . For the moment [we]1190-our could only sit among the bushes in patience and wait the coming of [Zambo]195-zambo . [Presently]213-presently [his]195-zambo honest black face topped the rocks and [his]195-zambo Herculean figure emerged upon the top of the pinnacle .

" What [I]195-zambo do now ? "[195-zambo] [he]195-zambo cried . " [You]0-i tell [me]195-zambo and [I]195-zambo do it . "[195-zambo]

It was a question which it was easier to ask than to answer . One thing only was clear . [He]195-zambo was [our]1190-our one trusty link with [the outside world]1218-the outside world . On no account must [he]195-zambo leave [us]1190-our .

" No no ! "[195-zambo] [he]195-zambo cried . " [I]195-zambo not leave [you]0-i . Whatever come , [you]0-i always find [me]195-zambo here . But no able to keep [Indians]204-the indians . Already [they]204-the indians say too much [Curupuri]168-curupuri live on [this place]2968-this place , and [they]204-the indians go [home]2831-home . Now [you]0-i leave [them]204-the indians [me]195-zambo no able to keep [them]204-the indians . "[195-zambo]

It was a fact that [[our]1190-our Indians]842-our indians had shown in many ways of late that [they]842-our indians were weary of [their]842-our indians journey and anxious to return . [We]1190-our realized that [Zambo]195-zambo spoke the truth , and that it would be impossible for [him]195-zambo to keep [them]842-our indians .

" Make [them]842-our indians wait till to - morrow , [Zambo]195-zambo , "[0-i] [I]0-i shouted ; " then [I]0-i can send letter back by [them]842-our indians . "[0-i]

" Very good , [sarr]2970-sarr ! [I]1220-the negro promise [they]842-our indians wait till to - morrow , "[1220-the negro] said [the negro]1220-the negro . " But what [I]1220-the negro do for [you]2970-sarr now ? "[1220-the negro]

There was plenty for [him]195-zambo to do , and admirably [the faithful fellow]1221-the faithful fellow did it . First of all , under [our]1190-our directions , [he]195-zambo undid the rope from the tree - stump and threw one end of it across to [us]1190-our . It was not thicker than a clothes - line , but it was of great strength , and though [we]1190-our could not make a bridge of it , [we]1190-our might well find it invaluable if [we]1190-our had any climbing to do . [He]195-zambo then fastened [his]195-zambo end of the rope to the package of supplies which had been carried up , and [we]1190-our were able to drag it across . This gave [us]1190-our the means of life for at least a week , even if [we]1190-our found nothing else . Finally [he]195-zambo descended and carried up two other packets of mixed goods - a box of ammunition and a number of other things , all of which [we]1190-our got across by throwing [our]1190-our rope to [him]195-zambo and hauling it back . It was evening when [he]195-zambo at last climbed down , with a final assurance that [he]195-zambo would keep [the Indians]893-the indians till next morning .

And so it is that [I]0-i have spent nearly the whole of this [our]1190-our first night upon [the plateau]789-the plateau writing up [our]1190-our experiences by the light of a single candle - lantern .

[We]1190-our supped and camped at [the very edge of [the cliff]2610-the cliff]1224-the very edge of the cliff , quenching [our]1190-our thirst with two bottles of Apollinaris which were in one of the cases . It is vital to [us]1190-our to find water , but [I]0-i think even [Lord John]181-lord john [himself]181-lord john had had adventures enough for one day , and [none of [us]1190-our]1226-none of us felt inclined to make the first push into [the unknown]781-the unknown . [We]1190-our forbore to light a fire or to make any unnecessary sound .

To - morrow or to - day , rather , for it is already dawn as [I]0-i write [we]1190-our shall make [our]1190-our first venture into [this strange land]1228-this strange land . When [I]0-i shall be able to write again - or if [I]0-i ever shall write again - [I]0-i know not . Meanwhile , [I]0-i can see that [the Indians]204-the indians are still in [their]204-the indians place , and [I]0-i am sure that [the faithful Zambo]1229-the faithful zambo will be here presently to get [my]0-i letter . [I]0-i only trust that it will come to hand .

P.S. - The more [I]0-i think the more desperate does [our]1190-our position seem . [I]0-i see no possible hope of [our]1190-our return . If there were a high tree near [the edge of [the plateau]789-the plateau]1186-the edge of the plateau [we]1190-our might drop a return bridge across , but there is none within fifty yards . [Our]1190-our united strength could not carry a trunk which would serve [our]1190-our purpose . The rope , of course , is far too short that [we]1190-our could descend by it . No , [our]1190-our position is hopeless - hopeless !

CHAPTER X

" The most Wonderful Things have Happened "[1190-our]

The most wonderful things have happened and are continually happening to [us]1190-our . All the paper that [I]0-i possess consists of five old note - books and a lot of scraps , and [I]0-i have only the one stylographic pencil ; but so long as [I]0-i can move [my]0-i hand [I]0-i will continue to set down [our]1190-our experiences and impressions , for , since [we]1190-our are [the only men of [the whole human race to see such things]1233-the whole human race to see such things]1232-the only men of the whole human race to see such things , it is of enormous importance that [I]0-i should record them whilst they are fresh in [my]0-i memory and before that fate which seems to be constantly impending does actually overtake [us]1190-our . Whether [Zambo]195-zambo can at last take these letters to [the river]2530-the river , or whether [I]0-i shall [myself]0-i in some miraculous way carry them back with [me]0-i , or , finally , whether [some daring explorer]1235-some daring explorer , coming upon [our]1190-our tracks with the advantage , perhaps , of [a perfected monoplane]1236-a perfected monoplane , should find this bundle of manuscript , in any case [I]0-i can see that what [I]0-i am writing is destined to immortality as a classic of true adventure .

On the morning after [our]1190-our being trapped upon [the plateau]789-the plateau by [the villainous Gomez]1238-the villainous gomez [we]1190-our began a new stage in [our]1190-our experiences . The first incident in it was not such as to give [me]0-i a very favorable opinion of the place to which [we]1190-our had wandered . As [I]0-i roused [myself]0-i from a short nap after day had dawned , [my]0-i eyes fell upon a most singular appearance upon [my]0-i own leg . [My]0-i trouser had slipped up , exposing a few inches of [my]0-i skin above [my]0-i sock . On this there rested a large , purplish grape . Astonished at the sight , [I]0-i leaned forward to pick it off , when , to [my]0-i horror , it burst between [my]0-i finger and thumb , squirting blood in every direction . [My]0-i cry of disgust had brought [the two professors]1239-the two professors to [my]0-i side .

" Most interesting , "[182-summerlee] said [Summerlee]182-summerlee , bending over [my]0-i shin . " An enormous blood - tick , as yet , [I]182-summerlee believe , unclassified . "[182-summerlee]

" The first - fruits of [our]1190-our labors , "[142-challenger] said [Challenger]142-challenger in [his]142-challenger booming , pedantic fashion . " [We]1190-our can not do less than call it [Ixodes Maloni]214-ixodes maloni . The very small inconvenience of being bitten , [[my]142-challenger young friend]2927-my young friend , can not , [I]142-challenger am sure , weigh with [you]2927-my young friend as against the glorious privilege of having [your]2927-my young friend name inscribed in the deathless roll of zoology . Unhappily [you]2927-my young friend have crushed this fine specimen at the moment of satiation . "[142-challenger]

" [Filthy vermin]2972-filthy vermin ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried .

[Professor Challenger]142-challenger raised [his]142-challenger great eyebrows in protest , and placed a soothing paw upon [my]0-i shoulder .

" [You]0-i should cultivate the scientific eye and the detached scientific mind , "[142-challenger] said [he]142-challenger . " To [a man of philosophic temperament like [myself]142-challenger]2973-a man of philosophic temperament like myself the blood - tick , with its lancet - like proboscis and its distending stomach , is as beautiful a work of Nature as the peacock or , for that matter , the aurora borealis . It pains [me]142-challenger to hear [you]2927-my young friend speak of it in so unappreciative a fashion . No doubt , with due diligence , [we]1240-we can secure some other specimen . "[142-challenger]

" There can be no doubt of that , "[182-summerlee] said [Summerlee]182-summerlee , grimly , " for one has just disappeared behind [your]142-challenger shirt - collar . "[182-summerlee]

[Challenger]142-challenger sprang into the air bellowing like a bull , and tore frantically at [his]142-challenger coat and shirt to get them off . [Summerlee]182-summerlee and [I]0-i laughed so that [we]1240-we could hardly help [him]142-challenger . At last [we]1240-we exposed that monstrous torso fifty - four inches , by [the tailor]1241-the tailor 's tape . [His]142-challenger body was all matted with black hair , out of which jungle [we]1240-we picked the wandering tick before it had bitten [him]142-challenger . But the bushes round were full of the horrible pests , and it was clear that [we]1240-we must shift [[our]1240-we camp]948-our camp .

But first of all it was necessary to make [our]1240-we arrangements with [the faithful negro , who appeared presently on the pinnacle with a number of tins of cocoa and biscuits , which [he]1243-the faithful negro , who appeared presently on the pinnacle with a number of tins of cocoa and biscuits , which he tossed over to us tossed over to [us]1240-we]1243-the faithful negro , who appeared presently on the pinnacle with a number of tins of cocoa and biscuits , which he tossed over to us . [The Indians]893-the indians were to have the remainder as a reward for [their]893-the indians services and as payment for taking [our]1240-we letters back to [the Amazon]1246-the amazon . Some hours later [we]1240-we saw [them]893-the indians in single file far out upon [the plain]1079-the plain , each with a bundle on [his]1243-the faithful negro , who appeared presently on the pinnacle with a number of tins of cocoa and biscuits , which he tossed over to us head , making [their]893-the indians way back along [the path [we]1240-we had come]1248-the path we had come . [Zambo]195-zambo occupied [[our]1240-we little tent at [the base of [the pinnacle]1208-the pinnacle]1250-the base of the pinnacle]1249-our little tent at the base of the pinnacle , and there [he]195-zambo remained , [our]1240-we one link with [the world below]1252-the world below .

And now [we]1240-we had to decide upon [our]1240-we immediate movements . [We]1240-we shifted [our]1240-we position from among the tick - laden bushes until [we]1240-we came to a small clearing thickly surrounded by trees upon all sides . There were some flat slabs of rock in the center , with [an excellent well close by]1253-an excellent well close by , and there [we]1240-we sat in cleanly comfort while [we]1240-we made [our]1240-we first plans for the invasion of [this new country]1254-this new country . Birds were calling among the foliage - especially one with a peculiar whooping cry which was new to [us]1240-we - but beyond these sounds there were no signs of life .

[Our]1240-we first care was to make some sort of list of [our]1240-we own stores , so that [we]1240-we might know what [we]1240-we had to rely upon . What with the things [we]1240-we had [ourselves]1240-we brought up and those which [Zambo]195-zambo had sent across on the rope , [we]1240-we were fairly well supplied . Most important of all , in view of the dangers which might surround [us]1240-we , [we]1240-we had [our]1240-we four rifles and one thousand three hundred rounds , also a shot - gun , but not more than a hundred and fifty medium pellet cartridges . In the matter of provisions [we]1240-we had enough to last for several weeks , with a sufficiency of tobacco and a few scientific implements , including a large telescope and a good field - glass . All these things [we]1240-we collected together in [the clearing]1255-the clearing , and as a first precaution , [we]1240-we cut down with [our]1240-we hatchet and knives a number of thorny bushes , which [we]1240-we piled round in a circle some fifteen yards in diameter . This was to be [[our]1240-we headquarters]1256-our headquarters for the time - [our]1240-we place of refuge against sudden danger and [the guard - house]1257-the guard - house for [[our]1240-we stores]1258-our stores . [Fort Challenger]87-fort challenger , [we]1240-we called [it]87-fort challenger .

It was midday before [we]1240-we had made [ourselves]1240-we secure , but the heat was not oppressive , and the general character of [the plateau]789-the plateau , both in [its]789-the plateau temperature and in [its]789-the plateau vegetation , was almost temperate . The beech , the oak , and even the birch were to be found among the tangle of trees which girt [us]1240-we in . One huge gingko tree , topping all the others , shot its great limbs and maidenhair foliage over [the fort which [we]1240-we had constructed]1260-the fort which we had constructed . In [its]789-the plateau shade [we]1240-we continued [our]1240-we discussion , while [Lord John]181-lord john , who had quickly taken command in the hour of action , gave [us]1240-we [his]181-lord john views .

" So long as [neither man]2974-neither man nor beast has seen or heard [us]1240-we , [we]1240-we are safe , "[181-lord john] said [he]181-lord john . " From the time [they]2975-they know [we]1240-we are [here]2484-here [our]1240-we troubles begin . There are no signs that [they]2975-they have found [us]1240-we out as yet . So [our]1240-we game surely is to lie low for a time and spy out [the land]2977-the land . [We]1240-we want to have a good look at [[our]1240-we neighbors]2497-our neighbors before [we]1240-we get on visitin ' terms . "[181-lord john]

" But [we]1240-we must advance , "[0-i] [I]0-i ventured to remark .

" By all means , sonny [[my]181-lord john boy]2979-my boy ! [We]1240-we will advance . But with common sense . [We]1240-we must never go so far that [we]1240-we ca n't get back to [[our]1240-we base]2980-our base . Above all , [we]1240-we must never , unless it is life or death , fire off [our]1240-we guns . "[181-lord john]

" But [YOU]0-i fired yesterday , "[182-summerlee] said [Summerlee]182-summerlee .

" Well , it could n't be helped . However , the wind was strong and blew outwards . It is not likely that the sound could have traveled far into [the plateau]789-the plateau . By the way , what shall [we]1240-we call [this place]2968-this place ? [I]181-lord john suppose it is up to [us]1240-we to give [it]2968-this place a name ? "[181-lord john]

There were several suggestions , more or less happy , but [Challenger]142-challenger 's was final .

" It can only have one name , "[182-summerlee] said [he]182-summerlee . " It is called after [the pioneer who discovered it]2983-the pioneer who discovered it . It is [Maple White Land]215-maple white land . "[182-summerlee]

[Maple White Land]215-maple white land [it]215-maple white land became , and so it is named in that chart which has become [my]0-i special task . So it will , [I]0-i trust , appear in the atlas of the future .

The peaceful penetration of [Maple White Land]215-maple white land was the pressing subject before [us]1261-we . [We]1261-we had the evidence of [our]1261-we own eyes that [the place]927-the place was inhabited by [some unknown creatures]1263-some unknown creatures , and there was that of [Maple White]215-maple white land 's sketch - book to show that [more dreadful and more dangerous monsters]1264-more dreadful and more dangerous monsters might still appear . That there might also prove to be [human occupants]1265-human occupants and that [they]1265-human occupants were of a malevolent character was suggested by [the skeleton impaled upon the bamboos , which could not have got there had it not been dropped from above]1266-the skeleton impaled upon the bamboos , which could not have got there had it not been dropped from above . [Our]1261-we situation , stranded without possibility of escape in [such a land]1267-such a land , was clearly full of danger , and [our]1261-we reasons endorsed every measure of caution which [Lord John]181-lord john 's experience could suggest . Yet it was surely impossible that [we]1261-we should halt on the edge of [this world of mystery]1268-this world of mystery when [our]1261-we very souls were tingling with impatience to push forward and to pluck the heart from it .

[We]1261-we therefore blocked the entrance to [[our]1261-we zareba]1269-our zareba by filling [it]1269-our zareba up with several thorny bushes , and left [[our]1261-we camp]948-our camp with the stores entirely surrounded by this protecting hedge . [We]1261-we then slowly and cautiously set forth into [the unknown]781-the unknown , following the course of [the little stream which flowed from [our]1261-we spring]1272-the little stream which flowed from our spring , as it should always serve [us]1261-we as a guide on [our]1261-we return .

Hardly had [we]1261-we started when [we]1261-we came across signs that there were indeed wonders awaiting [us]1261-we . After a few hundred yards of thick forest , containing many trees which were quite unknown to [me]0-i , but which [Summerlee]182-summerlee , who was [the botanist of the party]1273-the botanist of the party , recognized as forms of conifera and of cycadaceous plants which have long passed away in [the world below]1252-the world below , [we]1261-we entered [a region where [the stream]760-the stream widened out and formed [a considerable bog]1277-a considerable bog]1275-a region where the stream widened out and formed a considerable bog . High reeds of a peculiar type grew thickly before [us]1261-we , which were pronounced to be equisetacea , or mare's - tails , with tree - ferns scattered amongst them , all of them swaying in a brisk wind . Suddenly [Lord John]181-lord john , who was walking first , halted with uplifted hand .

" Look at this ! "[181-lord john] said [he]181-lord john . " By [George]144-george , this must be the trail of [the father of all birds]2984-the father of all birds ! "[181-lord john]

An enormous three - toed track was imprinted in the soft mud before [us]1261-we . The creature , whatever it was , had crossed [the swamp]1278-the swamp and had passed on into [the forest]897-the forest . [We]1261-we all stopped to examine that monstrous spoor . If it were indeed a bird - and what animal could leave such a mark ? - its foot was so much larger than an ostrich 's that its height upon the same scale must be enormous . [Lord John]181-lord john looked eagerly round [him]181-lord john and slipped two cartridges into [his]181-lord john elephant - gun .

" [I]181-lord john 'll stake [my]181-lord john good name as [a shikarree]2985-a shikarree , "[181-lord john] said [he]181-lord john , " that the track is a fresh one . [The creature]2986-the creature has not passed ten minutes . Look how the water is still oozing into that deeper print ! By [Jove]216-jove ! See , here is the mark of a little one ! "[181-lord john]

Sure enough , [smaller tracks of the same general form]1280-smaller tracks of the same general form were running parallel to the large ones .

" But what do [you]182-summerlee make of this ? "[182-summerlee] cried [Professor Summerlee]182-summerlee , triumphantly , pointing to what looked like the huge print of a five - fingered human hand appearing among the three - toed marks .

" [Wealden]34-the wealden ! "[142-challenger] cried [Challenger]142-challenger , in an ecstasy . " [I]142-challenger 've seen them in [the Wealden clay]2987-the wealden clay . It is a creature walking erect upon three - toed feet , and occasionally putting one of its five - fingered forepaws upon the ground . Not a bird , [my]142-challenger dear [Roxton]181-lord john - not a bird . "[142-challenger]

" A beast ? "[181-lord john]

" No ; a reptile - a dinosaur . Nothing else could have left such a track . [They]1283-they puzzled [a worthy Sussex doctor]2988-a worthy sussex doctor some ninety years ago ; but who in [the world]2307-the world could have hoped - hoped - to have seen a sight like that ? "[142-challenger]

[His]181-lord john words died away into a whisper , and [we]1281-we all stood in motionless amazement . Following the tracks , [we]1281-we had left [the morass]1100-the morass and passed through a screen of brushwood and trees . Beyond was an open glade , and in this were five of the most extraordinary creatures that [I]0-i have ever seen . Crouching down among the bushes , [we]1281-we observed [them]1283-they at [our]1281-we leisure .

There were , as [I]0-i say , five of [them]1283-they , [two being adults]1284-two being adults and [three young ones]1285-three young ones . In size [they]1283-they were enormous . Even [the babies]1286-the babies were as big as elephants , while [the two large ones]1287-the two large ones were far beyond all creatures [I]0-i have ever seen . [They]1283-they had slate - colored skin , which was scaled like a lizard 's and shimmered where the sun shone upon it . All five were sitting up , balancing [themselves]1283-they upon [their]1283-they broad , powerful tails and [their]1283-they huge three - toed hind - feet , while with [their]1283-they small five - fingered front - feet [they]1283-they pulled down the branches upon which [they]1283-they browsed . [I]0-i do not know that [I]0-i can bring [their]1283-they appearance home to [you]1288-you better than by saying that [they]1283-they looked like monstrous kangaroos , twenty feet in length , and with skins like black crocodiles .

[I]0-i do not know how long [we]1289-we stayed motionless gazing at this marvelous spectacle . A strong wind blew towards [us]1289-we and [we]1289-we were well concealed , so there was no chance of discovery . From time to time [the little ones]1290-the little ones played round [[their]1290-the little ones parents]1291-their parents in unwieldy gambols , the great beasts bounding into the air and falling with dull thuds upon [the earth]2576-the earth . The strength of [the parents]1293-the parents seemed to be limitless , for one of [them]1293-the parents , having some difficulty in reaching a bunch of foliage which grew upon a considerable - sized tree , put [his]1294-his fore - legs round the trunk and tore it down as if it had been a sapling . The action seemed , as [I]0-i thought , to show not only the great development of its muscles , but also the small one of [its]1295-its brain , for the whole weight came crashing down upon the top of [it]1295-its , and it uttered a series of shrill yelps to show that , big as it was , there was a limit to what it could endure . The incident made [it]1295-its think , apparently , that [the neighborhood]1296-the neighborhood was dangerous , for it slowly lurched off through the wood , followed by its mate and [[its]1295-its three enormous infants]1297-its three enormous infants . [We]1289-we saw the shimmering slaty gleam of [their]1283-they skins between the tree - trunks , and [their]1283-they heads undulating high above the brush - wood . Then [they]1283-they vanished from [our]1289-we sight .

[I]0-i looked at [[my]0-i comrades]662-my comrades . [Lord John]181-lord john was standing at gaze with [his]181-lord john finger on the trigger of [his]181-lord john elephant - gun , [[his]181-lord john eager hunter]1299-his eager hunter 's soul shining from [his]181-lord john fierce eyes . What would [he]181-lord john not give for one such head to place between the two crossed oars above the mantelpiece in [his]181-lord john snuggery at [the Albany]89-the albany ! And yet [his]181-lord john reason held [him]181-lord john in , for all [our]1289-we exploration of [the wonders of [this unknown land]1301-this unknown land]1300-the wonders of this unknown land depended upon [our]1289-we presence being concealed from [its inhabitants]1302-its inhabitants . [The two professors]1239-the two professors were in silent ecstasy . In [their]1239-the two professors excitement [they]1239-the two professors had unconsciously seized each other by the hand , and stood like [two little children in the presence of a marvel]1304-two little children in the presence of a marvel , [Challenger]142-challenger 's cheeks bunched up into a seraphic smile , and [Summerlee]182-summerlee 's sardonic face softening for the moment into wonder and reverence .

" Nunc dimittis ! "[142-challenger] [he]142-challenger cried at last . " What will [they]1239-the two professors say in [England]41-england of this ? "[142-challenger]

" [[My]142-challenger dear]2487-my dear [Summerlee]182-summerlee , [I]142-challenger will tell [you]182-summerlee with great confidence exactly what [they]1239-the two professors will say in [England]41-england , "[142-challenger] said [Challenger]142-challenger . " [They]1239-the two professors will say that [you]182-summerlee are [an infernal liar]2991-an infernal liar and [a scientific charlatan]2992-a scientific charlatan , exactly as [you]182-summerlee and [others]458-others said of [me]142-challenger . " In the face of photographs ? "[142-challenger]

" Faked , [Summerlee]182-summerlee ! Clumsily faked ! "[142-challenger]

" In the face of specimens ? "[142-challenger]

" Ah , there [we]2994-we may have [them]1239-the two professors ! [Malone]145-mr. malone and [[his]145-mr. malone filthy Fleet Street crew]2995-his filthy fleet street crew may be all yelping [our]2994-we praises yet . August the twenty - eighth - the day [we]2994-we saw five live iguanodons in [a glade of [Maple White Land]215-maple white land]2996-a glade of maple white land . " If ever [we]2994-we get out of this alive , [I]181-lord john must have a head with [me]181-lord john , "[181-lord john] said [Lord John]181-lord john . " [Lord]3002-lord , how [some of that Somaliland - Uganda crowd]3003-some of that somaliland - uganda crowd would turn a beautiful pea - green if [they]3003-some of that somaliland - uganda crowd saw it ! [I]181-lord john do n't know what [you]3002-lord chaps think , but it strikes [me]181-lord john that [we]2994-we are on mighty thin ice all this time . "[181-lord john]

[I]0-i had the same feeling of mystery and danger around [us]1305-we . In the gloom of the trees there seemed a constant menace and as [we]1305-we looked up into [their]1306-their shadowy foliage vague terrors crept into [one]2316-one 's heart . It is true that these monstrous creatures which [we]1305-we had seen were lumbering , [inoffensive brutes which were unlikely to hurt anyone]1308-inoffensive brutes which were unlikely to hurt anyone , but in [this world of wonders]1309-this world of wonders what other survivals might there not be - what fierce , active horrors ready to pounce upon [us]1305-we from [their]1306-their lair among the rocks or brushwood ? [I]0-i knew little of prehistoric life , but [I]0-i had a clear remembrance of one book which [I]0-i had read in which it spoke of creatures who would live upon [our]1305-we lions and tigers as a cat lives upon mice . What if these also were to be found in [the woods of [Maple White Land]215-maple white land]1310-the woods of maple white land !

It was destined that on this very morning - [our]1305-we first in [the new country]1311-the new country - [we]1305-we were to find out what strange hazards lay around [us]1305-we . It was a loathsome adventure , and one of which [I]0-i hate to think . If , as [Lord John]181-lord john said , [the glade of [the iguanodons]1313-the iguanodons]1312-the glade of the iguanodons will remain with [us]1305-we as a dream , then surely the swamp of the pterodactyls will forever be [our]1305-we nightmare . Let [me]0-i set down exactly what occurred .

[We]1305-we passed very slowly through [the woods]2543-the woods , partly because [Lord Roxton]181-lord john acted as [scout]1315-scout before [he]181-lord john would let [us]1305-we advance , and partly because at every second step [one or other of [[our]1305-we professors]922-our professors]1316-one or other of our professors would fall , with a cry of wonder , before some flower or insect which presented [him]181-lord john with a new type . [We]1305-we may have traveled two or three miles in all , keeping to the right of the line of [the stream]760-the stream , when [we]1305-we came upon a considerable opening in the trees . A belt of brushwood led up to a tangle of rocks - [the whole plateau]1319-the whole plateau was strewn with boulders . [We]1305-we were walking slowly towards these rocks , among bushes which reached over [our]1305-we waists , when [we]1305-we became aware of a strange low gabbling and whistling sound , which filled the air with a constant clamor and appeared to come from some spot immediately before [us]1305-we . [Lord John]181-lord john held up [his]181-lord john hand as a signal for [us]1305-we to stop , and [he]181-lord john made [his]181-lord john way swiftly , stooping and running , to the line of rocks . [We]1305-we saw [him]181-lord john peep over them and give a gesture of amazement . Then [he]181-lord john stood staring as if forgetting [us]1305-we , so utterly entranced was [he]181-lord john by what [he]181-lord john saw . Finally [he]181-lord john waved [us]1305-we to come on , holding up [his]181-lord john hand as a signal for caution . [His]181-lord john whole bearing made [me]0-i feel that something wonderful but dangerous lay before [us]1305-we .

Creeping to [his]181-lord john side , [we]1305-we looked over [the rocks]1029-the rocks . The place into which [we]1305-we gazed was a pit , and may , in the early days , have been one of [the smaller volcanic blow - holes of [the plateau]789-the plateau]1321-the smaller volcanic blow - holes of the plateau . [It]789-the plateau was bowl - shaped and at the bottom , some hundreds of yards from where [we]1305-we lay , were pools of green - scummed , stagnant water , fringed with bullrushes . [It]789-the plateau was [a weird place in [itself]789-the plateau]1323-a weird place in itself , but [its]789-the plateau occupants made [it]789-the plateau seem like a scene from [the Seven Circles of Dante]1324-the seven circles of dante . [The place]927-the place was [a rookery of pterodactyls]1326-a rookery of pterodactyls . There were hundreds of [them]1029-the rocks congregated within view . [All the bottom area round [the water - edge]1328-the water - edge]1327-all the bottom area round the water - edge was alive with [[their]1029-the rocks young ones]1329-their young ones , and with [hideous mothers]1330-hideous mothers brooding upon [their]1029-the rocks leathery , yellowish eggs . From this crawling flapping mass of obscene reptilian life came the shocking clamor which filled the air and the mephitic , horrible , musty odor which turned [us]1305-we sick . But above , perched each upon its own stone , tall , gray , and withered , more like dead and dried specimens than actual living creatures , sat [the horrible males]1331-the horrible males , absolutely motionless save for the rolling of [their]1331-the horrible males red eyes or an occasional snap of [their]1331-the horrible males rat - trap beaks as a dragon - fly went past [them]1331-the horrible males . [Their]1331-the horrible males huge , membranous wings were closed by folding [their]1331-the horrible males fore - arms , so that [they]1331-the horrible males sat like [gigantic old women , wrapped in hideous web - colored shawls , and with [their]1331-the horrible males ferocious heads protruding above [them]1331-the horrible males]1332-gigantic old women , wrapped in hideous web - colored shawls , and with their ferocious heads protruding above them . Large and small , not less than a thousand of [these filthy creatures]1333-these filthy creatures lay in [the hollow before [us]1305-we]1334-the hollow before us .

[[Our]1305-we professors]922-our professors would gladly have stayed there all day , so entranced were [they]922-our professors by this opportunity of studying the life of a prehistoric age . [They]922-our professors pointed out the fish and dead birds lying about among the rocks as proving the nature of the food of these creatures , and [I]0-i heard [them]922-our professors congratulating [each other]2795-each other on having cleared up the point why the bones of this flying dragon are found in such great numbers in certain well - defined areas , as in [the Cambridge Green - sand]1337-the cambridge green - sand , since it was now seen that , like penguins , [they]1333-these filthy creatures lived in gregarious fashion .

Finally , however , [Challenger]142-challenger , bent upon proving some point which [Summerlee]182-summerlee had contested , thrust [his]142-challenger head over [the rock]2875-the rock and nearly brought destruction upon [us]1305-we all . In an instant [the nearest male]1339-the nearest male gave a shrill , whistling cry , and flapped its twenty - foot span of leathery wings as it soared up into the air . [The females]1340-the females and [young ones]1341-young ones huddled together beside [the water]1342-the water , while [the whole circle of sentinels]1343-the whole circle of sentinels rose one after the other and sailed off into the sky . It was a wonderful sight to see at least [a hundred creatures of such enormous size and hideous appearance]1344-a hundred creatures of such enormous size and hideous appearance all swooping like swallows with swift , shearing wing - strokes above [us]1305-we ; but soon [we]1305-we realized that it was not one on which [we]1305-we could afford to linger . At first [the great brutes]1345-the great brutes flew round in a huge ring , as if to make sure what the exact extent of the danger might be . Then , the flight grew lower and the circle narrower , until [they]1345-the great brutes were whizzing round and round [us]1305-we , the dry , rustling flap of [their]1345-the great brutes huge slate - colored wings filling the air with a volume of sound that made [me]0-i think of [Hendon]218-hendon aerodrome upon a race day .

" Make for the wood and keep together , "[181-lord john] cried [Lord John]181-lord john , clubbing [his]181-lord john rifle . " [The brutes]3004-the brutes mean mischief . "[181-lord john]

The moment [we]1305-we attempted to retreat the circle closed in upon [us]1305-we , until the tips of the wings of those nearest to [us]1305-we nearly touched [our]1305-we faces . [We]1305-we beat at [them]1345-the great brutes with the stocks of [our]1305-we guns , but there was nothing solid or vulnerable to strike . Then suddenly out of the whizzing , slate - colored circle a long neck shot out , and a fierce beak made a thrust at [us]1305-we . Another and another followed . [Summerlee]182-summerlee gave a cry and put [his]182-summerlee hand to [his]182-summerlee face , from which the blood was streaming . [I]0-i felt a prod at the back of [my]0-i neck , and turned dizzy with the shock . [Challenger]142-challenger fell , and as [I]0-i stooped to pick [him]142-challenger up [I]0-i was again struck from behind and dropped on the top of [him]142-challenger . At the same instant [I]0-i heard the crash of [Lord John]181-lord john 's elephant - gun , and , looking up , saw one of the creatures with a broken wing struggling upon the ground , spitting and gurgling at [us]1305-we with a wide - opened beak and blood - shot , goggled eyes , like some devil in a medieval picture . [[Its]1346-its comrades]1347-its comrades had flown higher at the sudden sound , and were circling above [our]1305-we heads .

" Now , "[181-lord john] cried [Lord John]181-lord john , " now for [our]1305-we lives ! "[181-lord john]

[We]1305-we staggered through the brushwood , and even as [we]1305-we reached [the trees]1348-the trees [the harpies]1349-the harpies were on [us]1305-we again . [Summerlee]182-summerlee was knocked down , but [we]1305-we tore [him]182-summerlee up and rushed among the trunks . Once there [we]1305-we were safe , for those huge wings had no space for their sweep beneath the branches . As [we]1305-we limped homewards , sadly mauled and discomfited , [we]1305-we saw [them]1349-the harpies for a long time flying at a great height against the deep blue sky above [our]1305-we heads , soaring round and round , no bigger than wood - pigeons , with [their]1349-the harpies eyes no doubt still following [our]1305-we progress . At last , however , as [we]1305-we reached [the thicker woods]1350-the thicker woods [they]1349-the harpies gave up the chase , and [we]1305-we saw [them]1349-the harpies no more .

" A most interesting and convincing experience , "[142-challenger] said [Challenger]142-challenger , as [we]1305-we halted beside [the brook]1351-the brook and [he]142-challenger bathed a swollen knee . " [We]1305-we are exceptionally well informed , [Summerlee]182-summerlee , as to the habits of the enraged pterodactyl . "[142-challenger]

[Summerlee]182-summerlee was wiping the blood from a cut in [his]182-summerlee forehead , while [I]0-i was tying up a nasty stab in the muscle of the neck . [Lord John]181-lord john had the shoulder of [his]181-lord john coat torn away , but the creature 's teeth had only grazed the flesh .

" It is worth noting , "[142-challenger] [Challenger]142-challenger continued , " that [[our]1305-we young friend]2889-our young friend has received an undoubted stab , while [Lord John]181-lord john 's coat could only have been torn by a bite . "[142-challenger]

" It has been touch and go for [our]1305-we lives , "[181-lord john] said [Lord John]181-lord john , gravely , " and [I]181-lord john could not think of a more rotten sort of death than to be outed by such filthy vermin . " [We]1305-we should not be [here]2484-here if [you]142-challenger had n't , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , with conviction .

But now , if [you]0-i are of [my]142-challenger opinion , [we]1354-we have had thrills enough for one day , and had best get back to the surgical box at [the camp]669-the camp for some carbolic . But surely [no men]976-no men ever had just such a day since [the world]2307-the world began . Some fresh surprise was ever in store for [us]1354-we . When , following the course of [[our]1354-we brook]1355-our brook , [we]1354-we at last reached [[our]1354-we glade]1356-our glade and saw the thorny barricade of [[our]1354-we camp]948-our camp , [we]1354-we thought that [our]1354-we adventures were at an end . But [we]1354-we had something more to think of before [we]1354-we could rest . [The gate of [Fort Challenger]87-fort challenger]1358-the gate of fort challenger had been untouched , the walls were unbroken , and yet [it]1358-the gate of fort challenger had been visited by [some strange and powerful creature]1359-some strange and powerful creature in [our]1354-we absence . No foot - mark showed a trace of its nature , and only the overhanging branch of the enormous ginko tree suggested how it might have come and gone ; but of its malevolent strength there was ample evidence in the condition of [[our]1354-we stores]1258-our stores . They were strewn at random all over the ground , and one tin of meat had been crushed into pieces so as to extract the contents . A case of cartridges had been shattered into matchwood , and one of the brass shells lay shredded into pieces beside it . Again the feeling of vague horror came upon [our]1354-we souls , and [we]1354-we gazed round with frightened eyes at the dark shadows which lay around [us]1354-we , in all of which some fearsome shape might be lurking . How good it was when [we]1354-we were hailed by the voice of [Zambo]195-zambo , and , going to [the edge of [the plateau]789-the plateau]1186-the edge of the plateau , saw [him]195-zambo sitting grinning at [us]1354-we upon [the top of [the opposite pinnacle]1364-the opposite pinnacle]1363-the top of the opposite pinnacle .

" All well , [Massa Challenger]93-massa challenger , all well ! "[195-zambo] [he]195-zambo cried . " [Me]195-zambo stay here . No fear . [You]1354-we always find [me]195-zambo when [you]1354-we want . "[195-zambo]

[His]195-zambo honest black face , and the immense view before [us]1354-we , which carried [us]1354-we half - way back to [the affluent of [the Amazon]24-the amazon]1365-the affluent of the amazon , helped [us]1354-we to remember that [we]1354-we really were upon [this earth]1366-this earth in the twentieth century , and had not by some magic been conveyed to [some raw planet in [its]1367-some raw planet in its earliest and wildest state earliest and wildest state]1367-some raw planet in its earliest and wildest state . How difficult it was to realize that the violet line upon the far horizon was well advanced to [that great river upon which [huge steamers]1369-huge steamers ran]1368-that great river upon which huge steamers ran , and [folk]2790-folk talked of the small affairs of life , while [we]1354-we , marooned among [the creatures of a bygone age]1371-the creatures of a bygone age , could but gaze towards it and yearn for all that it meant !

One other memory remains with [me]0-i of this wonderful day , and with it [I]0-i will close this letter . [The two professors]1239-the two professors , [their]1239-the two professors tempers aggravated no doubt by [their]1239-the two professors injuries , had fallen out as to whether [[our]1354-we assailants]1373-our assailants were of the genus pterodactylus or dimorphodon , and high words had ensued . To avoid [their]1239-the two professors wrangling [I]0-i moved some little way apart , and was seated smoking upon the trunk of a fallen tree , when [Lord John]181-lord john strolled over in [my]0-i direction .

" [I]181-lord john say , [Malone]145-mr. malone , "[181-lord john] said [he]181-lord john , " do [you]145-mr. malone remember that place where those beasts were ? "[181-lord john]

" Very clearly . "[181-lord john]

" A sort of volcanic pit , was it not ? "[181-lord john]

" Exactly , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" What of that ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

"[181-lord john] They were the last words [I]0-i heard before [I]0-i dropped into an exhausted sleep .

CHAPTER XI

" For once [I]181-lord john was [the Hero]3011-the hero "[181-lord john]

[Lord John Roxton]181-lord john was right when [he]181-lord john thought that some specially toxic quality might lie in the bite of the horrible creatures which had attacked [us]1375-our . On the morning after [our]1375-our first adventure upon [the plateau]789-the plateau , both [Summerlee]182-summerlee and [I]0-i were in great pain and fever , while [Challenger]142-challenger 's knee was so bruised that [he]142-challenger could hardly limp . [We]1375-our kept to [[our]1375-our camp]948-our camp all day , therefore , [Lord John]181-lord john busying [himself]181-lord john , with such help as [we]1375-our could give [him]181-lord john , in raising the height and thickness of the thorny walls which were [our]1375-our only defense . [I]0-i remember that during the whole long day [I]0-i was haunted by the feeling that [we]1375-our were closely observed , though by whom or whence [I]0-i could give no guess .

So strong was the impression that [I]0-i told [Professor Challenger]142-challenger of it , who put it down to the cerebral excitement caused by [my]0-i fever . Again and again [I]0-i glanced round swiftly , with the conviction that [I]0-i was about to see something , but only to meet the dark tangle of [our]1375-our hedge or the solemn and cavernous gloom of the great trees which arched above [our]1375-our heads . And yet the feeling grew ever stronger in [my]0-i own mind that something observant and something malevolent was at [our]1375-our very elbow . [I]0-i thought of the Indian superstition of [the Curupuri]168-curupuri - the dreadful , lurking spirit of [the woods]2543-the woods - and [I]0-i could have imagined that [his]181-lord john terrible presence haunted [those who had invaded [[his]181-lord john most remote and sacred retreat]1380-his most remote and sacred retreat]1379-those who had invaded his most remote and sacred retreat .

That night [[our]1375-our third in [Maple White Land]215-maple white land]1381-our third in maple white land [we]1375-our had an experience which left a fearful impression upon [our]1375-our minds , and made [us]1375-our thankful that [Lord John]181-lord john had worked so hard in making [our]1375-our retreat impregnable . [We]1375-our were all sleeping round [our]1375-our dying fire when [we]1375-our were aroused - or , rather , [I]0-i should say , shot out of [our]1375-our slumbers - by a succession of the most frightful cries and screams to which [I]0-i have ever listened . [I]0-i know no sound to which [I]0-i could compare this amazing tumult , which seemed to come from some spot within a few hundred yards of [[our]1375-our camp]948-our camp . It was as ear - splitting as any whistle of [a railway - engine]1383-a railway - engine ; but whereas the whistle is a clear , mechanical , sharp - edged sound , this was far deeper in volume and vibrant with the uttermost strain of agony and horror . [We]1375-our clapped [our]1375-our hands to [our]1375-our ears to shut out that nerve - shaking appeal . A cold sweat broke out over [my]0-i body , and [my]0-i heart turned sick at the misery of it . All the woes of tortured life , all its stupendous indictment of high heaven , its innumerable sorrows , seemed to be centered and condensed into that one dreadful , agonized cry . And then , under this high - pitched , ringing sound there was another , more intermittent , a low , deep - chested laugh , a growling , throaty gurgle of merriment which formed a grotesque accompaniment to the shriek with which it was blended . For three or four minutes on end the fearsome duet continued , while all the foliage rustled with the rising of startled birds . Then it shut off as suddenly as it began . For a long time [we]1375-our sat in horrified silence . Then [Lord John]181-lord john threw a bundle of twigs upon the fire , and their red glare lit up the intent faces of [[my]0-i companions]1384-my companions and flickered over the great boughs above [our]1375-our heads .

" What was it ? "[0-i] [I]0-i whispered .

" [We]1375-our shall know in the morning , "[181-lord john] said [Lord John]181-lord john . " It was close to [us]1375-our - not farther than [the glade]3012-the glade . "[181-lord john]

" [We]1375-our have been privileged to overhear a prehistoric tragedy , the sort of drama which occurred among the reeds upon [the border of [some Jurassic lagoon]3014-some jurassic lagoon]3013-the border of some jurassic lagoon , when the greater dragon pinned [the lesser among the slime]3015-the lesser among the slime , "[142-challenger] said [Challenger]142-challenger , with more solemnity than [I]0-i had ever heard in [his]142-challenger voice . " It was surely well for [man]2341-man that [he]2341-man came late in the order of creation . There were powers abroad in earlier days which no courage and no mechanism of [his]2341-man could have met . What could [his]2341-man sling , [his]2341-man throwing - stick , or [his]2341-man arrow avail [him]2341-man against such forces as have been loose to - night ? Even with a modern rifle it would be all odds on [the monster]3017-the monster . "[142-challenger]

" [I]181-lord john think [I]181-lord john should back [[my]181-lord john little friend]3018-my little friend , "[181-lord john] said [Lord John]181-lord john , caressing [his]181-lord john Express . " But the beast would certainly have a good sporting chance . "[181-lord john]

[Summerlee]182-summerlee raised [his]182-summerlee hand .

" Hush ! "[182-summerlee] [he]182-summerlee cried . " Surely [I]182-summerlee hear something ? "[182-summerlee]

From the utter silence there emerged a deep , regular pat - pat . It was the tread of some animal - the rhythm of soft but heavy pads placed cautiously upon the ground . [It]1385-it stole slowly round [the camp]669-the camp , and then halted near [our]1387-our gateway . There was a low , sibilant rise and fall - the breathing of the creature . Only [our]1387-our feeble hedge separated [us]1387-our from this horror of the night . [Each of [us]1387-our]1191-each of us had seized [his]1191-each of us rifle , and [Lord John]181-lord john had pulled out a small bush to make an embrasure in the hedge .

" By [George]144-george ! "[181-lord john] [he]181-lord john whispered . " [I]181-lord john think [I]181-lord john can see it ! "[181-lord john]

[I]0-i stooped and peered over [his]181-lord john shoulder through the gap . Yes , [I]0-i could see it , too . In the deep shadow of the tree there was a deeper shadow yet , black , inchoate , vague - a crouching form full of savage vigor and menace . It was no higher than a horse , but the dim outline suggested vast bulk and strength . That hissing pant , as regular and full - volumed as the exhaust of an engine , spoke of a monstrous organism . Once , as it moved , [I]0-i thought [I]0-i saw the glint of two terrible , greenish eyes . There was an uneasy rustling , as if it were crawling slowly forward .

" [I]0-i believe it is going to spring ! "[0-i] said [I]0-i , cocking [my]0-i rifle .

" Do n't fire ! Do n't fire ! "[181-lord john] whispered [Lord John]181-lord john . " The crash of a gun in this silent night would be heard for miles . Keep it as a last card . "[181-lord john]

" If it gets over the hedge [we]3019-we 're done , "[182-summerlee] said [Summerlee]182-summerlee , and [his]182-summerlee voice crackled into a nervous laugh as [he]182-summerlee spoke .

" No , it must not get over , "[181-lord john] cried [Lord John]181-lord john ; " but hold [your]0-i fire to the last . Perhaps [I]181-lord john can make something of [the fellow]2366-the fellow . [I]181-lord john 'll chance it , anyhow . "[181-lord john]

It was as brave an act as ever [I]0-i saw [a man]272-a man do . [He]272-a man stooped to the fire , picked up a blazing branch , and slipped in an instant through a sallyport which [he]272-a man had made in [[our]1390-we gateway]1391-our gateway . The thing moved forward with a dreadful snarl . [Lord John]181-lord john never hesitated , but , running towards [it]1392-it with a quick , light step , [he]181-lord john dashed the flaming wood into [the brute]1393-the brute 's face . For one moment [I]0-i had a vision of a horrible mask like [a giant toad 's , of a warty , leprous skin , and of a loose mouth all beslobbered with fresh blood]1394-a giant toad 's , of a warty , leprous skin , and of a loose mouth all beslobbered with fresh blood . " [I]181-lord john thought [he]1396-our dreadful visitor would n't face the fire , "[181-lord john] said [Lord John]181-lord john , laughing , as [he]181-lord john came back and threw [his]181-lord john branch among the faggots .

" [You]181-lord john should not have taken such a risk ! "[1390-we] [we]1390-we all cried .

" There was nothin' else to be done . [[Our]1390-we learned men]1397-our learned men looked at [each other]2795-each other with some hesitation .

" Personally , [I]182-summerlee am unable to classify the creature with any certainty , "[182-summerlee] said [Summerlee]182-summerlee , lighting [his]182-summerlee pipe from the fire .

" In refusing to commit [yourself]142-challenger [you]142-challenger are but showing a proper scientific reserve , "[142-challenger] said [Challenger]142-challenger , with massive condescension . " [I]142-challenger am not [myself]142-challenger prepared to go farther than to say in general terms that [we]1390-we have almost certainly been in contact to - night with some form of carnivorous dinosaur . " [We]1390-we have to bear in mind , "[182-summerlee] remarked [Summerlee]182-summerlee , " that there are many prehistoric forms which have never come down to [us]1390-we . It would be rash to suppose that [we]1390-we can give a name to all that [we]1390-we are likely to meet . "[182-summerlee]

" Exactly . A rough classification may be the best that [we]1390-we can attempt . To - morrow some further evidence may help [us]1390-we to an identification . Meantime [we]1390-we can only renew [our]1390-we interrupted slumbers . "[142-challenger]

" But not without [a sentinel]3023-a sentinel , "[181-lord john] said [Lord John]181-lord john , with decision . " [We]1390-we ca n't afford to take chances in [a country like this]3024-a country like this . Two - hour spells in the future , for each of [us]1390-we . "[181-lord john]

" Then [I]182-summerlee 'll just finish [my]182-summerlee pipe in starting the first one , "[182-summerlee] said [Professor Summerlee]182-summerlee ; and from that time onwards [we]1399-we never trusted [ourselves]1399-we again without [a watchman]1400-a watchman .

In the morning it was not long before [we]1399-we discovered the source of the hideous uproar which had aroused [us]1399-we in the night . [The iguanodon glade]1401-the iguanodon glade was the scene of a horrible butchery . From the pools of blood and the enormous lumps of flesh scattered in every direction over [the green sward]1402-the green sward [we]1399-we imagined at first that a number of animals had been killed , but on examining the remains more closely [we]1399-we discovered that all this carnage came from one of these unwieldy monsters , which had been literally torn to pieces by some creature not larger , perhaps , but far more ferocious , than itself .

[[Our]1399-we two professors]862-our two professors sat in absorbed argument , examining piece after piece , which showed the marks of savage teeth and of enormous claws .

" [Our]1399-we judgment must still be in abeyance , "[142-challenger] said [Professor Challenger]142-challenger , with a huge slab of whitish - colored flesh across [his]142-challenger knee . " The indications would be consistent with the presence of a saber - toothed tiger , such as are still found among the breccia of [[our]1399-we caverns]3025-our caverns ; but the creature actually seen was undoubtedly of a larger and more reptilian character . Personally , [I]142-challenger should pronounce for allosaurus . "[142-challenger]

" Or megalosaurus , "[182-summerlee] said [Summerlee]182-summerlee .

" Exactly . Any one of the larger carnivorous dinosaurs would meet the case . Among them are to be found all the most terrible types of animal life that have ever cursed [the earth]2576-the earth or blessed [a museum]3027-a museum . "[142-challenger] [He]142-challenger laughed sonorously at [his]142-challenger own conceit , for , though [he]142-challenger had little sense of humor , the crudest pleasantry from [his]142-challenger own lips moved [him]142-challenger always to roars of appreciation .

" The less noise the better , "[181-lord john] said [Lord Roxton]181-lord john , curtly . " [We]1399-we do n't know who or what may be near [us]1399-we . By the way , what is this mark upon the iguanodon 's hide ? "[181-lord john]

On the dull , scaly , slate - colored skin somewhere above the shoulder , there was a singular black circle of some substance which looked like asphalt . [None of [us]1405-us]1226-none of us could suggest what it meant , though [Summerlee]182-summerlee was of opinion that [he]182-summerlee had seen something similar upon one of [the young ones two days before]1406-the young ones two days before . [Challenger]142-challenger said nothing , but looked pompous and puffy , as if [he]142-challenger could if [he]142-challenger would , so that finally [Lord John]181-lord john asked [his]142-challenger opinion direct .

" If [[your]181-lord john lordship]3029-your lordship will graciously permit [me]142-challenger to open [my]142-challenger mouth , [I]142-challenger shall be happy to express [my]142-challenger sentiments , "[142-challenger] said [he]142-challenger , with elaborate sarcasm . " [I]142-challenger am not in the habit of being taken to task in the fashion which seems to be customary with [[your]181-lord john lordship]3029-your lordship . It was not until [he]142-challenger had received [his]142-challenger apology that [[our]1407-we touchy friend]1408-our touchy friend would suffer [himself]142-challenger to be appeased . When at last [his]142-challenger ruffled feelings were at ease , [he]142-challenger addressed [us]1407-we at some length from [his]142-challenger seat upon a fallen tree , speaking , as [his]142-challenger habit was , as if [he]142-challenger were imparting most precious information to [a class of a thousand]1409-a class of a thousand .

" With regard to the marking , "[142-challenger] said [he]142-challenger , " [I]142-challenger am inclined to agree with [[my]142-challenger friend]319-my friend and colleague , [Professor Summerlee]182-summerlee , that the stains are from asphalt . As [this plateau]2888-this plateau is , in its very nature , highly volcanic , and as asphalt is a substance which one associates with Plutonic forces , [I]142-challenger can not doubt that it exists in the free liquid state , and that the creatures may have come in contact with it . A much more important problem is the question as to the existence of the carnivorous monster which has left its traces in [this glade]3033-this glade . [We]1407-we know roughly that [this plateau]2888-this plateau is not larger than [an average English county]3035-an average english county . Within this confined space a certain number of creatures , mostly types which have passed away in [the world below]1252-the world below , have lived together for innumerable years . Now , it is very clear to [me]142-challenger that in so long a period one would have expected that the carnivorous creatures , multiplying unchecked , would have exhausted [their]3037-their food supply and have been compelled to either modify [their]3037-their flesh - eating habits or die of hunger . This [we]1407-we see has not been so . [We]1407-we can only imagine , therefore , that the balance of Nature is preserved by some check which limits the numbers of these ferocious creatures . One of the many interesting problems , therefore , which await [our]1407-we solution is to discover what that check may be and how it operates . [I]142-challenger venture to trust that [we]1407-we may have some future opportunity for the closer study of the carnivorous dinosaurs . "[142-challenger]

" And [I]0-i venture to trust [we]1407-we may not , "[0-i] [I]0-i observed .

[The Professor]2374-the professor only raised [his]2374-the professor great eyebrows , as [the schoolmaster]1411-the schoolmaster meets the irrelevant observation of [the naughty boy]1412-the naughty boy .

" Perhaps [Professor Summerlee]182-summerlee may have an observation to make , "[2374-the professor] [he]2374-the professor said , and [the two savants]1413-the two savants ascended together into some rarefied scientific atmosphere , where the possibilities of a modification of the birth - rate were weighed against the decline of the food supply as a check in the struggle for existence .

That morning [we]1414-we mapped out [a small portion of [the plateau]789-the plateau]1415-a small portion of the plateau , avoiding [the swamp of the pterodactyls]1417-the swamp of the pterodactyls , and keeping to the east of [[our]1414-we brook]1355-our brook instead of to the west . In that direction [the country]2801-the country was still thickly wooded , with so much undergrowth that [our]1414-we progress was very slow .

[I]0-i have dwelt up to now upon the terrors of [Maple White Land]215-maple white land ; but there was another side to the subject , for all that morning [we]1414-we wandered among lovely flowers - mostly , as [I]0-i observed , white or yellow in color , these being , as [[our]1414-we professors]922-our professors explained , the primitive flower - shades . In many places the ground was absolutely covered with them , and as [we]1414-we walked ankle - deep on that wonderful yielding carpet , the scent was almost intoxicating in its sweetness and intensity . The homely English bee buzzed everywhere around [us]1414-we . Many of [the trees under which [we]1414-we passed]1421-the trees under which we passed had their branches bowed down with fruit , some of which were of familiar sorts , while other varieties were new . By observing which of them were pecked by the birds [we]1414-we avoided all danger of poison and added a delicious variety to [our]1414-we food reserve . In [the jungle]1422-the jungle which [we]1414-we traversed were numerous hard - trodden paths made by the wild beasts , and in [the more marshy places]1423-the more marshy places [we]1414-we saw a profusion of strange footmarks , including many of the iguanodon . Once in [a grove]1424-a grove [we]1414-we observed several of these great creatures grazing , and [Lord John]181-lord john , with [his]181-lord john glass , was able to report that [they]1425-they also were spotted with asphalt , though in a different place to the one which [we]1414-we had examined in the morning . What this phenomenon meant [we]1414-we could not imagine .

[We]1414-we saw many small animals , such as porcupines , [a scaly ant - eater]1426-a scaly ant - eater , and a wild pig , piebald in color and with long curved tusks . Once , through a break in the trees , [we]1414-we saw [a clear shoulder of green hill some distance away]1427-a clear shoulder of green hill some distance away , and across this a large dun - colored animal was traveling at a considerable pace . It passed so swiftly that [we]1414-we were unable to say what it was ; but if it were a deer , as was claimed by [Lord John]181-lord john , it must have been as large as those monstrous Irish elk which are still dug up from time to time in the bogs of [[my]0-i native land]1428-my native land .

Ever since the mysterious visit which had been paid to [[our]1414-we camp]948-our camp [we]1414-we always returned to [it]948-our camp with some misgivings . However , on this occasion [we]1414-we found everything in order .

That evening [we]1414-we had a grand discussion upon [our]1414-we present situation and future plans , which [I]0-i must describe at some length , as it led to a new departure by which [we]1414-we were enabled to gain a more complete knowledge of [Maple White Land]215-maple white land than might have come in many weeks of exploring . It was [Summerlee]182-summerlee who opened the debate . All day [he]182-summerlee had been querulous in manner , and now some remark of [Lord John]181-lord john 's as to what [we]1414-we should do on the morrow brought all [his]182-summerlee bitterness to a head .

" What [we]1414-we ought to be doing to - day , to - morrow , and all the time , "[182-summerlee] said [he]182-summerlee , " is finding some way out of the trap into which [we]1414-we have fallen . [You]3038-you are all turning [your]3038-you brains towards getting into [this country]3039-this country . [I]182-summerlee say that [we]1414-we should be scheming how to get out of it . "[182-summerlee]

" [I]142-challenger am surprised , [sir]2355-sir , "[142-challenger] boomed [Challenger]142-challenger , stroking [his]142-challenger majestic beard , " that [any man of science]3041-any man of science should commit [himself]3041-any man of science to so ignoble a sentiment . " It is a waste of energy to do anything else , "[182-summerlee] growled [Summerlee]182-summerlee from behind [his]182-summerlee pipe . " Let [me]182-summerlee remind [you]1430-you that [we]3047-we came here upon a perfectly definite mission , entrusted to [us]3047-we at the meeting of [the Zoological Institute]2389-the zoological institute in [London]22-london . [Our]3047-we ostensible work is therefore done . Should [we]3047-we attempt to do so [ourselves]3047-we , the only possible result must be that [we]3047-we shall never return with the important contribution to science which [we]3047-we have already gained . "[182-summerlee]

[I]0-i confess that as [Summerlee]182-summerlee stated [his]182-summerlee view it struck [me]0-i as altogether reasonable . " The problem of the descent is at first sight a formidable one , "[142-challenger] said [he]142-challenger , " and yet [I]142-challenger can not doubt that the intellect can solve it .
