CHAPTER XIV

" Those Were [the Real Conquests]3229-the real conquests "[1810-i.]

[We]1812-we had imagined that [[our]1812-we pursuers]1813-our pursuers , [the ape - men]3101-the ape - men , knew nothing of [our]1812-we brush - wood hiding - place , but [we]1812-we were soon to find out [our]1812-we mistake . There was no sound in [the woods]2543-the woods - not a leaf moved upon the trees , and all was peace around [us]1812-we - but [we]1812-we should have been warned by [our]1812-we first experience how cunningly and how patiently [these creatures]1816-these creatures can watch and wait until [their]1816-these creatures chance comes . Whatever fate may be [mine]1810-i. through life , [I]0-i am very sure that [I]0-i shall never be nearer death than [I]0-i was that morning . But [I]0-i will tell [you]1817-you the thing in its due order .

[We]1812-we all awoke exhausted after the terrific emotions and scanty food of yesterday . [Summerlee]182-summerlee was still so weak that it was an effort for [him]182-summerlee to stand ; but [the old man]299-the old man was full of a sort of surly courage which would never admit defeat . A council was held , and it was agreed that [we]1812-we should wait quietly for an hour or two where [we]1812-we were , have [our]1812-we much - needed breakfast , and then make [our]1812-we way across [the plateau]789-the plateau and round [the central lake]1460-the central lake to [the caves where [my]0-i observations had shown that [the Indians]893-the indians lived]1821-the caves where my observations had shown that the indians lived . [We]1812-we relied upon the fact that [we]1812-we could count upon the good word of [those whom [we]1812-we had rescued to ensure a warm welcome from [[their]1823-those whom we had rescued to ensure a warm welcome from their fellows fellows]1824-their fellows]1823-those whom we had rescued to ensure a warm welcome from their fellows . Then , with [our]1812-we mission accomplished and possessing a fuller knowledge of the secrets of [Maple White Land]215-maple white land , [we]1812-we should turn [our]1812-we whole thoughts to the vital problem of [our]1812-we escape and return . [Even [Challenger]142-challenger]1825-even challenger was ready to admit that [we]1812-we should then have done all for which [we]1812-we had come , and that [our]1812-we first duty from that time onwards was to carry back to civilization the amazing discoveries [we]1812-we had made .

[We]1812-we were able now to take a more leisurely view of [the Indians whom [we]1812-we had rescued]1826-the indians whom we had rescued . [They]1826-the indians whom we had rescued were [small men]1827-small men , wiry , active , and well - built , with lank black hair tied up in a bunch behind [their]1826-the indians whom we had rescued heads with a leathern thong , and leathern also were [their]1826-the indians whom we had rescued loin - clothes . [Their]1826-the indians whom we had rescued faces were hairless , well formed , and good - humored . The lobes of [their]1826-the indians whom we had rescued ears , hanging ragged and bloody , showed that [they]1826-the indians whom we had rescued had been pierced for some ornaments which [[their]1826-the indians whom we had rescued captors]1828-their captors had torn out . [Their]1826-the indians whom we had rescued speech , though unintelligible to [us]1812-we , was fluent among [themselves]1826-the indians whom we had rescued , and as [they]1826-the indians whom we had rescued pointed to [each other]2795-each other and uttered the word " Accala "[1826-the indians whom we had rescued] many times over , [we]1812-we gathered that this was the name of [the nation]1830-the nation . Occasionally , with faces which were convulsed with fear and hatred , [they]1826-the indians whom we had rescued shook [their]1826-the indians whom we had rescued clenched hands at [the woods]2543-the woods round and cried : " Doda ! [Doda]232-doda ! "[1826-the indians whom we had rescued] which was surely [their]1826-the indians whom we had rescued term for [[their]1826-the indians whom we had rescued enemies]1832-their enemies .

" What do [you]2456-this man make of [them]1826-the indians whom we had rescued , [Challenger]142-challenger ? "[181-lord john] asked [Lord John]181-lord john . " One thing is very clear to [me]181-lord john , and that is that [the little chap with the front of [his]3230-the little chap with the front of his head shaved head shaved]3230-the little chap with the front of his head shaved is [a chief among [them]1826-the indians whom we had rescued]3231-a chief among them . "[181-lord john]

It was indeed evident that [this man]2456-this man stood apart from [the others]1647-the others , and that [they]1647-the others never ventured to address [him]2456-this man without every sign of deep respect . [He]2456-this man seemed to be [the youngest of [them]1647-the others all]1835-the youngest of them all , and yet , so proud and high was [his]2456-this man spirit that , upon [Challenger]142-challenger laying [his]2456-this man great hand upon [his]2456-this man head , [he]2456-this man started like a spurred horse and , with a quick flash of [his]2456-this man dark eyes , moved further away from [the Professor]2374-the professor . Then , placing [his]2456-this man hand upon [his]2456-this man breast and holding [himself]2456-this man with great dignity , [he]2456-this man uttered the word " Maretas "[2456-this man] several times . [The Professor]2374-the professor , unabashed , seized [the nearest Indian]1838-the nearest indian by the shoulder and proceeded to lecture upon [him]1838-the nearest indian as if [he]1838-the nearest indian were a potted specimen in [a class - room]1839-a class - room .

" The type of [these people]2964-these people , "[2374-the professor] said [he]2374-the professor in [his]2374-the professor sonorous fashion , " whether judged by cranial capacity , facial angle , or any other test , can not be regarded as a low one ; on the contrary , [we]3233-we must place it as considerably higher in the scale than [many South American tribes which [I]2374-the professor can mention]3234-many south american tribes which i can mention . On no possible supposition can [we]3233-we explain the evolution of such a race in [this place]2968-this place . For that matter , so great a gap separates [these ape - men]3236-these ape - men from the primitive animals which have survived upon [this plateau]2888-this plateau , that it is inadmissible to think that [they]3236-these ape - men could have developed where [we]3233-we find [them]3236-these ape - men . "[2374-the professor]

" Then where the dooce did [they]3236-these ape - men drop from ? "[181-lord john] asked [Lord John]181-lord john .

" A question which will , no doubt , be eagerly discussed in every scientific society in [Europe]49-europe and [America]31-america , "[2374-the professor] [the Professor]2374-the professor answered . " [My]2374-the professor own reading of the situation for what it is worth - "[2374-the professor] [he]2374-the professor inflated [his]2374-the professor chest enormously and looked insolently around [him]2374-the professor at the words - " is that evolution has advanced under the peculiar conditions of [this country]3039-this country up to the vertebrate stage , the old types surviving and living on in company with [the newer ones]3239-the newer ones . Thus [we]3233-we find such modern creatures as the tapir - an animal with quite a respectable length of pedigree - the great deer , and [the ant - eater in the companionship of reptilian forms of jurassic type]3240-the ant - eater in the companionship of reptilian forms of jurassic type . So much is clear . And now come [the ape - men]3101-the ape - men and [the Indian]1667-the indian . What is the scientific mind to think of [their]3236-these ape - men presence ? [I]2374-the professor can only account for it by an invasion from outside . It is probable that there existed an anthropoid ape in [South America]18-south america , who in past ages found [his]2374-the professor way to [this place]2968-this place , and that [he]2374-the professor developed into the creatures [we]3233-we have seen , some of which "[2374-the professor] - here [he]2374-the professor looked hard at [me]0-i - " were of an appearance and shape which , if it had been accompanied by corresponding intelligence , would , [I]2374-the professor do not hesitate to say , have reflected credit upon [any living race]3244-any living race . As to [the Indians]204-the indians [I]2374-the professor can not doubt that [they]204-the indians are [more recent immigrants from below]3245-more recent immigrants from below . Under the stress of famine or of conquest [they]204-the indians have made [their]204-the indians way up here . Faced by ferocious creatures which [they]204-the indians had never before seen , [they]204-the indians took refuge in [the caves which [[our]3233-we young friend]2889-our young friend has described]3246-the caves which our young friend has described , but [they]204-the indians have no doubt had a bitter fight to hold [their]204-the indians own against wild beasts , and especially against [the ape - men who would regard [them]204-the indians as [intruders]3249-intruders , and wage a merciless war upon [them]204-the indians with a cunning which the larger beasts would lack . [Professor Summerlee]182-summerlee for once was too depressed to argue , though [he]182-summerlee shook [his]182-summerlee head violently as a token of general disagreement . [Lord John]181-lord john merely scratched [his]181-lord john scanty locks with the remark that [he]181-lord john could n't put up a fight as [he]181-lord john was n't in the same weight or class . " [He]1841-one of the indians has gone to fetch some water , "[181-lord john] said [Lord Roxton]181-lord john . " [We]3251-we fitted [him]1841-one of the indians up with an empty beef tin and [he]1841-one of the indians is off . "[181-lord john]

" To [the old camp]1707-the old camp ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" [I]233-i. 'll go and look after [him]1841-one of the indians , "[233-i.] said [I.]233-i. [I]0-i picked up [my]0-i rifle and strolled in the direction of [the brook]1351-the brook , leaving [[my]0-i friends]2934-my friends to lay out the scanty breakfast . It may seem to [you]1845-you rash that even for so short a distance [I]0-i should quit the shelter of [[our]1846-our friendly thicket]1847-our friendly thicket , but [you]1845-you will remember that [we]1846-our were many miles from [Ape - town]3174-ape - town , that so far as [we]1846-our knew [the creatures]1849-the creatures had not discovered [our]1846-our retreat , and that in any case with a rifle in [my]0-i hands [I]0-i had no fear of [them]1849-the creatures . [I]0-i had not yet learned [their]1849-the creatures cunning or [their]1849-the creatures strength .

[I]0-i could hear the murmur of [[our]1846-our brook]1355-our brook somewhere ahead of [me]0-i , but there was a tangle of trees and brushwood between [me]0-i and [it]1355-our brook . [I]0-i was making [my]0-i way through this at a point which was just out of sight of [[my]0-i companions]1384-my companions , when , under one of the trees , [I]0-i noticed something red huddled among the bushes . As [I]0-i approached [it]1852-it , [I]0-i was shocked to see that it was the dead body of [the missing Indian]1853-the missing indian . [He]1853-the missing indian lay upon [his]1853-the missing indian side , [his]1853-the missing indian limbs drawn up , and [his]1853-the missing indian head screwed round at a most unnatural angle , so that [he]1853-the missing indian seemed to be looking straight over [his]1853-the missing indian own shoulder . [I]0-i gave a cry to warn [[my]0-i friends]2934-my friends that something was amiss , and running forwards [I]0-i stooped over the body . Surely [[my]0-i guardian angel]1855-my guardian angel was very near [me]0-i then , for some instinct of fear , or it may have been some faint rustle of leaves , made [me]0-i glance upwards . Out of the thick green foliage which hung low over [my]0-i head , two long muscular arms covered with reddish hair were slowly descending . Another instant and the great stealthy hands would have been round [my]0-i throat . [I]0-i sprang backwards , but quick as [I]0-i was , those hands were quicker still . Through [my]0-i sudden spring they missed a fatal grip , but one of them caught the back of [my]0-i neck and the other one [my]0-i face . [I]0-i threw [my]0-i hands up to protect [my]0-i throat , and the next moment the huge paw had slid down [my]0-i face and closed over them . [I]0-i was lifted lightly from the ground , and [I]0-i felt an intolerable pressure forcing [my]0-i head back and back until the strain upon the cervical spine was more than [I]0-i could bear . [My]0-i senses swam , but [I]0-i still tore at the hand and forced it out from [my]0-i chin . Looking up [I]0-i saw a frightful face with cold inexorable light blue eyes looking down into [mine]0-i . There was something hypnotic in those terrible eyes . [I]0-i could struggle no longer . As the creature felt [me]0-i grow limp in [his]1856-his grasp , two white canines gleamed for a moment at each side of the vile mouth , and the grip tightened still more upon [my]0-i chin , forcing it always upwards and back . A thin , oval - tinted mist formed before [my]0-i eyes and little silvery bells tinkled in [my]0-i ears . Dully and far off [I]0-i heard the crack of a rifle and was feebly aware of the shock as [I]0-i was dropped to [the earth]2576-the earth , where [I]0-i lay without sense or motion .

[I]0-i awoke to find [myself]0-i on [my]0-i back upon the grass in [[our]1858-our lair]1859-our lair within the thicket . [Someone]2531-someone had brought the water from [the brook]1351-the brook , and [Lord John]181-lord john was sprinkling [my]0-i head with it , while [Challenger]142-challenger and [Summerlee]182-summerlee were propping [me]0-i up , with concern in [their]1862-their faces . For a moment [I]0-i had a glimpse of [the human spirits]1863-the human spirits behind [their]1863-the human spirits scientific masks . It was really shock , rather than any injury , which had prostrated [me]0-i , and in half - an - hour , in spite of aching head and stiff neck , [I]0-i was sitting up and ready for anything .

" But [you]0-i 've had the escape of [your]0-i life , [young fellah]186-young fellah [[my]181-lord john lad]2741-my lad , "[181-lord john] said [Lord Roxton]181-lord john . " When [I]181-lord john heard [your]0-i cry and ran forward , and saw [your]0-i head twisted half - off and [your]0-i stohwassers kickin ' in the air , [I]181-lord john thought [we]3256-we were [one short]3171-one short . [I]181-lord john wish [I]181-lord john had [fifty men with rifles]3258-fifty men with rifles . [I]181-lord john 'd clear out [the whole infernal gang of [them]3101-the ape - men]3259-the whole infernal gang of them and leave [this country]3039-this country a bit cleaner than [we]1865-we found it . "[181-lord john]

It was clear now that [the ape - men]3101-the ape - men had in some way marked [us]1865-we down , and that [we]1865-we were watched on every side . [We]1865-we had not so much to fear from [them]3101-the ape - men during the day , but [they]3101-the ape - men would be very likely to rush [us]1865-we by night ; so the sooner [we]1865-we got away from [[their]3101-the ape - men neighborhood]1866-their neighborhood the better . On [three sides of [us]1865-we]1867-three sides of us was [absolute forest]1868-absolute forest , and there [we]1865-we might find [ourselves]1865-we in an ambush . But on the fourth side - that which sloped down in the direction of [the lake]2920-the lake - there was only low scrub , with scattered trees and occasional open glades . It was , in fact , [the route which [I]0-i had [myself]0-i taken in [my]0-i solitary journey]1870-the route which i had myself taken in my solitary journey , and it led [us]1865-we straight for [the Indian caves]1871-the indian caves . This then must for every reason be [[our]1865-we road]929-our road .

One great regret [we]1865-we had , and that was to leave [[our]1865-we old camp]1806-our old camp behind [us]1865-we , not only for the sake of the stores which remained there , but even more because [we]1865-we were losing touch with [Zambo]195-zambo , [our]1865-we link with [the outside world]1218-the outside world . However , [we]1865-we had a fair supply of cartridges and all [our]1865-we guns , so , for a time at least , [we]1865-we could look after [ourselves]1865-we , and [we]1865-we hoped soon to have a chance of returning and restoring [our]1865-we communications with [[our]1865-we negro]1875-our negro . [He]1875-our negro had faithfully promised to stay where [he]1875-our negro was , and [we]1865-we had not a doubt that [he]1875-our negro would be as good as [his]1875-our negro word .

It was in the early afternoon that [we]1865-we started upon [our]1865-we journey . [The young chief]1876-the young chief walked at [our]1865-we head as [[our]1865-we guide]1877-our guide , but refused indignantly to carry any burden . Behind [him]1876-the young chief came [the two surviving Indians with [our]1865-we scanty possessions upon [their]1878-the two surviving indians with our scanty possessions upon their backs backs]1878-the two surviving indians with our scanty possessions upon their backs . [We]1865-we [four white men]1879-four white men walked in the rear with rifles loaded and ready . As [we]1865-we started there broke from [the thick silent woods behind [us]1865-we]1880-the thick silent woods behind us a sudden great ululation of [the ape - men]3101-the ape - men , which may have been a cheer of triumph at [our]1865-we departure or a jeer of contempt at [our]1865-we flight . Looking back [we]1865-we saw only the dense screen of trees , but that long - drawn yell told [us]1865-we how many of [[our]1865-we enemies]1882-our enemies lurked among [them]1880-the thick silent woods behind us . [We]1865-we saw no sign of pursuit , however , and soon [we]1865-we had got into [more open country]1883-more open country and beyond [their]3101-the ape - men power .

As [I]0-i tramped along , the rearmost of the four , [I]0-i could not help smiling at the appearance of [[my]0-i three companions]1884-my three companions in front . Was this the luxurious [Lord John Roxton]181-lord john who had sat that evening in [the Albany]2738-the albany amidst [his]181-lord john Persian rugs and [his]181-lord john pictures in the pink radiance of the tinted lights ? And , finally , could this be the austere and prim figure which had risen before the meeting at [the Zoological Institute]2389-the zoological institute ? [No three tramps that one]1889-no three tramps that one could have met in [a [Surrey]105-surrey lane]1890-a surrey lane could have looked more hopeless and bedraggled . [We]1865-we had , it is true , been only a week or so upon [the top of [the plateau]789-the plateau]1891-the top of the plateau , but all [our]1865-we spare clothing was in [[our]1865-we camp]948-our camp below , and the one week had been a severe one upon [us]1865-we all , though least to [me]0-i who had not to endure the handling of [the ape - men]3101-the ape - men . [[My]0-i three friends]1895-my three friends had all lost [their]1895-my three friends hats , and had now bound handkerchiefs round [their]1895-my three friends heads , [their]1895-my three friends clothes hung in ribbons about [them]1895-my three friends , and [their]1895-my three friends unshaven grimy faces were hardly to be recognized . Both [Summerlee]182-summerlee and [Challenger]142-challenger were limping heavily , while [I]0-i still dragged [my]0-i feet from weakness after the shock of the morning , and [my]0-i neck was as stiff as a board from the murderous grip that held it . [We]1865-we were indeed [a sorry crew]1896-a sorry crew , and [I]0-i did not wonder to see [[our]1865-we Indian companions]1897-our indian companions glance back at [us]1865-we occasionally with horror and amazement on [their]1897-our indian companions faces .

In the late afternoon [we]1865-we reached [the margin of [the lake]2920-the lake]1898-the margin of the lake , and as [we]1865-we emerged from the bush and saw the sheet of water stretching before [us]1865-we [[our]1865-we native friends]1900-our native friends set up a shrill cry of joy and pointed eagerly in front of [them]1900-our native friends . It was indeed a wonderful sight which lay before [us]1865-we . Sweeping over the glassy surface was [a great flotilla of canoes coming straight for [the shore upon which [we]1865-we stood]1902-the shore upon which we stood]1901-a great flotilla of canoes coming straight for the shore upon which we stood . [They]1901-a great flotilla of canoes coming straight for the shore upon which we stood were some miles out when [we]1865-we first saw [them]1901-a great flotilla of canoes coming straight for the shore upon which we stood , but [they]1901-a great flotilla of canoes coming straight for the shore upon which we stood shot forward with great swiftness , and were soon so near that [the rowers]1903-the rowers could distinguish [[our]1865-we persons]1904-our persons . Finally one of [them]1901-a great flotilla of canoes coming straight for the shore upon which we stood , [an elderly man]1908-an elderly man , with a necklace and bracelet of great lustrous glass beads and the skin of some beautiful mottled amber - colored animal slung over [his]1908-an elderly man shoulders , ran forward and embraced most tenderly [the youth whom [we]1865-we had saved]1909-the youth whom we had saved . [He]1908-an elderly man then looked at [us]1865-we and asked some questions , after which [he]1908-an elderly man stepped up with much dignity and embraced [us]1865-we also each in turn . Then , at [his]1908-an elderly man order , [the whole tribe]3177-the whole tribe lay down upon the ground before [us]1865-we in homage . Personally [I]0-i felt shy and uncomfortable at this obsequious adoration , and [I]0-i read the same feeling in the faces of [Roxton]181-lord john and [Summerlee]182-summerlee , but [Challenger]142-challenger expanded like a flower in the sun .

" [They]3177-the whole tribe may be [undeveloped types]3261-undeveloped types , "[1908-an elderly man] said [he]1908-an elderly man , stroking [his]1908-an elderly man beard and looking round at [them]3177-the whole tribe , " but [their]3177-the whole tribe deportment in the presence of [[their]3177-the whole tribe superiors]3262-their superiors might be a lesson to [some of [[our]1914-we more advanced Europeans]3264-our more advanced europeans]3263-some of our more advanced europeans . It was clear that [the natives]2527-the natives had come out upon the war - path , for [every man]1912-every man carried [his]1912-every man spear - a long bamboo tipped with bone - [his]1912-every man bow and arrows , and some sort of club or stone battle - axe slung at [his]1912-every man side . [Their]2527-the natives dark , angry glances at [the woods from which [we]1914-we had come]1913-the woods from which we had come , and the frequent repetition of the word " [Doda]232-doda , "[2527-the natives] made it clear enough that this was [a rescue party who had set forth to save or revenge [[the old chief]1916-the old chief 's son]1917-the old chief 's son , for such [we]1914-we gathered that [the youth]1918-the youth must be]1915-a rescue party who had set forth to save or revenge the old chief 's son , for such we gathered that the youth must be . A council was now held by [the whole tribe squatting in a circle]1919-the whole tribe squatting in a circle , whilst [we]1914-we sat near on a slab of basalt and watched [their]2527-the natives proceedings . [Two or three warriors]1920-two or three warriors spoke , and finally [[our]1914-we young friend]2889-our young friend made a spirited harangue with such eloquent features and gestures that [we]1914-we could understand it all as clearly as if [we]1914-we had known [his]2889-our young friend language .

" What is the use of returning ? "[2889-our young friend] [he]2889-our young friend said . " Sooner or later the thing must be done . [[Your]1914-we comrades]3266-your comrades have been murdered . What if [I]2889-our young friend have returned safe ? [These others]3267-these others have been done to death . There is no safety for [any of [us]1914-we]3268-any of us . [We]1914-we are assembled now and ready . "[2889-our young friend] Then [he]2889-our young friend pointed to [us]1914-we . " [These strange men]3269-these strange men are [[our]1914-we friends]978-our friends . [They]3269-these strange men are [great fighters]3271-great fighters , and [they]3269-these strange men hate [the ape - men]3101-the ape - men even as [we]1914-we do . [They]3269-these strange men command , "[2889-our young friend] here [he]2889-our young friend pointed up to [heaven]1922-heaven , " the thunder and the lightning . When shall [we]1914-we have such a chance again ? Let [us]1914-we go forward , and either die now or live for the future in safety . How else shall [we]1914-we go back unashamed to [[our]1914-we women]3273-our women ? "[2889-our young friend]

[The little red warriors]1923-the little red warriors hung upon the words of [the speaker]1000-the speaker , and when [he]2889-our young friend had finished [they]1923-the little red warriors burst into a roar of applause , waving [their]1923-the little red warriors rude weapons in the air . [The old chief]1916-the old chief stepped forward to [us]1926-you , and asked [us]1926-you some questions , pointing at the same time to [the woods]2543-the woods . " Well , it 's up to [you]1926-you to say what [you]1926-you will do , "[181-lord john] said [he]181-lord john ; " for [my]181-lord john part [I]181-lord john have a score to settle with [these monkey - folk]3274-these monkey - folk , and if it ends by wiping [them]3274-these monkey - folk off the face of [the earth]2576-the earth [I]181-lord john do n't see that [the earth]2576-the earth need fret about it . [I]181-lord john 'm goin' with [[our]1926-you little red pals]3277-our little red pals and [I]181-lord john mean to see [them]3277-our little red pals through the scrap . What do [you]1926-you say , [young fellah]186-young fellah ? "[181-lord john]

" Of course [I]181-lord john will come . "[181-lord john]

" And [you]1926-you , [Challenger]142-challenger ? "[181-lord john]

" [I]181-lord john will assuredly co - operate . "[181-lord john]

" And [you]1926-you , [Summerlee]182-summerlee ? "[181-lord john]

" [We]1926-you seem to be drifting very far from the object of this expedition , [Lord John]181-lord john . [I]181-lord john assure [you]1926-you that [I]181-lord john little thought when [I]181-lord john left [my]181-lord john professional chair in [London]22-london that it was for the purpose of heading a raid of savages upon a colony of anthropoid apes . "[181-lord john]

" To such base uses do [we]1926-you come , "[181-lord john] said [Lord John]181-lord john , smiling . " But [we]1926-you are up against it , so what 's the decision ? "[181-lord john]

" It seems a most questionable step , "[182-summerlee] said [Summerlee]182-summerlee , argumentative to the last , " but if [you]1926-you are all going , [I]182-summerlee hardly see how [I]182-summerlee can remain behind . "[182-summerlee]

" Then it is settled , "[181-lord john] said [Lord John]181-lord john , and turning to [the chief]2532-the chief [he]181-lord john nodded and slapped [his]181-lord john rifle .

[The old fellow]1929-the old fellow clasped [our]1930-we hands , each in turn , while [[his]1929-the old fellow men]1931-his men cheered louder than ever . It was too late to advance that night , so [the Indians]204-the indians settled down into a rude bivouac . On all sides [their]204-the indians fires began to glimmer and smoke . [Some of [them]204-the indians who had disappeared into [the jungle]1422-the jungle]1932-some of them who had disappeared into the jungle came back presently driving [a young iguanodon]1934-a young iguanodon before [them]1932-some of them who had disappeared into the jungle . Like [the others]1647-the others , it had a daub of asphalt upon [its]1934-a young iguanodon shoulder , and it was only when [we]1930-we saw [one of [the natives]2527-the natives]1936-one of the natives step forward with the air of [an owner]1938-an owner and give [his]1936-one of the natives consent to the beast 's slaughter that [we]1930-we understood at last that [these great creatures]1939-these great creatures were as much private property as a herd of cattle , and that these symbols which had so perplexed [us]1930-we were nothing more than the marks of [the owner]1940-the owner . [Helpless , torpid , and vegetarian , with great limbs but a minute brain]1941-helpless , torpid , and vegetarian , with great limbs but a minute brain , [they]1939-these great creatures could be rounded up and driven by [a child]809-a child . In a few minutes the huge beast had been cut up and slabs of [him]1934-a young iguanodon were hanging over a dozen camp fires , together with great scaly ganoid fish which had been speared in [the lake]2920-the lake .

[Summerlee]182-summerlee had lain down and slept upon [the sand]1944-the sand , but [we]1930-we others roamed round [the edge of [the water]1342-the water]1945-the edge of the water , seeking to learn something more of [this strange country]1947-this strange country . Twice [we]1930-we found pits of blue clay , such as [we]1930-we had already seen in [the swamp of the pterodactyls]1417-the swamp of the pterodactyls . These were old volcanic vents , and for some reason excited the greatest interest in [Lord John]181-lord john . What attracted [Challenger]142-challenger , on the other hand , was a bubbling , gurgling mud geyser , where some strange gas formed great bursting bubbles upon the surface . [He]142-challenger thrust a hollow reed into it and cried out with delight like [a schoolboy]1949-a schoolboy then [he]142-challenger was able , on touching it with a lighted match , to cause a sharp explosion and a blue flame at the far end of the tube . Still more pleased was [he]142-challenger when , inverting a leathern pouch over the end of the reed , and so filling it with the gas , [he]142-challenger was able to send it soaring up into the air .

" An inflammable gas , and one markedly lighter than the atmosphere . [I]142-challenger should say beyond doubt that [it]3278-it contained a considerable proportion of free hydrogen . The resources of G. E. C. are not yet exhausted , [[my]142-challenger young friend]2927-my young friend . [I]142-challenger may yet show [you]2927-my young friend how a great mind molds all Nature to its use . "[142-challenger] [He]142-challenger swelled with some secret purpose , but would say no more .

There was nothing which [we]1930-we could see upon [the shore]1950-the shore which seemed to [me]0-i so wonderful as the great sheet of water before [us]1930-we . [Our]1930-we numbers and [our]1930-we noise had frightened [all living creatures]1951-all living creatures away , and save for a few pterodactyls , which soared round high above [our]1930-we heads while [they]1952-they waited for the carrion , all was still around [the camp]669-the camp . But it was different out upon [the rose - tinted waters of [the central lake]1460-the central lake]1954-the rose - tinted waters of the central lake . [It]1460-the central lake boiled and heaved with strange life . Great slate - colored backs and high serrated dorsal fins shot up with a fringe of silver , and then rolled down into the depths again . [The sand - banks far out]1956-the sand - banks far out were spotted with uncouth crawling forms , huge turtles , strange saurians , and one great flat creature like a writhing , palpitating mat of black greasy leather , which flopped its way slowly to [the lake]2920-the lake . Here and there high serpent heads projected out of the water , cutting swiftly through it with a little collar of foam in front , and a long swirling wake behind , rising and falling in graceful , swan - like undulations as [they]1952-they went . It was not until one of these creatures wriggled on to [a sand - bank]1958-a sand - bank within a few hundred yards of [us]1930-we , and exposed a barrel - shaped body and huge flippers behind the long serpent neck , that [Challenger]142-challenger , and [Summerlee]182-summerlee , who had joined [us]1930-we , broke out into [their]1959-their duet of wonder and admiration .

" Plesiosaurus ! A fresh - water plesiosaurus ! "[182-summerlee] cried [Summerlee]182-summerlee . " That [I]182-summerlee should have lived to see such a sight ! [We]1930-we are blessed , [[my]182-summerlee dear]2487-my dear [Challenger]142-challenger , above [all zoologists]3281-all zoologists since [the world]2307-the world began ! "[182-summerlee]

It was not until the night had fallen , and the fires of [[our]1930-we savage allies]1960-our savage allies glowed red in the shadows , that [[our]1930-we two men of science]1961-our two men of science could be dragged away from [the fascinations of [that primeval lake]1963-that primeval lake]1962-the fascinations of that primeval lake . Even in the darkness as [we]1930-we lay upon [the strand]1964-the strand , [we]1930-we heard from time to time the snort and plunge of the huge creatures who lived therein .

At earliest dawn [[our]1930-we camp]948-our camp was astir and an hour later [we]1930-we had started upon [our]1930-we memorable expedition . Often in [my]0-i dreams have [I]0-i thought that [I]0-i might live to be [a war correspondent]1966-a war correspondent . In what wildest one could [I]0-i have conceived the nature of the campaign which it should be [my]0-i lot to report ! Here then is [my]0-i first despatch from [a field of battle]1967-a field of battle :

[Our]1930-we numbers had been reinforced during the night by [a fresh batch of natives from [the caves]1535-the caves]1968-a fresh batch of natives from the caves , and [we]1930-we may have been four or five hundred strong when [we]1930-we made [our]1930-we advance . [A fringe of scouts]1970-a fringe of scouts was thrown out in front , and behind [them]1970-a fringe of scouts [the whole force in a solid column]1971-the whole force in a solid column made [their]1971-the whole force in a solid column way up [the long slope of [the bush country]1973-the bush country]1972-the long slope of the bush country until [we]1930-we were near the edge of [the forest]897-the forest . Here [they]1971-the whole force in a solid column spread out into a long straggling line of [spearmen]1975-spearmen and [bowmen]1976-bowmen . [Roxton]181-lord john and [Summerlee]182-summerlee took [their]1971-the whole force in a solid column position upon the right flank , while [Challenger]142-challenger and [I]0-i were on the left . It was a host of the stone age that [we]1930-we were accompanying to battle - [we]1930-we with the last word of [the gunsmith]1977-the gunsmith 's art from [St. James ' Street]77-st. james 's street and [the Strand]1964-the strand .

[We]1930-we had not long to wait for [[our]1930-we enemy]1979-our enemy . A wild shrill clamor rose from the edge of the wood and suddenly a body of [ape - men]3115-ape - men rushed out with clubs and stones , and made for the center of the Indian line . It was a valiant move but a foolish one , for [the great bandy - legged creatures]1981-the great bandy - legged creatures were slow of foot , while [[their]1981-the great bandy - legged creatures opponents]1982-their opponents were as active as cats . It was horrible to see [the fierce brutes with foaming mouths and glaring eyes]1983-the fierce brutes with foaming mouths and glaring eyes , rushing and grasping , but forever missing [[their]1981-the great bandy - legged creatures elusive enemies]1984-their elusive enemies , while arrow after arrow buried itself in [their]1981-the great bandy - legged creatures hides . [One great fellow]1985-one great fellow ran past [me]0-i roaring with pain , with a dozen darts sticking from [his]1985-one great fellow chest and ribs . In mercy [I]0-i put a bullet through [his]1985-one great fellow skull , and [he]1985-one great fellow fell sprawling among the aloes . But this was the only shot fired , for the attack had been on the center of the line , and [the Indians]204-the indians there had needed no help of [ours]1930-we in repulsing it . Of all [the ape - men who had rushed out into the open]1986-the ape - men who had rushed out into the open , [I]0-i do not think [that one]1987-that one got back to cover .

But the matter was more deadly when [we]1930-we came among the trees . For an hour or more after [we]1930-we entered [the wood]3140-the wood , there was a desperate struggle in which for a time [we]1930-we hardly held [our]1930-we own . Springing out from among the scrub [the ape - men with huge clubs]1989-the ape - men with huge clubs broke in upon [the Indians]204-the indians and often felled three or four of [them]1989-the ape - men with huge clubs before [they]1989-the ape - men with huge clubs could be speared . [Their]1989-the ape - men with huge clubs frightful blows shattered everything upon which [they]1989-the ape - men with huge clubs fell . One of [them]1989-the ape - men with huge clubs knocked [Summerlee]182-summerlee 's rifle to matchwood and the next would have crushed [his]1985-one great fellow skull had [an Indian]2558-an indian not stabbed the beast to the heart . [Other ape - men in the trees above [us]1930-we]1991-other ape - men in the trees above us hurled down stones and logs of wood , occasionally dropping bodily on to [our]1930-we ranks and fighting furiously until [they]1991-other ape - men in the trees above us were felled . Once [[our]1930-we allies]1992-our allies broke under the pressure , and had it not been for the execution done by [our]1930-we rifles [they]1992-our allies would certainly have taken to [their]1992-our allies heels . But [they]1992-our allies were gallantly rallied by [[their]1992-our allies old chief]1993-their old chief and came on with such a rush that [the ape - men]3101-the ape - men began in turn to give way . [Summerlee]182-summerlee was weaponless , but [I]0-i was emptying [my]0-i magazine as quick as [I]0-i could fire , and on the further flank [we]1930-we heard the continuous cracking of [[our]1930-we companion]1127-our companion 's rifles .

Then in a moment came the panic and the collapse . Screaming and howling , the great creatures rushed away in all directions through the brushwood , while [[our]1930-we allies]1992-our allies yelled in [their]1992-our allies savage delight , following swiftly after [[their]1992-our allies flying enemies]1997-their flying enemies . All the feuds of countless generations , all the hatreds and cruelties of [their]1992-our allies narrow history , all the memories of ill - usage and persecution were to be purged that day . [At last man]1998-at last man was to be supreme and [the man - beast]1999-the man - beast to find forever [[his]1999-the man - beast allotted place]2000-his allotted place . Fly as [they]1992-our allies would [the fugitives]2001-the fugitives were too slow to escape from [the active savages]2002-the active savages , and from every side in [the tangled woods]2003-the tangled woods [we]1930-we heard the exultant yells , the twanging of bows , and the crash and thud as [ape - men]3115-ape - men were brought down from [their]3115-ape - men hiding - places in the trees .

[I]0-i was following [the others]1647-the others , when [I]0-i found that [Lord John]181-lord john and [Challenger]142-challenger had come across to join [us]1930-we .

" It 's over , "[181-lord john] said [Lord John]181-lord john . " [I]181-lord john think [we]1930-we can leave the tidying up to [them]3115-ape - men . Perhaps the less [we]1930-we see of it the better [we]1930-we shall sleep . "[181-lord john]

[Challenger]142-challenger 's eyes were shining with the lust of slaughter .

" [We]1930-we have been privileged , "[181-lord john] [he]181-lord john cried , strutting about like a gamecock , " to be present at one of the typical decisive battles of history - the battles which have determined the fate of [the world]2307-the world . What , [[my]181-lord john friends]2934-my friends , is the conquest of [one nation]3285-one nation by another ? It is meaningless . Each produces the same result . But those fierce fights , when in the dawn of the ages [the cave - dwellers]3286-the cave - dwellers held [their]3286-the cave - dwellers own against [the tiger folk]3287-the tiger folk , or [the elephants]3288-the elephants first found that [they]3288-the elephants had [a master]3289-a master , those were the real conquests - the victories that count . By this strange turn of fate [we]2006-we have seen and helped to decide even such a contest . Now upon [this plateau]2888-this plateau the future must ever be for [man]2341-man . "[181-lord john]

It needed a robust faith in the end to justify such tragic means . As [we]2006-we advanced together through [the woods]2543-the woods [we]2006-we found [the ape - men lying thick , transfixed with spears or arrows]2008-the ape - men lying thick , transfixed with spears or arrows . Here and there a little group of shattered Indians marked where one of the anthropoids had turned to bay , and sold [his]2009-his life dearly . Always in front of [us]2006-we [we]2006-we heard the yelling and roaring which showed the direction of the pursuit . [The ape - men]3101-the ape - men had been driven back to [[their]3101-the ape - men city]2011-their city , [they]3101-the ape - men had made a last stand there , once again [they]3101-the ape - men had been broken , and now [we]2006-we were in time to see the final fearful scene of all . [Some eighty or a hundred males]2012-some eighty or a hundred males , [the last survivors]2013-the last survivors , had been driven across [that same little clearing which led to [the edge of the cliff]1007-the edge of the cliff]2014-that same little clearing which led to the edge of the cliff , the scene of [our]2006-we own exploit two days before . As [we]2006-we arrived [the Indians]893-the indians , a semicircle of [spearmen]1975-spearmen , had closed in on [them]893-the indians , and in a minute it was over , Thirty or forty died where [they]893-the indians stood . [The others , screaming and clawing]2018-the others , screaming and clawing , were thrust over the precipice , and went hurtling down , as [[their]2018-the others , screaming and clawing prisoners]3175-their prisoners had of old , on to the sharp bamboos six hundred feet below . It was as [Challenger]142-challenger had said , and the reign of [man]2341-man was assured forever in [Maple White Land]215-maple white land . [The males]2021-the males were exterminated , [Ape Town]2022-ape town was destroyed , [the females]1340-the females and [young]2024-young were driven away to live in bondage , and the long rivalry of untold centuries had reached its bloody end .

For [us]2006-we the victory brought much advantage . Once again [we]2006-we were able to visit [[our]2006-we camp]948-our camp and get at [[our]2006-we stores]1258-our stores . Once more also [we]2006-we were able to communicate with [Zambo]195-zambo , who had [been terrified by the spectacle from afar of an avalanche of apes falling from the edge of the cliff]2027-been terrified by the spectacle from afar of an avalanche of apes falling from the edge of the cliff .

" Come away , [Massas]234-massas , come away ! "[195-zambo] [he]195-zambo cried , [his]195-zambo eyes starting from [his]195-zambo head . " [The debbil]3292-the debbil get [you]234-massas sure if [you]234-massas stay up there . "[195-zambo]

" It is the voice of sanity ! "[182-summerlee] said [Summerlee]182-summerlee with conviction . " [We]2006-we have had adventures enough and [they]3293-they are neither suitable to [our]2006-we character or [our]2006-we position . [I]182-summerlee hold [you]234-massas to [your]234-massas word , [Challenger]142-challenger . From now onwards [you]234-massas devote [your]234-massas energies to getting [us]2006-we out of [this horrible country]3294-this horrible country and back once more to civilization . "[182-summerlee]

CHAPTER XV

" [Our]2028-we Eyes have seen Great Wonders "[195-zambo]

[I]0-i write this from day to day , but [I]0-i trust that before [I]0-i come to the end of it , [I]0-i may be able to say that the light shines , at last , through [our]2028-we clouds . [We]2028-we are held here with no clear means of making [our]2028-we escape , and bitterly [we]2028-we chafe against it . Yet , [I]0-i can well imagine that the day may come when [we]2028-we may be glad that [we]2028-we were kept , against [our]2028-we will , to see something more of the wonders of [this singular place]2029-this singular place , and of the creatures who inhabit [it]2029-this singular place .

The victory of [the Indians]204-the indians and the annihilation of [the ape - men]3101-the ape - men , marked the turning point of [our]2028-we fortunes . From then onwards , [we]2028-we were in [truth masters of [the plateau]789-the plateau]2031-truth masters of the plateau , for [the natives]2527-the natives looked upon [us]2028-we with a mixture of fear and gratitude , since by [our]2028-we strange powers [we]2028-we had aided [them]2527-the natives to destroy [[their]2527-the natives hereditary foe]2034-their hereditary foe . For [their]2527-the natives own sakes [they]2527-the natives would , perhaps , be glad to see the departure of [such formidable and incalculable people]2035-such formidable and incalculable people , but [they]2527-the natives have not [themselves]2527-the natives suggested any way by which [we]2028-we may reach [the plains below]2036-the plains below . There had been , so far as [we]2028-we could follow [their]2527-the natives signs , a tunnel by which [the place]927-the place could be approached , the lower exit of which [we]2028-we had seen from below . By this , no doubt , [both ape - men]2038-both ape - men and [Indians]2039-indians had at different epochs reached the top , and [Maple White]169-maple white with [[his]169-maple white companion]2040-his companion had taken the same way . Only the year before , however , there had been a terrific earthquake , and the upper end of [the tunnel]2041-the tunnel had fallen in and completely disappeared . [The Indians]893-the indians now could only shake [their]893-the indians heads and shrug [their]893-the indians shoulders when [we]2028-we expressed by signs [our]2028-we desire to descend . It may be that [they]893-the indians can not , but it may also be that [they]893-the indians will not , help [us]2028-we to get away .

At the end of the victorious campaign [the surviving ape - folk]2043-the surviving ape - folk were driven across [the plateau]789-the plateau [their]2043-the surviving ape - folk wailings were horrible and established in [the neighborhood of [the Indian caves]1871-the indian caves]2045-the neighborhood of the indian caves , where [they]2043-the surviving ape - folk would , from now onwards , be [a servile race]2047-a servile race under the eyes of [[their]2043-the surviving ape - folk masters]2048-their masters . It was a rude , raw , primeval version of [the Jews in [Babylon]107-babylon]2049-the jews in babylon or [the Israelites]235-the israelites in [Egypt]108-egypt . At night [we]2028-we could hear from amid the trees the long - drawn cry , as [some primitive Ezekiel mourned for fallen greatness]2050-some primitive ezekiel mourned for fallen greatness and recalled the departed glories of [Ape Town]109-ape town . Hewers of wood and drawers of water , such were they from now onwards .

[We]2028-we had returned across [the plateau]789-the plateau with [[our]2028-we allies]1992-our allies two days after the battle , and made [our]2028-we camp at the foot of [[their]1992-our allies cliffs]2053-their cliffs . [They]1992-our allies would have had [us]2028-we share [[their]1992-our allies caves]2054-their caves with [them]1992-our allies , but [Lord John]181-lord john would by no means consent to it considering that to do so would put [us]2028-we in [their]1992-our allies power if [they]1992-our allies were treacherously disposed . [We]2028-we kept [our]2028-we independence , therefore , and had [our]2028-we weapons ready for any emergency , while preserving the most friendly relations . [We]2028-we also continually visited [[their]1992-our allies caves]2054-their caves , which were most remarkable places , though whether made by [man]2341-man or by Nature [we]2028-we have never been able to determine . They were all on the one stratum , hollowed out of some soft rock which lay between the volcanic basalt forming [the ruddy cliffs above [them]1992-our allies]2057-the ruddy cliffs above them , and the hard granite which formed [their]1992-our allies base .

The openings were about eighty feet above the ground , and were led up to by long stone stairs , so narrow and steep that no large animal could mount [them]1992-our allies . Inside they were warm and dry , running in straight passages of varying length into the side of [the hill]941-the hill , with smooth gray walls decorated with many excellent pictures done with charred sticks and representing the various animals of [the plateau]789-the plateau . If every living thing were swept from [the country]2801-the country [the future explorer]2061-the future explorer would find upon the walls of [these caves]2062-these caves ample evidence of the strange fauna - the dinosaurs , iguanodons , and fish lizards - which had lived so recently upon earth .

Since [we]2028-we had learned that [the huge iguanodons]2063-the huge iguanodons were kept as tame herds by [[their]2063-the huge iguanodons owners]2064-their owners , and were simply walking meat - stores , [we]2028-we had conceived [that man]2065-that man , even with [his]2065-that man primitive weapons , had established [his]2065-that man ascendancy upon [the plateau]789-the plateau . [We]2028-we were soon to discover that it was not so , and that [he]2065-that man was still there upon tolerance .

It was on the third day after [our]2028-we forming [[our]2028-we camp]948-our camp near [the Indian caves]1871-the indian caves that the tragedy occurred . [Challenger]142-challenger and [Summerlee]182-summerlee had gone off together that day to [the lake]2920-the lake where [some of [the natives]2527-the natives , under [their]2070-some of the natives , under their direction direction]2070-some of the natives , under their direction , were engaged in harpooning specimens of the great lizards . [Lord John]181-lord john and [I]0-i had remained in [[our]2028-we camp]948-our camp , while [a number of [the Indians]204-the indians]2073-a number of the indians were scattered about upon [the grassy slope in front of the caves]2074-the grassy slope in front of the caves engaged in different ways . Suddenly there was a shrill cry of alarm , with the word " Stoa "[2335-men] resounding from a hundred tongues . From every side [men]2335-men , [women]2309-women , and [children]2683-children were rushing wildly for shelter , swarming up the staircases and into [the caves]1535-the caves in a mad stampede .

Looking up , [we]2028-we could see [them]2079-them waving [their]2079-them arms from the rocks above and beckoning to [us]2028-we to join [them]2079-them in [their]2079-them refuge . [We]2028-we had both seized [our]2028-we magazine rifles and ran out to see what the danger could be . Suddenly from the near belt of trees there broke forth [a group of twelve or fifteen Indians]2080-a group of twelve or fifteen indians , running for [their]2080-a group of twelve or fifteen indians lives , and at [their]2080-a group of twelve or fifteen indians very heels [two of those frightful monsters which had disturbed [[our]2028-we camp]948-our camp]2081-two of those frightful monsters which had disturbed our camp and pursued [me]0-i upon [my]0-i solitary journey . In shape [they]2080-a group of twelve or fifteen indians were like horrible toads , and moved in a succession of springs , but in size [they]2080-a group of twelve or fifteen indians were of an incredible bulk , larger than the largest elephant . [We]2028-we had never before seen [them]2080-a group of twelve or fifteen indians save at night , and indeed [they]2080-a group of twelve or fifteen indians are nocturnal animals save when disturbed in [their]2080-a group of twelve or fifteen indians lairs , as these had been . [We]2028-we now stood amazed at the sight , for [their]2080-a group of twelve or fifteen indians blotched and warty skins were of a curious fish - like iridescence , and the sunlight struck [them]2080-a group of twelve or fifteen indians with an ever - varying rainbow bloom as [they]2080-a group of twelve or fifteen indians moved .

[We]2028-we had little time to watch [them]2080-a group of twelve or fifteen indians , however , for in an instant [they]2080-a group of twelve or fifteen indians had overtaken [the fugitives]2001-the fugitives and were making a dire slaughter among [them]2001-the fugitives . [Their]2080-a group of twelve or fifteen indians method was to fall forward with [their]2080-a group of twelve or fifteen indians full weight upon each in turn , leaving [him]2084-him crushed and mangled , to bound on after [the others]1647-the others . [The wretched Indians]2086-the wretched indians screamed with terror , but were helpless , run as [they]2086-the wretched indians would , before the relentless purpose and horrible activity of [these monstrous creatures]2087-these monstrous creatures . One after another [they]2080-a group of twelve or fifteen indians went down , and there were not half - a - dozen surviving by the time [[my]0-i companion]420-my companion and [I]0-i could come to [their]2080-a group of twelve or fifteen indians help . But [our]2028-we aid was of little avail and only involved [us]2028-we in the same peril . At the range of a couple of hundred yards [we]2028-we emptied [our]2028-we magazines , firing bullet after bullet into the beasts , but with no more effect than if [we]2028-we were pelting [them]2087-these monstrous creatures with pellets of paper . [Their]2087-these monstrous creatures slow reptilian natures cared nothing for wounds , and the springs of [their]2087-these monstrous creatures lives , with no special brain center but scattered throughout [their]2087-these monstrous creatures spinal cords , could not be tapped by any modern weapons . The most that [we]2028-we could do was to check [their]2087-these monstrous creatures progress by distracting [their]2087-these monstrous creatures attention with the flash and roar of [our]2028-we guns , and so to give both [the natives]2527-the natives and [ourselves]2028-we time to reach the steps which led to safety . But where the conical explosive bullets of the twentieth century were of no avail , the poisoned arrows of [the natives]2527-the natives , dipped in the juice of strophanthus and steeped afterwards in decayed carrion , could succeed . Such arrows were of little avail to the hunter who attacked the beast , because [their]2080-a group of twelve or fifteen indians action in that torpid circulation was slow , and before its powers failed it could certainly overtake and slay [[its]2080-a group of twelve or fifteen indians assailant]2091-its assailant . But now , as [the two monsters]2092-the two monsters hounded [us]2028-we to the very foot of the stairs , a drift of darts came whistling from every chink in [the cliff above [them]2092-the two monsters]2093-the cliff above them . In a minute [they]2092-the two monsters were feathered with [them]2092-the two monsters , and yet with no sign of pain [they]2092-the two monsters clawed and slobbered with impotent rage at the steps which would lead [them]2092-the two monsters to [[their]2092-the two monsters victims]2094-their victims , mounting clumsily up for a few yards and then sliding down again to the ground . But at last the poison worked . [One of [them]2092-the two monsters]723-one of them gave a deep rumbling groan and dropped [his]723-one of them huge squat head on to [the earth]2576-the earth . The other bounded round in an eccentric circle with shrill , wailing cries , and then lying down writhed in agony for some minutes before it also stiffened and lay still . With yells of triumph [the Indians]204-the indians came flocking down from [[their]204-the indians caves]2054-their caves and danced a frenzied dance of victory round the dead bodies , in mad joy that [two more of the most dangerous of all [their]204-the indians enemies]2098-two more of the most dangerous of all their enemies had been slain . That night [they]204-the indians cut up and removed the bodies , not to eat - for the poison was still active - but lest [they]204-the indians should breed a pestilence . The great reptilian hearts , however , each as large as a cushion , still lay there , beating slowly and steadily , with a gentle rise and fall , in horrible independent life . It was only upon the third day that the ganglia ran down and the dreadful things were still .

Some day , when [I]0-i have a better desk than a meat - tin and more helpful tools than a worn stub of pencil and a last , tattered note - book , [I]0-i will write some fuller account of [the Accala Indians]236-the indians - of [our]2099-we life amongst [them]236-the indians , and of the glimpses which [we]2099-we had of the strange conditions of [wondrous Maple White Land]2100-wondrous maple white land . Memory , at least , will never fail [me]0-i , for so long as the breath of life is in [me]0-i , every hour and every action of that period will stand out as hard and clear as do the first strange happenings of [our]2099-we childhood . No new impressions could efface those which are so deeply cut . When the time comes [I]0-i will describe that wondrous moonlit night upon [the great lake]2101-the great lake when [a young ichthyosaurus]2102-a young ichthyosaurus - a strange creature , half seal , half fish , to look at , with bone - covered eyes on each side of [his]2102-a young ichthyosaurus snout , and a third eye fixed upon the top of [his]2102-a young ichthyosaurus head - was entangled in an Indian net , and nearly upset [[our]2099-we canoe]2103-our canoe before [we]2099-we towed [it]2103-our canoe [ashore]2104-ashore ; the same night that a green water - snake shot out from the rushes and carried off in its coils the steersman of [[Challenger]142-challenger 's canoe]2105-challenger 's canoe . [I]0-i will tell , too , of the great nocturnal white thing - to this day [we]2099-we do not know whether it was beast or reptile - which lived in [a vile swamp to the east]2106-a vile swamp to the east of [the lake]2920-the lake , and flitted about with a faint phosphorescent glimmer in the darkness . [The Indians]236-the indians were so terrified at it that [they]236-the indians would not go near [the place]927-the place , and , though [we]2099-we twice made expeditions and saw it each time , [we]2099-we could not make [our]2099-we way through [the deep marsh in which it lived]2109-the deep marsh in which it lived . [I]0-i can only say that it seemed to be larger than a cow and had the strangest musky odor . [I]0-i will tell also of the huge bird which chased [Challenger]142-challenger to the shelter of the rocks one day - a great running bird , far taller than an ostrich , with a vulture - like neck and cruel head which made it a walking death . As [Challenger]142-challenger climbed to safety one dart of that savage curving beak shore off the heel of [his]142-challenger boot as if it had been cut with a chisel . This time at least modern weapons prevailed and the great creature , twelve feet from head to foot - phororachus [its]2110-its name , according to [[our]2099-we panting but exultant [Professor]142-challenger]2111-our panting but exultant professor - went down before [Lord Roxton]181-lord john 's rifle in a flurry of waving feathers and kicking limbs , with two remorseless yellow eyes glaring up from the midst of it . May [I]0-i live to see that flattened vicious skull in its own niche amid the trophies of [the Albany]89-the albany . Finally , [I]0-i will assuredly give some account of the toxodon , the giant ten - foot guinea pig , with projecting chisel teeth , which [we]2099-we killed as it drank in the gray of the morning by [the side of [the lake]2920-the lake]2112-the side of the lake .

All this [I]0-i shall some day write at fuller length , and amidst these more stirring days [I]0-i would tenderly sketch in these lovely summer evenings , when with the deep blue sky above [us]2099-we [we]2099-we lay in good comradeship among the long grasses by the wood and marveled at the strange fowl that swept over [us]2099-we and the quaint new creatures which crept from [their]2114-their burrows to watch [us]2099-we , while above [us]2099-we the boughs of the bushes were heavy with luscious fruit , and below [us]2099-we strange and lovely flowers peeped at [us]2099-we from among the herbage ; or those long moonlit nights when [we]2099-we lay out upon the shimmering surface of [the great lake]2101-the great lake and watched with wonder and awe the huge circles rippling out from the sudden splash of some fantastic monster ; or the greenish gleam , far down in [the deep water]2116-the deep water , of [some strange creature upon the confines of darkness]2117-some strange creature upon the confines of darkness . These are the scenes which [my]0-i mind and [my]0-i pen will dwell upon in every detail at some future day .

But , [you]2118-you will ask , why these experiences and why this delay , when [you]2118-you and [[your]2118-you comrades]3266-your comrades should have been occupied day and night in the devising of some means by which [you]2118-you could return to [the outer world]775-the outer world ? [My]0-i answer is , that there was not one of [us]2099-we who was not working for this end , but that [our]2099-we work had been in vain . One fact [we]2099-we had very speedily discovered : [The Indians]236-the indians would do nothing to help [us]2099-we . In every other way [they]236-the indians were [[our]2099-we friends]978-our friends - one might almost say [[our]2099-we devoted slaves]2122-our devoted slaves - but when it was suggested that [they]236-the indians should help [us]2099-we to make and carry a plank which would bridge [the chasm]1009-the chasm , or when [we]2099-we wished to get from [them]236-the indians thongs of leather or liana to weave ropes which might help [us]2099-we , [we]2099-we were met by a good - humored , but [an invincible , refusal]2124-an invincible , refusal . [They]236-the indians would smile , twinkle [their]236-the indians eyes , shake [their]236-the indians heads , and there was the end of it . Even [the old chief]1916-the old chief met [us]2099-we with the same obstinate denial , and it was only [Maretas]238-maretas , [the youngster whom [we]2099-we had saved]2126-the youngster whom we had saved , who looked wistfully at [us]2099-we and told [us]2099-we by [his]238-maretas gestures that [he]238-maretas was grieved for [our]2099-we thwarted wishes . Ever since [their]236-the indians crowning triumph with [the ape - men]3101-the ape - men [they]236-the indians looked upon [us]2099-we as [supermen , who bore victory in the tubes of strange weapons]2128-supermen , who bore victory in the tubes of strange weapons , and [they]236-the indians believed that so long as [we]2099-we remained with [them]236-the indians good fortune would be [theirs]236-the indians . [A little red - skinned wife]2129-a little red - skinned wife and [a cave of [our]2099-we own]2130-a cave of our own were freely offered to each of [us]2099-we if [we]2099-we would but forget [[our]2099-we own people]2131-our own people and dwell forever upon [the plateau]789-the plateau . So far all had been kindly , however far apart [our]2099-we desires might be ; but [we]2099-we felt well assured that [our]2099-we actual plans of a descent must be kept secret , for [we]2099-we had reason to fear that at the last [they]236-the indians might try to hold [us]2099-we by force .

In spite of the danger from dinosaurs which is not great save at night , for , as [I]0-i may have said before , [they]236-the indians are mostly nocturnal in [their]236-the indians habits [I]0-i have twice in the last three weeks been over to [[our]2099-we old camp]1806-our old camp in order to see [[our]2099-we negro who still kept watch and ward below [the cliff]2610-the cliff]2134-our negro who still kept watch and ward below the cliff . [My]0-i eyes strained eagerly across [the great plain]1206-the great plain in the hope of seeing afar off the help for which [we]2099-we had prayed . But [the long cactus - strewn levels]2137-the long cactus - strewn levels still stretched away , empty and bare , to the distant line of [the cane - brake]2138-the cane - brake .

" [They]236-the indians will soon come now , [Massa Malone]224-massa malone . Before another week pass [Indian]225-the indian come back and bring rope and fetch [you]224-massa malone down . "[195-zambo] Such was the cheery cry of [[our]2099-we excellent [Zambo]195-zambo]2139-our excellent zambo .

[I]0-i had one strange experience as [I]0-i came from this second visit which had involved [my]0-i being away for a night from [[my]0-i companions]1384-my companions . [I]0-i was returning along [the well - remembered route]2141-the well - remembered route , and had reached [a spot within a mile or so of [the marsh of the pterodactyls]2143-the marsh of the pterodactyls]2142-a spot within a mile or so of the marsh of the pterodactyls , when [I]0-i saw an extraordinary object approaching [me]0-i . It was [a man who walked inside a framework made of bent canes]2144-a man who walked inside a framework made of bent canes so that [he]2144-a man who walked inside a framework made of bent canes was enclosed on all sides in a bell - shaped cage . As [I]0-i drew nearer [I]0-i was more amazed still to see that it was [Lord John Roxton]181-lord john . When [he]181-lord john saw [me]0-i [he]181-lord john slipped from under [his]181-lord john curious protection and came towards [me]0-i laughing , and yet , as [I]0-i thought , with some confusion in [his]181-lord john manner .

" Well , [young fellah]2760-young fellah , "[181-lord john] said [he]181-lord john , " who would have thought of meetin ' [you]2760-young fellah up here ? "[181-lord john]

" What in [the world]2307-the world are [you]181-lord john doing ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" But why ? "[181-lord john]

" Interestin ' beasts , do n't [you]181-lord john think ? But unsociable ! Nasty rude ways with [strangers]3298-strangers , as [you]181-lord john may remember .
