[He]181-lord john turned away and [I]0-i left [him]181-lord john wandering on through the wood with [his]181-lord john extraordinary cage around [him]181-lord john .

If [Lord John]181-lord john 's behavior at this time was strange , that of [Challenger]142-challenger was more so . [I]0-i may say that [he]142-challenger seemed to possess an extraordinary fascination for [the Indian women]2145-the indian women , and that [he]142-challenger always carried a large spreading palm branch with which [he]142-challenger beat [them]2145-the indian women off as if [they]2145-the indian women were flies , when [their]2145-the indian women attentions became too pressing . To see [him]142-challenger walking like [a comic opera Sultan]2146-a comic opera sultan , with this badge of authority in [his]142-challenger hand , [his]142-challenger black beard bristling in front of [him]142-challenger , [his]142-challenger toes pointing at each step , and a train of wide - eyed Indian girls behind [him]142-challenger , clad in [their]2145-the indian women slender drapery of bark cloth , is one of the most grotesque of all the pictures which [I]0-i will carry back with [me]0-i . As to [Summerlee]182-summerlee , [he]182-summerlee was absorbed in the insect and bird life of [the plateau]789-the plateau , and spent [his]182-summerlee whole time save that considerable portion which was devoted to abusing [Challenger]142-challenger for not getting [us]2148-us out of [our]2148-us difficulties in cleaning and mounting [his]142-challenger specimens .

[Challenger]142-challenger had been in the habit of walking off by [himself]142-challenger every morning and returning from time to time with looks of portentous solemnity , as one who bears the full weight of a great enterprise upon [his]142-challenger shoulders . One day , palm branch in hand , and [[his]142-challenger crowd of adoring devotees behind [him]142-challenger]2149-his crowd of adoring devotees behind him , [he]142-challenger led [us]2148-us down to [[his]142-challenger hidden work - shop]2150-his hidden work - shop and took [us]2148-us into the secret of [his]142-challenger plans .

[The place]927-the place was a small clearing in [the center of [a palm grove]2153-a palm grove]2152-the center of a palm grove . In this was one of those boiling mud geysers which [I]0-i have already described . Around [its]927-the place edge were scattered a number of leathern thongs cut from iguanodon hide , and a large collapsed membrane which proved to be the dried and scraped stomach of one of the great fish lizards from [the lake]2920-the lake . This huge sack had been sewn up at one end and only a small orifice left at the other . Into this opening several bamboo canes had been inserted and the other ends of these canes were in contact with conical clay funnels which collected the gas bubbling up through the mud of the geyser . Soon the flaccid organ began to slowly expand and show such a tendency to upward movements that [Challenger]142-challenger fastened the cords which held it to the trunks of the surrounding trees . In half an hour a good - sized gas - bag had been formed , and the jerking and straining upon the thongs showed that it was capable of considerable lift . [Challenger]142-challenger , like [a glad father]2155-a glad father in the presence of [[his]142-challenger first - born]2156-his first - born , stood smiling and stroking [his]142-challenger beard , in silent , self - satisfied content as [he]142-challenger gazed at the creation of [his]142-challenger brain . It was [Summerlee]182-summerlee who first broke the silence .

" [You]142-challenger do n't mean [us]2148-us to go up in that thing , [Challenger]142-challenger ? "[182-summerlee] said [he]182-summerlee , in an acid voice .

" [I]182-summerlee mean , [[my]182-summerlee dear]2487-my dear [Summerlee]182-summerlee , to give [you]182-summerlee such a demonstration of its powers that after seeing it [you]182-summerlee will , [I]182-summerlee am sure , have no hesitation in trusting [yourself]182-summerlee to it . "[182-summerlee]

" [You]182-summerlee can put it right out of [your]182-summerlee head now , at once , "[182-summerlee] said [Summerlee]182-summerlee with decision , " nothing on [earth]2555-earth would induce [me]182-summerlee to commit such a folly . [Lord John]181-lord john , [I]182-summerlee trust that [you]182-summerlee will not countenance such madness ? "[182-summerlee]

" Dooced ingenious , [I]1793-our peer call it , "[1793-our peer] said [[our]2157-we peer]1793-our peer . " [I]1793-our peer 'd like to see how it works . "[1793-our peer]

" So [you]182-summerlee shall , "[142-challenger] said [Challenger]142-challenger . " For some days [I]142-challenger have exerted [my]142-challenger whole brain force upon the problem of how [we]2157-we shall descend from [these cliffs]2618-these cliffs . [We]2157-we have satisfied [ourselves]2157-we that [we]2157-we can not climb down and that there is no tunnel . [We]2157-we are also unable to construct any kind of bridge which may take [us]2157-we back to [the pinnacle from which [we]2157-we came]3309-the pinnacle from which we came . How then shall [I]142-challenger find a means to convey [us]2157-we ? Some little time ago [I]142-challenger had remarked to [[our]2157-we young friend]2889-our young friend here that free hydrogen was evolved from the geyser . The idea of a balloon naturally followed . [I]142-challenger was , [I]142-challenger will admit , somewhat baffled by the difficulty of discovering an envelope to contain the gas , but the contemplation of the immense entrails of these reptiles supplied [me]142-challenger with a solution to the problem . Behold the result ! "[142-challenger]

[He]142-challenger put one hand in the front of [his]142-challenger ragged jacket and pointed proudly with the other .

By this time the gas - bag had swollen to a goodly rotundity and was jerking strongly upon its lashings .

" Midsummer madness ! "[182-summerlee] snorted [Summerlee]182-summerlee .

[Lord John]181-lord john was delighted with the whole idea . " [Clever old dear]3311-clever old dear , ai n't [he]142-challenger ? "[181-lord john] [he]181-lord john whispered to [me]0-i , and then louder to [Challenger]142-challenger . " What about [a car]3312-a car ? "[181-lord john]

" [The car]3313-the car will be [my]181-lord john next care . [I]181-lord john have already planned how it is to be made and attached . Meanwhile [I]181-lord john will simply show [you]0-i how capable [my]181-lord john apparatus is of supporting the weight of each of [us]2159-our . "[181-lord john]

" [All of [us]2159-our]2437-all of us , surely ? "[181-lord john]

" No , it is part of [my]142-challenger plan that [each in turn]1150-each in turn shall descend as in a parachute , and the balloon be drawn back by means which [I]142-challenger shall have no difficulty in perfecting . If it will support the weight of one and let [him]142-challenger gently down , it will have done all that is required of it . [I]142-challenger will now show [you]0-i its capacity in that direction . "[142-challenger]

[He]142-challenger brought out a lump of basalt of a considerable size , constructed in the middle so that a cord could be easily attached to it . This cord was the one which [we]2159-our had brought with [us]2159-our on to [the plateau]789-the plateau after [we]2159-our had used it for climbing the pinnacle . It was over a hundred feet long , and though it was thin it was very strong . [He]142-challenger had prepared a sort of collar of leather with many straps depending from it . This collar was placed over the dome of the balloon , and the hanging thongs were gathered together below , so that the pressure of any weight would be diffused over a considerable surface . Then the lump of basalt was fastened to the thongs , and the rope was allowed to hang from the end of it , being passed three times round [the Professor]2374-the professor 's arm .

" [I]142-challenger will now , "[142-challenger] said [Challenger]142-challenger , with a smile of pleased anticipation , " demonstrate the carrying power of [my]142-challenger balloon . "[142-challenger] As [he]142-challenger said so [he]142-challenger cut with a knife the various lashings that held it .

Never was [our]2159-our expedition in more imminent danger of complete annihilation . The inflated membrane shot up with frightful velocity into the air . In an instant [Challenger]142-challenger was pulled off [his]142-challenger feet and dragged after [it]2162-it . [I]0-i had just time to throw [my]0-i arms round [his]142-challenger ascending waist when [I]0-i was [myself]0-i whipped up into the air . [Lord John]181-lord john had [me]0-i with a rat - trap grip round the legs , but [I]0-i felt that [he]142-challenger also was coming off the ground . For a moment [I]0-i had a vision of [four adventurers floating like a string of sausages]2163-four adventurers floating like a string of sausages over [the land that [they]2163-four adventurers floating like a string of sausages had explored]2164-the land that they had explored . But , happily , there were limits to the strain which the rope would stand , though none apparently to the lifting powers of this infernal machine . There was a sharp crack , and [we]2159-our were in a heap upon the ground with coils of rope all over [us]2159-our . When [we]2159-our were able to stagger to [our]2159-our feet [we]2159-our saw far off in the deep blue sky one dark spot where the lump of basalt was speeding upon its way .

" Splendid ! "[2165-the undaunted challenger] cried [the undaunted Challenger]2165-the undaunted challenger , rubbing [his]142-challenger injured arm . " A most thorough and satisfactory demonstration ! [I]2165-the undaunted challenger could not have anticipated such a success . Within a week , [gentlemen]2671-gentlemen , [I]2165-the undaunted challenger promise that a second balloon will be prepared , and that [you]2671-gentlemen can count upon taking in safety and comfort the first stage of [our]2159-our homeward journey . "[2165-the undaunted challenger] So far [I]0-i have written each of the foregoing events as it occurred . Now [I]0-i am rounding off [my]0-i narrative from [the old camp]1707-the old camp , where [Zambo]195-zambo has waited so long , with all [our]2159-our difficulties and dangers left like a dream behind [us]2159-our upon the summit of [those vast ruddy crags which tower above [our]2159-our heads]2167-those vast ruddy crags which tower above our heads . [We]2159-our have descended in safety , though in a most unexpected fashion , and all is well with [us]2159-our . In six weeks or two months [we]2159-our shall be in [London]22-london , and it is possible that this letter may not reach [you]2168-you much earlier than [we]2159-our do [ourselves]2159-our . Already [our]2159-our hearts yearn and [our]2159-our spirits fly towards [the great mother city]2169-the great mother city which holds so much that is dear to [us]2159-our .

It was on the very evening of [our]2159-our perilous adventure with [Challenger]142-challenger 's home - made balloon that the change came in [our]2159-our fortunes . [I]0-i have said that [the one person from whom [we]2159-our had had some sign of sympathy in [our]2159-our attempts to get away]2170-the one person from whom we had had some sign of sympathy in our attempts to get away was [the young chief whom [we]2159-our had rescued]2171-the young chief whom we had rescued . [He]2171-the young chief whom we had rescued alone had no desire to hold [us]2159-our against [our]2159-our will in [a strange land]2581-a strange land . [He]2171-the young chief whom we had rescued had told [us]2159-our as much by [his]2171-the young chief whom we had rescued expressive language of signs . That evening , after dusk , [he]2171-the young chief whom we had rescued came down to [[our]2159-our little camp]2173-our little camp , handed [me]0-i for some reason [he]2171-the young chief whom we had rescued had always shown [his]2171-the young chief whom we had rescued attentions to [me]0-i , perhaps because [I]0-i was [the one who was nearest [his]2171-the young chief whom we had rescued age a small roll of the bark of a tree , and then pointing solemnly up at [the row of caves above [him]2171-the young chief whom we had rescued]2175-the row of caves above him , [he]2171-the young chief whom we had rescued had put [his]2171-the young chief whom we had rescued finger to [his]2171-the young chief whom we had rescued lips as a sign of secrecy and had stolen back again to [[his]2171-the young chief whom we had rescued people]2176-his people]2174-the one who was nearest his age a small roll of the bark of a tree , and then pointing solemnly up at the row of caves above him , he had put his finger to his lips as a sign of secrecy and had stolen back again to his people .

[I]0-i took the slip of bark to the firelight and [we]2159-our examined it together . It was about a foot square , and on the inner side there was a singular arrangement of lines , which [I]0-i here reproduce :

They were neatly done in charcoal upon the white surface , and looked to [me]0-i at first sight like some sort of rough musical score .

" Whatever it is , [I]0-i can swear that it is of importance to [us]2159-our , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " [I]0-i could read that on [his]2171-the young chief whom we had rescued face as [he]2171-the young chief whom we had rescued gave it . "[0-i]

" Unless [we]2159-our have come upon [a primitive practical joker]3317-a primitive practical joker , "[182-summerlee] [Summerlee]182-summerlee suggested , " which [I]182-summerlee should think would be one of the most elementary developments of [man]2341-man . "[182-summerlee]

" It is clearly some sort of script , "[142-challenger] said [Challenger]142-challenger .

" Looks like a guinea puzzle competition , "[181-lord john] remarked [Lord John]181-lord john , craning [his]181-lord john neck to have a look at it . Then suddenly [he]181-lord john stretched out [his]181-lord john hand and seized the puzzle .

" By [George]144-george ! "[181-lord john] [he]181-lord john cried , " [I]181-lord john believe [I]181-lord john 've got it . [The boy]3319-the boy guessed right the very first time . See here ! How many marks are on that paper ? Eighteen . Well , if [you]0-i come to think of it there are eighteen cave openings on [the hill - side above [us]2159-our]3320-the hill - side above us . "[181-lord john]

" [He]3319-the boy pointed up to [the caves]1535-the caves when [he]3319-the boy gave it to [me]2177-me , "[2177-me] said [I.]2177-me

" Well , that settles it . This is a chart of [the caves]1535-the caves . What ! Eighteen of them all in a row , some short , some deep , some branching , same as [we]2159-our saw them . It 's a map , and here 's a cross on it . What 's the cross for ? It is placed to mark one that is much deeper than the others . "[181-lord john]

" One that goes through , "[0-i] [I]0-i cried .

" [I]142-challenger believe [[our]2159-our young friend]2889-our young friend has read the riddle , "[142-challenger] said [Challenger]142-challenger . " If [the cave]1046-the cave does not go through [I]142-challenger do not understand why [this person]3325-this person , who has every reason to mean [us]2159-our well , should have drawn [our]2159-our attention to it . But if it does go through and comes out at [the corresponding point on the other side]3326-the corresponding point on the other side , [we]2159-our should not have more than a hundred feet to descend . "[142-challenger]

" A hundred feet ! "[182-summerlee] grumbled [Summerlee]182-summerlee .

" Well , [our]2159-our rope is still more than a hundred feet long , "[0-i] [I]0-i cried . " Surely [we]2159-our could get down . "[0-i]

" How about the Indians in [the cave]1046-the cave ? "[182-summerlee] [Summerlee]182-summerlee objected .

" There are [no Indians]3328-no indians in [any of the caves above [our]2159-our heads]3329-any of the caves above our heads , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " [They]893-the indians are all used as [barns]3330-barns and [store - houses]3331-store - houses . Why should [we]2180-we not go up now at once and spy out [the land]2977-the land ? "[0-i]

There is [a dry bituminous wood upon [the plateau]789-the plateau]2178-a dry bituminous wood upon the plateau - a species of araucaria , according to [[our]2180-we botanist]2181-our botanist - which is always used by [the Indians]893-the indians for torches . [Each of [us]2180-we]1191-each of us picked up a faggot of this , and [we]2180-we made [our]2180-we way up weed - covered steps to the particular cave which was marked in the drawing . [It]2184-it was , as [I]0-i had said , empty , save for a great number of enormous bats , which flapped round [our]2180-we heads as [we]2180-we advanced into [it]2184-it . As [we]2180-we had no desire to draw the attention of [the Indians]893-the indians to [our]2180-we proceedings , [we]2180-we stumbled along in the dark until [we]2180-we had gone round several curves and penetrated a considerable distance into [the cavern]2186-the cavern . Then , at last , [we]2180-we lit [our]2180-we torches . It was [a beautiful dry tunnel with smooth gray walls covered with native symbols]2187-a beautiful dry tunnel with smooth gray walls covered with native symbols , a curved roof which arched over [our]2180-we heads , and white glistening sand beneath [our]2180-we feet . [We]2180-we hurried eagerly along [it]2187-a beautiful dry tunnel with smooth gray walls covered with native symbols until , with a deep groan of bitter disappointment , [we]2180-we were brought to a halt . [A sheer wall of rock]2188-a sheer wall of rock had appeared before [us]2180-we , with no chink through which a mouse could have slipped . There was no escape for [us]2180-we there .

[We]2180-we stood with bitter hearts staring at this unexpected obstacle . It was not the result of any convulsion , as in the case of [the ascending tunnel]2189-the ascending tunnel . The end wall was exactly like [the side ones]2190-the side ones . [It]2191-it was , and had always been , [a cul - de - sac]2192-a cul - de - sac .

" Never mind , [[my]142-challenger friends]2934-my friends , "[142-challenger] said [the indomitable Challenger]142-challenger . " [You]0-i have still [my]142-challenger firm promise of a balloon . "[142-challenger]

[Summerlee]182-summerlee groaned .

" Can [we]2180-we be in [the wrong cave]3334-the wrong cave ? "[0-i] [I]0-i suggested .

" No use , [young fellah]2760-young fellah , "[181-lord john] said [Lord John]181-lord john , with [his]181-lord john finger on the chart . " Seventeen from the right and second from the left . This is [the cave]1046-the cave sure enough . "[181-lord john]

[I]0-i looked at the mark to which [his]181-lord john finger pointed , and [I]0-i gave a sudden cry of joy .

" [I]0-i believe [I]0-i have it ! Follow [me]0-i ! Follow [me]0-i ! "[0-i]

[I]0-i hurried back along the way [we]2193-we had come , [my]0-i torch in [my]0-i hand . " Here , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , pointing to some matches upon the ground , " is where [we]2193-we lit up . "[0-i]

" Exactly . "[0-i]

" Well , [it]2194-it is marked as [a forked cave]3337-a forked cave , and in the darkness [we]2193-we passed the fork before the torches were lit . On the right side as [we]2193-we go out [we]2193-we should find the longer arm . "[0-i]

It was as [I]0-i had said . [We]2193-we had not gone thirty yards before a great black opening loomed in the wall . [We]2193-we turned into [it]2194-it to find that [we]2193-we were in [a much larger passage than before]2195-a much larger passage than before . Along it [we]2193-we hurried in breathless impatience for many hundreds of yards . Then , suddenly , in the black darkness of the arch in front of [us]2193-we [we]2193-we saw a gleam of dark red light . [We]2193-we stared in amazement . A sheet of steady flame seemed to cross [the passage]328-the passage and to bar [our]2193-we way . [We]2193-we hastened towards [it]2194-it . No sound , no heat , no movement came from it , but still the great luminous curtain glowed before [us]2193-we , silvering all [the cave]1046-the cave and turning the sand to powdered jewels , until as [we]2193-we drew closer it discovered a circular edge .

" The moon , by [George]144-george ! "[181-lord john] cried [Lord John]181-lord john . " [We]2193-we are through , [boys]3085-boys ! [We]2193-we are through ! "[181-lord john]

It was indeed the full moon which shone straight down the aperture which opened upon [the cliffs]1111-the cliffs . It was a small rift , not larger than a window , but it was enough for all [our]2193-we purposes . As [we]2193-we craned [our]2193-we necks through it [we]2193-we could see that the descent was not a very difficult one , and that the level ground was no very great way below [us]2193-we . It was no wonder that from below [we]2193-we had not observed [the place]927-the place , as [the cliffs]1111-the cliffs curved overhead and an ascent at the spot would have seemed so impossible as to discourage close inspection . [We]2193-we satisfied [ourselves]2193-we that with the help of [our]2193-we rope [we]2193-we could find [our]2193-we way down , and then returned , rejoicing , to [[our]2193-we camp]948-our camp to make [our]2193-we preparations for the next evening .

What [we]2193-we did [we]2193-we had to do quickly and secretly , since even at this last hour [the Indians]236-the indians might hold [us]2193-we back . [[Our]2193-we stores]1258-our stores [we]2193-we would leave behind [us]2193-we , save only [our]2193-we guns and cartridges . But [Challenger]142-challenger had some unwieldy stuff which [he]142-challenger ardently desired to take with [him]142-challenger , and one particular package , of which [I]0-i may not speak , which gave [us]2193-we more labor than any . Slowly the day passed , but when the darkness fell [we]2193-we were ready for [our]2193-we departure . With much labor [we]2193-we got [our]2193-we things up the steps , and then , looking back , took one last long survey of [that strange land]2203-that strange land , soon [I]0-i fear to be vulgarized , the prey of [hunter]2204-hunter and [prospector]2205-prospector , but to each of [us]2193-we a dreamland of glamour and romance , [a land where [we]2193-we had dared much , suffered much , and learned much - [OUR]2193-we land , as [we]2193-we shall ever fondly call [it]2206-a land where we had dared much , suffered much , and learned much - our land , as we shall ever fondly call it]2206-a land where we had dared much , suffered much , and learned much - our land , as we shall ever fondly call it . Along upon [our]2193-we left the neighboring caves each threw out [its]2207-its ruddy cheery firelight into the gloom . From [the slope below [us]2193-we]2208-the slope below us rose the voices of [the Indians]893-the indians as [they]893-the indians laughed and sang . Beyond was the long sweep of [the woods]2543-the woods , and in the center , shimmering vaguely through the gloom , was [the great lake]2101-the great lake , the mother of strange monsters . Even as [we]2193-we looked a high whickering cry , the call of some weird animal , rang clear out of the darkness . It was the very voice of [Maple White Land]215-maple white land bidding [us]2193-we good - bye . [We]2193-we turned and plunged into [the cave which led to [home]2831-home]2212-the cave which led to home .

Two hours later , [we]2193-we , [our]2193-we packages , and all [we]2193-we owned , were at [the foot of [the cliff]2610-the cliff]2214-the foot of the cliff . Save for [Challenger]142-challenger 's luggage [we]2193-we had never a difficulty . Leaving it all where [we]2193-we descended , [we]2193-we started at once for [[Zambo]195-zambo 's camp]2216-zambo 's camp . In the early morning [we]2193-we approached [it]2216-zambo 's camp , but only to find , to [our]2193-we amazement , not one fire but a dozen upon [the plain]1079-the plain . [The rescue party]2218-the rescue party had arrived . There were [twenty Indians from [the river]2530-the river]2219-twenty indians from the river , with stakes , ropes , and all that could be useful for bridging [the chasm]1009-the chasm . At least [we]2193-we shall have no difficulty now in carrying [our]2193-we packages , when to - morrow [we]2193-we begin to make [our]2193-we way back to [the Amazon]24-the amazon .

And so , in humble and thankful mood , [I]0-i close this account . [Our]2193-we eyes have seen great wonders and [our]2193-we souls are chastened by what [we]2193-we have endured . [Each]240-each is in [his]240-each own way [a better and deeper man]2222-a better and deeper man . It may be that when [we]2193-we reach [Para]56-para [we]2193-we shall stop to refit . If [we]2193-we do , this letter will be a mail ahead . If not , it will reach [London]22-london on the very day that [I]0-i do . In either case , [[my]0-i dear]2487-my dear [Mr. McArdle]143-mcardle , [I]0-i hope very soon to shake [you]143-mcardle by the hand .

CHAPTER XVI

" A Procession ! A Procession ! "[0-i]

[I]0-i should wish to place upon record here [our]2193-we gratitude to [all [our]2193-we friends]2224-all our friends upon [the Amazon]24-the amazon for the very great kindness and hospitality which was shown to [us]2193-we upon [our]2193-we return journey . Very particularly would [I]0-i thank [Senhor Penalosa]241-senhor penalosa and [other officials of [the Brazilian Government]2226-the brazilian government]2225-other officials of the brazilian government for the special arrangements by which [we]2193-we were helped upon [our]2193-we way , and [[Senhor Pereira]242-senhor pereira of [Para]56-para]2227-senhor pereira of para , to whose forethought [we]2193-we owe the complete outfit for a decent appearance in [the civilized world]2228-the civilized world which [we]2193-we found ready for [us]2193-we at [that town]2229-that town . It seemed a poor return for all the courtesy which [we]2193-we encountered that [we]2193-we should deceive [[our]2193-we hosts and [benefactors]2231-benefactors]2230-our hosts and benefactors , but under the circumstances [we]2193-we had really no alternative , and [I]0-i hereby tell [them]2230-our hosts and benefactors that [they]2230-our hosts and benefactors will only waste [their]2230-our hosts and benefactors time and [their]2230-our hosts and benefactors money if [they]2230-our hosts and benefactors attempt to follow upon [our]2193-we traces . Even the names have been altered in [our]2193-we accounts , and [I]0-i am very sure that [no one]2652-no one , from the most careful study of [them]2233-them , could come within a thousand miles of [[our]2193-we unknown land]2234-our unknown land .

The excitement which had been caused through [those parts of [South America]18-south america which [we]2193-we had to traverse]2235-those parts of south america which we had to traverse was imagined by [us]2193-we to be purely local , and [I]0-i can assure [[our]2193-we friends]978-our friends in [England]41-england that [we]2193-we had no notion of the uproar which the mere rumor of [our]2193-we experiences had caused through [Europe]49-europe . It was not until [the Ivernia]110-the ivernia was within five hundred miles of [Southampton]60-southampton that the wireless messages from paper after paper and agency after agency , offering huge prices for a short return message as to [our]2193-we actual results , showed [us]2193-we how strained was the attention not only of the scientific world but of [the general public]2237-the general public . It was agreed among [us]2193-we , however , that no definite statement should be given to the Press until [we]2193-we had met [the members of [the Zoological Institute]2389-the zoological institute]2238-the members of the zoological institute , since as delegates it was [our]2193-we clear duty to give [our]2193-we first report to [the body from which [we]2193-we had received [our]2193-we commission of investigation]2240-the body from which we had received our commission of investigation . Thus , although [we]2193-we found [Southampton]60-southampton full of [Pressmen]2241-pressmen , [we]2193-we absolutely refused to give any information , which had the natural effect of focussing public attention upon the meeting which was advertised for the evening of November 7th . For this gathering , [the Zoological Hall]2242-the zoological hall which had been the scene of the inception of [our]2193-we task was found to be far too small , and it was only in [the Queen 's Hall in [Regent Street]39-regent street]2243-the queen 's hall in regent street that accommodation could be found . It is now common knowledge [the promoters]2244-the promoters might have ventured upon [the Albert Hall]2245-the albert hall and still found [[their]2244-the promoters space]2246-their space too scanty .

It was for the second evening after [our]2193-we arrival that the great meeting had been fixed . For the first , [we]2193-we had each , no doubt , [our]2193-we own pressing personal affairs to absorb [us]2193-we . Of [mine]2247-mine [I]0-i can not yet speak . It may be that as it stands further from [me]0-i [I]0-i may think of it , and even speak of it , with less emotion . [I]0-i have shown [the reader]285-the reader in the beginning of this narrative where lay the springs of [my]0-i action . It is but right , perhaps , that [I]0-i should carry on the tale and show also the results . And yet the day may come when [I]0-i would not have it otherwise . At least [I]0-i have been driven forth to take part in a wondrous adventure , and [I]0-i can not but be thankful to the force that drove [me]0-i .

And now [I]0-i turn to the last supreme eventful moment of [our]2193-we adventure . As [I]0-i was racking [my]0-i brain as to how [I]0-i should best describe it , [my]0-i eyes fell upon the issue of [my]0-i own Journal for the morning of the 8th of November with the full and excellent account of [[my]0-i friend and fellow - reporter [Macdona]243-macdona]2249-my friend and fellow - reporter macdona . What can [I]0-i do better than transcribe [his]2249-my friend and fellow - reporter macdona narrative - head - lines and all ? [I]0-i admit that the paper was exuberant in the matter , out of compliment to [its]2250-its own enterprise in sending [a correspondent]2251-a correspondent , but [the other great dailies]2252-the other great dailies were hardly less full in [their]2252-the other great dailies account . Thus , then , [friend Mac]244-mac in [his]244-mac report :

[THE NEW WORLD GREAT MEETING AT [THE QUEEN 'S HALL]112-the queen 's hall SCENES OF UPROAR]111-the new world great meeting at the queen 's hall scenes of uproar EXTRAORDINARY INCIDENT WHAT WAS [IT]2253-it ? [NOCTURNAL RIOT]113-nocturnal riot IN [REGENT STREET Special]114-regent street special

" The much - discussed meeting of [the Zoological Institute]2389-the zoological institute , convened to hear the report of [the Committee of Investigation]3340-the committee of investigation sent out last year to [South America]18-south america to test the assertions made by [Professor Challenger]142-challenger as to the continued existence of prehistoric life upon [that Continent]3341-that continent , was held last night in [the greater Queen 's Hall]3342-the greater queen 's hall , and it is safe to say that it is likely to be a red letter date in the history of Science , for the proceedings were of so remarkable and sensational a character that [no one present]3343-no one present is ever likely to forget [them]111-the new world great meeting at the queen 's hall scenes of uproar . "[243-macdona] Oh , [brother scribe Macdona]243-macdona , what a monstrous opening sentence ! " The tickets were theoretically confined to [members]3344-members and [[their]3344-members friends]3345-their friends , but the latter is an elastic term , and long before eight o'clock , the hour fixed for the commencement of the proceedings , [all parts of [the Great Hall]3347-the great hall]3346-all parts of the great hall were tightly packed . [The general public]2237-the general public , however , which most unreasonably entertained a grievance at having been excluded , stormed the doors at a quarter to eight , after a prolonged melee in which [several people]2436-several people were injured , including [Inspector Scoble]245-inspector scoble of H. Division , whose leg was unfortunately broken . After this unwarrantable invasion , which not only filled every passage , but even intruded upon the space set apart for the Press , it is estimated that [nearly five thousand people]3350-nearly five thousand people awaited the arrival of [the travelers]3351-the travelers . When [they]3350-nearly five thousand people eventually appeared , [they]3350-nearly five thousand people took [their]3350-nearly five thousand people places in the front of a platform which already contained [all the leading scientific men]3352-all the leading scientific men , not only of [this country]3039-this country , but of [France]115-france and of [Germany]116-germany . [Sweden]117-sweden was also represented , in the person of [Professor Sergius]3354-professor sergius , [the famous Zoologist of [the University of [Upsala]119-upsala]118-the university of upsala]3355-the famous zoologist of the university of upsala . The entrance of [the four heroes of the occasion]3356-the four heroes of the occasion was the signal for a remarkable demonstration of welcome , [the whole audience]3357-the whole audience rising and cheering for some minutes . [An acute observer]3358-an acute observer might , however , have detected some signs of dissent amid the applause , and gathered that the proceedings were likely to become more lively than harmonious . It may safely be prophesied , however , that [no one]2652-no one could have foreseen the extraordinary turn which [they]3350-nearly five thousand people were actually to take .[243-macdona]

" Of the appearance of [the four wanderers]3360-the four wanderers little need be said , since [their]3350-nearly five thousand people photographs have for some time been appearing in all the papers . [They]3350-nearly five thousand people bear few traces of the hardships which [they]3350-nearly five thousand people are said to have undergone . [Professor Challenger]142-challenger 's beard may be more shaggy , [Professor Summerlee]182-summerlee 's features more ascetic , [Lord John Roxton]181-lord john 's figure more gaunt , and all three may be burned to a darker tint than when [they]3350-nearly five thousand people left [[our]3361-our shores]3362-our shores , but [each]1785-each appeared to be in most excellent health . As to [[our]3361-our own representative]3364-our own representative , [the well - known athlete and international Rugby football player]3365-the well - known athlete and international rugby football player , [E. D. Malone]145-mr. malone , [he]3365-the well - known athlete and international rugby football player looks trained to a hair , and as [he]3365-the well - known athlete and international rugby football player surveyed [the crowd]526-the crowd a smile of good - humored contentment pervaded [his]3365-the well - known athlete and international rugby football player honest but homely face . "[244-mac] All right , [Mac]244-mac , wait till [I]0-i get [you]244-mac alone !

" When quiet had been restored and [the audience]2633-the audience resumed [their]2633-the audience seats after the ovation which [they]2633-the audience had given to [the travelers]3351-the travelers , [the chairman]2407-the chairman , [the Duke of [Durham]120-durham]3370-the duke of durham , addressed the meeting . ' [He]2407-the chairman would not , ' [he]2407-the chairman said , ' stand for more than a moment between that vast assembly and the treat which lay before [them]2633-the audience . It was not for [him]2407-the chairman to anticipate what [Professor Summerlee]182-summerlee , who was [the spokesman of the committee]3371-the spokesman of the committee , had to say to [them]2633-the audience , but it was common rumor that [their]2633-the audience expedition had been crowned by extraordinary success . ' Applause . ' Apparently the age of romance was not dead , and there was common ground upon which the wildest imaginings of [the novelist]3372-the novelist could meet the actual scientific investigations of [the searcher for truth]3373-the searcher for truth . [He]2407-the chairman would only add , before [he]2407-the chairman sat down , that [he]2407-the chairman rejoiced - and all of [them]2633-the audience would rejoice - that [these gentlemen]3374-these gentlemen had returned safe and sound from [their]3374-these gentlemen difficult and dangerous task , for it can not be denied that any disaster to such an expedition would have inflicted a well - nigh irreparable loss to the cause of Zoological science . ' Great applause , in which [Professor Challenger]142-challenger was observed to join .[243-macdona]

" [Professor Summerlee]182-summerlee 's rising was the signal for another extraordinary outbreak of enthusiasm , which broke out again at intervals throughout [his]182-summerlee address . That address will not be given in extenso in these columns , for the reason that a full account of the whole adventures of the expedition is being published as a supplement from the pen of [[our]3375-our own special correspondent]3376-our own special correspondent . Some general indications will therefore suffice . Having described the genesis of [their]2633-the audience journey , and paid a handsome tribute to [[his]182-summerlee friend]3377-his friend [Professor Challenger]142-challenger , coupled with an apology for the incredulity with which [his]182-summerlee assertions , now fully vindicated , had been received , [he]182-summerlee gave the actual course of [their]2633-the audience journey , carefully withholding such information as would aid [the public]2627-the public in any attempt to locate [this remarkable plateau]3379-this remarkable plateau . Having described , in general terms , [their]2633-the audience course from [the main river]2521-the main river up to the time that [they]2633-the audience actually reached [the base of [the cliffs]1111-the cliffs]3381-the base of the cliffs , [he]182-summerlee enthralled [[his]182-summerlee hearers]3383-his hearers by [his]182-summerlee account of the difficulties encountered by [the expedition]3384-the expedition in [their]2633-the audience repeated attempts to mount [them]2633-the audience , and finally described how [they]2633-the audience succeeded in [their]2633-the audience desperate endeavors , which cost the lives of [[their]2633-the audience two devoted half - breed servants]3385-their two devoted half - breed servants . "[243-macdona] This amazing reading of the affair was the result of [Summerlee]182-summerlee 's endeavors to avoid raising any questionable matter at the meeting .

" Having conducted [[his]182-summerlee audience]3386-his audience in fancy to [the summit]2611-the summit , and marooned [them]3386-his audience there by reason of the fall of [[their]3386-his audience bridge]3388-their bridge , [the Professor]2374-the professor proceeded to describe both the horrors and the attractions of [that remarkable land]3390-that remarkable land . Of personal adventures [he]182-summerlee said little , but laid stress upon the rich harvest reaped by Science in the observations of the wonderful beast , bird , insect , and plant life of [the plateau]789-the plateau . Peculiarly rich in the coleoptera and in the lepidoptera , [forty - six new species of the one and ninety - four of the other]3392-forty - six new species of the one and ninety - four of the other had been secured in the course of a few weeks . It was , however , in the larger animals , and especially in the larger animals supposed to have been long extinct , that the interest of [the public]2627-the public was naturally centered . Of these [he]182-summerlee was able to give a goodly list , but had little doubt that it would be largely extended when [the place]927-the place had been more thoroughly investigated . [He]182-summerlee and [[his]182-summerlee companions]3395-his companions had seen at least a dozen creatures , most of [them]3396-them at a distance , which corresponded with nothing at present known to Science . These would in time be duly classified and examined . [He]182-summerlee instanced a snake , the cast skin of which , deep purple in color , was fifty - one feet in length , and mentioned a white creature , supposed to be mammalian , which gave forth well - marked phosphorescence in the darkness ; also a large black moth , the bite of which was supposed by [the Indians]236-the indians to be highly poisonous . Setting aside these entirely new forms of life , [the plateau]789-the plateau was very rich in known prehistoric forms , dating back in some cases to early Jurassic times . Among these [he]182-summerlee mentioned the gigantic and grotesque stegosaurus , seen once by [Mr. Malone]145-mr. malone at [a drinking - place by [the lake]2920-the lake]3398-a drinking - place by the lake , and drawn in the sketch - book of [that adventurous American who had first penetrated [this unknown world]3401-this unknown world]3400-that adventurous american who had first penetrated this unknown world . [He]182-summerlee described also the iguanodon and the pterodactyl - two of the first of the wonders which [they]3395-his companions had encountered . [He]182-summerlee then thrilled [the assembly]536-the assembly by some account of the terrible carnivorous dinosaurs , which had on more than one occasion pursued [members of the party]3403-members of the party , and which were the most formidable of all the creatures which [they]3395-his companions had encountered . Thence [he]182-summerlee passed to the huge and ferocious bird , the phororachus , and to the great elk which still roams upon [this upland]3404-this upland . It was not , however , until [he]182-summerlee sketched the mysteries of [the central lake]1460-the central lake that the full interest and enthusiasm of [the audience]2633-the audience were aroused . [One]2316-one had to pinch [oneself]2316-one to be sure that [one]2316-one was awake as [one]2316-one heard [this sane and practical Professor]3410-this sane and practical professor in cold measured tones describing the monstrous three - eyed fish - lizards and the huge water - snakes which inhabit this enchanted sheet of water . Next [he]182-summerlee touched upon [the Indians]236-the indians , and upon [the extraordinary colony of anthropoid apes , which might be looked upon as an advance upon the pithecanthropus of [Java]102-java]3411-the extraordinary colony of anthropoid apes , which might be looked upon as an advance upon the pithecanthropus of java , and as coming therefore nearer than any known form to that hypothetical creation , the missing link . Finally [he]182-summerlee described , amongst some merriment , the ingenious but highly dangerous aeronautic invention of [Professor Challenger]142-challenger , and wound up a most memorable address by an account of the methods by which [the committee]3412-the committee did at last find [their]3412-the committee way back to civilization .[243-macdona]

" It had been hoped that the proceedings would end there , and that a vote of thanks and congratulation , moved by [Professor Sergius]246-professor sergius , of [Upsala University]3413-upsala university , would be duly seconded and carried ; but it was soon evident that the course of events was not destined to flow so smoothly . Symptoms of opposition had been evident from time to time during the evening , and now [Dr. James Illingworth]206-dr. illingworth , of [Edinburgh]79-edinburgh , rose in the center of [the hall]379-the hall . [Dr. Illingworth]206-dr. illingworth asked whether an amendment should not be taken before a resolution .[243-macdona]

" [THE CHAIRMAN]2407-the chairman : ' Yes , [sir]2355-sir , if there must be an amendment . '[243-macdona]

" [Dr. Illingworth]206-dr. illingworth began [his]206-dr. illingworth remarks by expressing [his]206-dr. illingworth high appreciation of the scientific work both of [Professor Challenger]142-challenger and of [Professor Summerlee]182-summerlee . [He]206-dr. illingworth much regretted that any personal bias should have been read into [his]206-dr. illingworth remarks , which were entirely dictated by [his]206-dr. illingworth desire for scientific truth . [His]206-dr. illingworth position , in fact , was substantially the same as that taken up by [Professor Summerlee]182-summerlee at the last meeting . At that last meeting [Professor Challenger]142-challenger had made certain assertions which had been queried by [[his]142-challenger colleague]959-his colleague . Was this to constitute a final proof where the matters in question were of the most revolutionary and incredible character ? " It was at this point that the sensation of the evening arose - a sensation so dramatic that it can never have been paralleled in the history of scientific gatherings . [Professor Challenger]142-challenger raised [his]142-challenger hand in the air as a signal , and at once [[our]3469-our colleague]3053-our colleague , [Mr. E. D. Malone]145-mr. malone , was observed to rise and to make [his]3053-our colleague way to the back of the platform . An instant later [he]3053-our colleague re - appeared in company of [a gigantic negro]3482-a gigantic negro , the two of [them]3482-a gigantic negro bearing between [them]3482-a gigantic negro a large square packing - case . It was evidently of great weight , and was slowly carried forward and placed in front of [the Professor]2374-the professor 's chair . All sound had hushed in [the audience]2633-the audience and [everyone]2480-everyone was absorbed in the spectacle before [them]2633-the audience . [Professor Challenger]142-challenger drew off the top of the case , which formed a sliding lid . Peering down into the box [he]142-challenger snapped [his]142-challenger fingers several times and was heard from the Press seat to say , ' Come , then , pretty , pretty ! ' in a coaxing voice . An instant later , with a scratching , rattling sound , a most horrible and loathsome creature appeared from below and perched itself upon the side of the case . Even the unexpected fall of [the Duke of Durham into the orchestra]3486-the duke of durham into the orchestra , which occurred at this moment , could not distract the petrified attention of [the vast audience]3487-the vast audience . The face of the creature was like the wildest gargoyle that the imagination of [a mad medieval builder]3488-a mad medieval builder could have conceived . It was malicious , horrible , with two small red eyes as bright as points of burning coal . [Its]3482-a gigantic negro long , savage mouth , which was held half - open , was full of a double row of shark - like teeth . Its shoulders were humped , and round them were draped what appeared to be a faded gray shawl . It was the devil of [our]3469-our childhood in person . There was a turmoil in [the audience]2633-the audience - [someone]2531-someone screamed , [two ladies in the front row]3491-two ladies in the front row fell senseless from [their]3491-two ladies in the front row chairs , and there was a general movement upon the platform to follow [[their]3491-two ladies in the front row chairman]3492-their chairman into the orchestra . For a moment there was danger of a general panic . [Professor Challenger]142-challenger threw up [his]142-challenger hands to still the commotion , but the movement alarmed the creature beside [him]142-challenger . [Its]3482-a gigantic negro strange shawl suddenly unfurled , spread , and fluttered as a pair of leathery wings . [Its owner]3493-its owner grabbed at [its]3482-a gigantic negro legs , but too late to hold [it]3482-a gigantic negro . [It]3482-a gigantic negro had sprung from the perch and was circling slowly round [the Queen 's Hall]3494-the queen 's hall with a dry , leathery flapping of [its]3482-a gigantic negro ten - foot wings , while a putrid and insidious odor pervaded [the room]264-the room . The cries of [the people in the galleries , who were alarmed at the near approach of those glowing eyes and that murderous beak]3496-the people in the galleries , who were alarmed at the near approach of those glowing eyes and that murderous beak , excited [the creature]2986-the creature to a frenzy . Faster and faster it flew , beating against walls and chandeliers in a blind frenzy of alarm . ' The window ! For heaven 's sake shut that window ! ' roared [the Professor]2374-the professor from [the platform]460-the platform , dancing and wringing [his]2374-the professor hands in an agony of apprehension . Alas , [his]2374-the professor warning was too late ! In a moment the creature , beating and bumping along the wall like a huge moth within a gas - shade , came upon the opening , squeezed its hideous bulk through it , and was gone . [Professor Challenger]142-challenger fell back into [his]142-challenger chair with [his]142-challenger face buried in [his]142-challenger hands , while [the audience]2633-the audience gave one long , deep sigh of relief as [they]2633-the audience realized that the incident was over .[243-macdona]

" Then - oh ! how shall [one]2316-one describe what took place then - when the full exuberance of [the majority]3502-the majority and the full reaction of [the minority]3503-the minority united to make one great wave of enthusiasm , which rolled from the back of [the hall]379-the hall , gathering volume as it came , swept over [the orchestra]3505-the orchestra , submerged the platform , and carried [the four heroes]3506-the four heroes away upon its crest ? "[243-macdona] Good for [you]2254-you , [Mac]244-mac ! " If [the audience]2633-the audience had done less than justice , surely it made ample amends . [Every one]3508-every one was on [his]3508-every one feet . [Every one]3508-every one was moving , shouting , gesticulating . [A dense crowd of cheering men]3510-a dense crowd of cheering men were round [the four travelers]3511-the four travelers . ' Up with [them]3511-the four travelers ! up with [them]3511-the four travelers ! ' cried [a hundred voices]3512-a hundred voices . In a moment [four figures]3513-four figures shot up above [the crowd]526-the crowd . In vain [they]3513-four figures strove to break loose . [They]3513-four figures were held in [[their]3513-four figures lofty places of honor]3515-their lofty places of honor . It would have been hard to let [them]3513-four figures down if it had been wished , so dense was [the crowd around [them]3513-four figures]3516-the crowd around them . ' [Regent Street]39-regent street ! [Regent Street]39-regent street ! ' sounded [the voices]3517-the voices . There was a swirl in [the packed multitude]3518-the packed multitude , and a slow current , bearing the four upon [their]3513-four figures shoulders , made for the door . Out in [the street]353-the street the scene was extraordinary . An assemblage of [not less than a hundred thousand people]3520-not less than a hundred thousand people was waiting . [The close - packed throng]3521-the close - packed throng extended from the other side of [the Langham Hotel]121-the langham hotel to [Oxford Circus]122-oxford circus . A roar of acclamation greeted [the four adventurers]3522-the four adventurers as [they]3522-the four adventurers appeared , high above the heads of [the people]3523-the people , under the vivid electric lamps outside [the hall]379-the hall . ' A procession ! A procession ! ' was the cry . In a dense phalanx , blocking [the streets]3525-the streets from side to side , [the crowd]526-the crowd set forth , taking the route of [Regent Street]39-regent street , [Pall Mall]123-pall mall , [St. James 's Street]77-st. james 's street , and [Piccadilly]124-piccadilly . [The whole central traffic of [London]22-london]3527-the whole central traffic of london was held up , and many collisions were reported between [the demonstrators]3528-the demonstrators upon the one side and [the police]3529-the police and [taxi - cabmen upon the other]3530-taxi - cabmen upon the other . ' So ended one of the most remarkable evenings that [London]22-london has seen for a considerable time . "[244-mac]

So far [[my]0-i friend]319-my friend [Macdona]243-macdona ; and it may be taken as a fairly accurate , if florid , account of the proceedings . As to the main incident , it was a bewildering surprise to [the audience]2633-the audience , but not , [I]0-i need hardly say , to [us]2257-we . [The reader]285-the reader will remember how [I]0-i met [Lord John Roxton]181-lord john upon the very occasion when , in [his]181-lord john protective crinoline , [he]181-lord john had gone to bring the " Devil 's chick "[181-lord john] as [he]181-lord john called it , for [Professor Challenger]142-challenger . [I]0-i have hinted also at the trouble which [the Professor]2374-the professor 's baggage gave [us]2257-we when [we]2257-we left [the plateau]789-the plateau , and had [I]0-i described [our]2257-we voyage [I]0-i might have said a good deal of the worry [we]2257-we had to coax with putrid fish the appetite of [[our]2257-we filthy companion]2261-our filthy companion . If [I]0-i have not said much about it before , it was , of course , that [the Professor]2374-the professor 's earnest desire was that no possible rumor of the unanswerable argument which [we]2257-we carried should be allowed to leak out until the moment came when [[his]2374-the professor enemies]1432-his enemies were to be confuted .

One word as to the fate of the [London]22-london pterodactyl . Nothing can be said to be certain upon this point . There is the evidence of [two frightened women]2264-two frightened women that it perched upon the roof of [the Queen 's Hall]3494-the queen 's hall and remained there like a diabolical statue for some hours . The next day it came out in the evening papers that [Private Miles]252-private miles , of [the Coldstream Guards]2266-the coldstream guards , on duty outside [Marlborough House]125-marlborough house , had deserted [his]252-private miles post without leave , and was therefore courtmartialed . [Private Miles]252-private miles ' account , that [he]252-private miles dropped [his]252-private miles rifle and took to [his]252-private miles heels down [the Mall]2267-the mall because on looking up [he]252-private miles had suddenly seen the devil between [him]252-private miles and the moon , was not accepted by [the Court]2268-the court , and yet it may have a direct bearing upon the point at issue . The only other evidence which [I]0-i can adduce is from the log of [the SS]2269-the ss . [Friesland]126-friesland , [a Dutch - American liner]2270-a dutch - american liner , which asserts that at nine next morning , [Start Point]127-start point being at the time ten miles upon [their]2271-their starboard quarter , [they]2271-their were passed by something between a flying goat and a monstrous bat , which was heading at a prodigious pace [south and west]2272-south and west . If its homing instinct led [it]2273-it upon the right line , there can be no doubt that somewhere out in [the wastes of [the Atlantic]57-the atlantic]2274-the wastes of the atlantic [the last European pterodactyl]2275-the last european pterodactyl found its end .

And [Gladys]134-gladys - oh , [[my]0-i [Gladys]134-gladys]292-my gladys ! - Gladys of [the mystic lake]2277-the mystic lake , now to be re - named the Central , for never shall [she]134-gladys have immortality through [me]0-i . Did [I]0-i not always see some hard fiber in [her]134-gladys nature ?
